[CHAPTER XIX . EUNICE]79-chapter xix . eunice 'S DIARY . When [people]673-people are interested in some event that is coming , do [they]673-people find the dull days , passed in waiting for it , days which [they]673-people are not able to remember when [they]673-people look back ? This is [my]1122-dearest euneece unfortunate case . Night after night , [I]1122-dearest euneece have gone to bed without so much as opening [my]1122-dearest euneece Journal . There was nothing worth writing about , nothing that [I]1122-dearest euneece could recollect , until [the postman]4329-the postman came to - day . [I]1122-dearest euneece ran [downstairs]4170-downstairs , when [I]1122-dearest euneece heard [his]4329-the postman ring at the bell , and stopped [Maria]64-maria on [her]64-maria way to [the study]4243-the study . "[0-i] [I]0-i quote the passages in [Philip]47-philip 's letter which most deeply interested [me]0-i - [I]0-i am [[his]47-philip dear miss]1125-his dear miss ; and [he]47-philip is [mine]0-i ever truly . At the end was a delightful announcement that [he]47-philip was coming to [me]0-i by [the afternoon train]1126-the afternoon train . [I]0-i ran [upstairs]3864-upstairs to see how [I]0-i looked in the glass . [My]0-i first feeling was regret . For the thousandth time , [I]0-i was obliged to acknowledge that [I]0-i was not as pretty as [Helena]52-helena . But this passed off . A cheering reflection occurred to [me]0-i . [Philip]47-philip would not have found , in [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister 's face , what seems to have interested [him]47-philip in [my]0-i face . Besides , there is [my]0-i figure . The pity of it is that [I]0-i am so ignorant about some things . However , [my]0-i mind was quite unexpectedly set at ease on the subject of [my]0-i figure . The manner in which it happened was so amusing - at least , so amusing to [me]0-i - that [I]0-i can not resist mentioning it . [[My]0-i sister]596-my sister and [I]0-i are forbidden to read newspapers , as well as novels . " In [her]4335-the mayor address to [the magistrates]4333-the magistrates , [the Mayoress]4337-the mayoress stated that [she]4335-the mayor had seen a disgusting photograph in the shop window of [a stationer , lately established in [the town]205-the town]4338-a stationer , lately established in the town . "[0-i] - On second thoughts , [I]0-i prefer going back to [my]0-i own writing again ; it is so uninteresting to copy [other people]683-other people 's writing . For [my]0-i own part , gratitude to [Venus]83-venus obliges [me]0-i to own that [she]83-venus effected a great improvement in the state of [my]0-i mind . [She]83-venus encouraged [me]0-i . "[64-maria] Instead of finishing what [she]64-maria had to say , [she]64-maria looked at [me]0-i with a sly smile . [I]0-i looked at [her]64-maria with a sly smile . [We]1167-we were certainly [a couple of fools]1168-a couple of fools . But , dear [me]0-i , how happy sometimes [a fool]767-a fool can be ! [My]0-i enjoyment of that delightful time was checked when [I]0-i went into [the drawing - room]4218-the drawing - room . [I]0-i had expected to see [papa]3927-papa 's face made beautiful by [his]3927-papa winning smile . At the same time , [I]0-i saw nothing to make [me]0-i conclude that [Philip]47-philip had produced an unfavorable impression . The truth is , [we]1167-we were all three on [our]1167-we best behavior , and [we]1167-we showed it . [Philip]47-philip had brought with [him]47-philip a letter from [Mrs. Staveley]59-mrs. staveley , introducing [him]47-philip to [papa]3927-papa . [We]1167-we spoke of [the Staveleys]54-the staveleys , of the weather , of [the Cathedral]863-the cathedral - and then there seemed to be nothing more left to talk about . In the silence that followed - what a dreadful thing silence is ! - [papa]3927-papa was sent for to see [somebody who had called on business]1175-somebody who had called on business . [He]3927-papa made [his]3927-papa excuses in the sweetest manner , but still seriously . When [he]3927-papa and [Philip]47-philip had shaken hands , would [he]3927-papa leave [us]1167-we together ? No ; [he]3927-papa waited . [Poor Philip]47-philip had no choice but to take leave of [me]0-i . [Papa]58-papa then went out by the door that led into [[his]58-papa study]910-his study , and [I]0-i was left alone . Can any words say how wretched [I]0-i felt ? [I]0-i had hoped so much from that first meeting - and where were [my]0-i hopes now ? " Hundreds of times , [miss]4033-miss . "[0-i] Was it wrong for [me]0-i to go to [Philip]47-philip , in [the garden]637-the garden ? Oh , there is no end to objections ! And how rashly [he]47-philip had placed [himself]47-philip just where [he]47-philip could be seen from the back windows ! "[1190-he] [His]1190-he lips touched [my]0-i lips , pressed them , dwelt on them - oh , how can [I]0-i tell of it ! Some new enchantment of feeling ran deliciously through and through [me]0-i . There was no need for it ; [my]0-i thoughts and [his]1190-he thoughts were one - [he]1190-he knew that [I]0-i was quite overcome ; [he]1190-he saw that [he]1190-he must leave [me]0-i to recover [myself]0-i alone . [EUNICE]53-eunice 'S DIARY . How long a time passed before [my]0-i composure came back to [me]0-i , [I]0-i can not remember now . It seemed as if [I]0-i was waiting through some interval of [my]0-i life that was a mystery to [myself]0-i . [I]0-i was content to wait , and feel the light evening air in [the garden]637-the garden wafting happiness over [me]0-i . And all this had come from a kiss ! [I]0-i can call the time to mind when [I]0-i used to wonder why [people]673-people made such a fuss about kissing . [I]0-i had been indebted to [Maria]64-maria for [my]0-i first taste of Paradise . [I]0-i was recalled by [Maria]64-maria to [the world that [I]0-i had been accustomed to live in]1200-the world that i had been accustomed to live in ; [the world that was beginning to fade away in [my]0-i memory]1201-the world that was beginning to fade away in my memory already . CHAPTER XXI . [HELENA]52-helena 'S DIARY . The day of [my]0-i return marks an occasion which [I]0-i am not likely to forget . Hours have passed since [I]0-i came [home]258-home - and [my]0-i agitation still forbids the thought of repose . As [I]0-i sit at [my]0-i desk [I]0-i see [Eunice]53-eunice in bed , sleeping peacefully , except when [she]53-eunice is murmuring enjoyment in some happy dream . To what end has [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister been advancing blindfold , and who knows ? dragging [me]0-i with [her]596-my sister , since that disastrous visit to [[our]1237-our friends]669-our friends in [London]3-london ? Strange that there should be a leaven of superstition in [my]0-i nature ! Strange that [I]0-i should feel fear of something - [I]0-i hardly know what ! [I]0-i have met somewhere perhaps in [my]0-i historical reading with the expression : " A chain of events . "[0-i] Was [I]0-i at the beginning of that chain , when [I]0-i entered [the railway carriage]1239-the railway carriage on [my]0-i journey [home]258-home ? Among [the other passengers]1241-the other passengers there was [a young gentleman , accompanied by a lady who proved to be [[his]1242-a young gentleman , accompanied by a lady who proved to be his sister sister]3873-his sister]1242-a young gentleman , accompanied by a lady who proved to be his sister . [They]1244-they were [both well - bred people]1245-both well - bred people . [The brother]1246-the brother evidently admired [me]0-i , and did [his]1246-the brother best to make [himself]1246-the brother agreeable . Time passed quickly in pleasant talk , and [my]0-i vanity was flattered - and that was all . [[My]0-i fellow - travelers]1247-my fellow - travelers were going on to [London]3-london . "[87-mrs. t.] When [I]0-i asked what this meant in English , [I]0-i was told , " Medical Rubber , "[0-i] and that the fame of [Mrs. T.]87-mrs. t. [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall looked shocked at [my]0-i stupidity . [She]66-miss jillgall reminded [me]0-i that there was a mystery in [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen 's letter and a mystery in [papa]3927-papa 's strange conduct toward [Philip]47-philip . " Put two and two together , [darling]4451-darling , "[66-miss jillgall] [she]66-miss jillgall said ; " and , one of these days , [they]4452-they may make four . "[66-miss jillgall] If this meant anything , it meant that the reason which made [papa]58-papa keep [Helena]52-helena 's age and [my]0-i age unknown to [everybody]3957-everybody but [himself]58-papa , was also the reason why [he]58-papa seemed to be so strangely unwilling to let [me]0-i be [[Philip]47-philip 's wife]1328-philip 's wife . [I]0-i really could not endure to take such a view of it as that , and begged [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall to drop the subject . [She]66-miss jillgall was as kind as ever . "[66-miss jillgall] CHAPTER XXIII . [EUNICE]53-eunice 'S DIARY . Only two days now , before [we]1329-we give [our]1329-we little dinner - party , and [Philip]47-philip finds [his]47-philip opportunity of speaking to [papa]3927-papa . Oh , how [I]0-i wish that day had come and gone ! [I]0-i try not to take gloomy views of things ; but [I]0-i am not quite so happy as [I]0-i had expected to be when [[my]0-i dear]3949-my dear was in [the same town]1332-the same town with [me]0-i . If papa had encouraged [him]3927-papa to call again , [we]1329-we might have had some precious time to [ourselves]1329-we . As it is , [we]1329-we can only meet in the different show - places in [the town]205-the town - with [Helena]52-helena on one side , and [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall on the other , to take care of [us]1329-we . [I]0-i do call it cruel not to let [two young people]1334-two young people love [each other]3725-each other , without setting [third persons]1336-third persons to watch [them]1334-two young people . If [I]0-i was [Queen of [England]4-england]1337-queen of england , [I]0-i would have pretty private bowers made for [lovers]1338-lovers , in the summer , and [nice warm little rooms to hold two]1339-nice warm little rooms to hold two , in the winter . Why not ? What harm could come of it , [I]0-i should like to know ? [The cathedral]863-the cathedral is the place of meeting which [we]1329-we find most convenient , under the circumstances . There are delightful nooks and corners about [this celebrated building in which [lovers]1338-lovers can lag behind]1341-this celebrated building in which lovers can lag behind . If [we]1329-we had been in [[papa]3927-papa 's chapel]867-papa 's chapel [I]0-i should have hesitated to turn [it]867-papa 's chapel to such a profane use as this ; [the cathedral]863-the cathedral does n't so much matter . Shall [I]0-i own that [I]0-i felt [my]0-i inferiority to [Helena]52-helena a little keenly ? [She]52-helena could tell [Philip]47-philip so many things that [I]0-i should have liked to tell [him]47-philip first . [[My]0-i clever sister]790-my clever sister taught [him]47-philip how to pronounce the name of [the bishop who began building [the cathedral]863-the cathedral]1347-the bishop who began building the cathedral ; [she]790-my clever sister led [him]47-philip over [the crypt]1349-the crypt , and told [him]47-philip how old [it]1349-the crypt was . [He]47-philip was interested in [the crypt]1349-the crypt ; [he]47-philip talked to [Helena]52-helena not to [me]0-i of [his]47-philip ambition to write a work on cathedral architecture in [England]4-england ; [he]47-philip made a rough little sketch in [his]47-philip book of [[our]1351-our famous tomb of [some king]1353-some king]1352-our famous tomb of some king . [Helena]52-helena knew [the late royal personage]1354-the late royal personage 's name , and [Philip]47-philip showed [his]47-philip sketch to [her]52-helena before [he]47-philip showed it to [me]0-i . [Helena]52-helena might have whispered it to [me]0-i , [I]0-i think . [She]52-helena remembered it , not [I]0-i - and mentioned it to [Philip]47-philip , of course . [I]0-i kept close by [him]47-philip all the time , and now and then [he]47-philip gave [me]0-i a look which raised [my]0-i spirits . [He]47-philip might have given [me]0-i something better than that - [I]0-i mean a kiss - when [we]1355-us had left [the cathedral]863-the cathedral , and were by [ourselves]1355-us for a moment in a corner of [[the Dean]1357-the dean 's garden]1358-the dean 's garden . However , [I]0-i am far from thinking the worse of [Philip]47-philip . [I]0-i gave [his]47-philip arm a little squeeze - and that was better than nothing . ....... [He]47-philip and [I]0-i took a walk along [the bank of [the river]1361-the river]1360-the bank of the river to - day ; [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister and [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall looking after [us]1355-us as usual . " What [a boy]4076-a boy [you]47-philip are ! "[52-helena] [Helena]52-helena said , enjoying [his]47-philip delightful hilarity as [I]0-i did . CHAPTER XXIV . [EUNICE]53-eunice 'S DIARY . On entering [the schoolroom]1381-the schoolroom [we]1379-our lost [our]1379-our gayety , all in a moment . Something unpleasant had evidently happened . [Two of [the eldest girls]1383-the eldest girls]1382-two of the eldest girls were sitting together in a corner , separated from the rest , and looking most wickedly sulky . [The teachers]1384-the teachers were at the other end of [the room]3541-the room , appearing to be ill at ease . And there , standing in the midst of [them]1384-the teachers , with [his]47-philip face flushed and [his]47-philip eyes angry - there was [papa]3927-papa , sadly unlike [his]47-philip gentle self in the days of [his]47-philip health and happiness . On former occasions , when the exercise of [his]47-philip authority was required in [the school]1387-the school , [his]47-philip forbearing temper always set things right . When [I]0-i saw [him]47-philip now , [I]0-i thought of what [the doctor]162-the doctor had said of [his]47-philip health , on [my]0-i way [home]258-home from [the station]1220-the station . "[58-papa] Then [he]58-papa spoke to [Helena]52-helena and to [me]0-i , still excited , still not like [himself]58-papa : " [You]0-i could n't have come here , [[my]58-papa dears]611-my dears , at a time when [your]0-i presence was more urgently needed . "[58-papa] [We]1393-we now heard that [the two girls in disgrace]1394-the two girls in disgrace had broken the rules , and in such a manner as to deserve severe punishment . [One of [them]1394-the two girls in disgrace]1076-one of them had been discovered hiding a novel in [her]1076-one of them desk . "[1394-the two girls in disgrace] All this time [I]0-i had been asking [myself]0-i what [papa]3927-papa meant , when [he]3927-papa told [us]1401-we [we]1401-we could not have come to [the schoolroom]1381-the schoolroom at a better time . But [he]3927-papa had not done yet . [He]3927-papa turned to [Helena]52-helena . " Answer some of the questions , "[3927-papa] [he]3927-papa went on , " from [my]3927-papa Manual of Christian Obligation , which [the girls]1062-the girls call [my]3927-papa catechism . "[3927-papa] [He]3927-papa asked one of the questions : " If [you]0-i are told to do unto [others]3603-others as [you]0-i would [they]3603-others should do unto [you]0-i , and if [you]0-i find a difficulty in obeying that Divine Precept , what does [your]0-i duty require ? "[3927-papa] It is [my]0-i belief that [Helena]52-helena has the materials in [her]52-helena for making another Joan of Arc . "[52-helena] " And if these fail ? "[58-papa] " Then [I]58-papa am to remember that [[my]58-papa pastor]4477-my pastor is [[my]58-papa friend]3475-my friend . [He]4477-my pastor claims no priestly authority or priestly infallibility . [He]4477-my pastor is [my]58-papa fellow - Christian who loves [me]58-papa . [He]4477-my pastor will tell [me]58-papa how [he]4477-my pastor has [himself]4477-my pastor failed ; how [he]4477-my pastor has struggled against [himself]4477-my pastor ; and what a blessed reward has followed [his]4477-my pastor victory - a purified heart , a peaceful mind . "[58-papa] Then [papa]58-papa released [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister , after [she]596-my sister had only repeated two out of all the answers in Christian Obligation , which [we]1406-we first began to learn when [we]1406-we were [children]283-children . [He]58-papa then addressed [himself]58-papa again to [the girls]1062-the girls . " Is what [you]1062-the girls have just heard a part of [my]58-papa catechism ? Has [[my]58-papa daughter]249-my daughter been excused from repeating it because [she]249-my daughter is [a young lady]3958-a young lady ? Where is the difference between the religious education which is given to [[my]58-papa own child]1116-my own child , and that given to [you]1062-the girls ? "[58-papa] [The wretched girls]1409-the wretched girls still sat silent and obstinate , with [their]1409-the wretched girls heads down . [I]0-i tremble again as [I]0-i write of what happened next . [Papa]58-papa fixed [his]58-papa eyes on [me]0-i . [He]58-papa said , out loud : " Eunice ! "[58-papa] - and waited for [me]0-i to rise and answer , as [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister had done . It was entirely beyond [my]0-i power to get on [my]0-i feet . [Philip]47-philip had innocently , [I]0-i am sure discouraged [me]0-i ; [I]0-i saw displeasure , [I]0-i saw contempt in [his]47-philip face . There was a dead silence in [the room]3541-the room . [Everybody]3957-everybody looked at [me]0-i . [My]0-i heart beat furiously , [my]0-i hands turned cold , the questions and answers in Christian Obligation all left [my]0-i memory together . [I]0-i looked imploringly at [papa]58-papa . For the first time in [his]47-philip life , [he]47-philip was hard on [me]0-i . [His]47-philip eyes were as angry as ever ; they showed [me]0-i no mercy . Oh , what had come to [me]0-i ? what evil spirit possessed [me]0-i ? [I]0-i felt resentment ; horrid , undutiful resentment , at being treated in this cruel way . [My]0-i fists clinched themselves in [my]0-i lap , [my]0-i face felt as hot as fire . Instead of asking [[my]0-i father]615-my father to excuse [me]0-i , [I]0-i said : " [I]0-i ca n't do it . "[0-i] [He]615-my father was astounded , as well [he]615-my father might be . [I]0-i went on from bad to worse . [I]0-i said : " [I]0-i wo n't do it . "[0-i] [He]47-philip stooped over [me]0-i ; [he]47-philip whispered : " [I]47-philip am going to ask [you]0-i something ; [I]47-philip insist on [your]0-i answering , Yes or No . "[47-philip] [He]47-philip raised [his]47-philip voice , and drew [himself]47-philip back so that [they]1414-they could all see [me]0-i . " Have [you]0-i been taught like [[your]0-i sister]3944-your sister ? "[47-philip] [he]47-philip asked . " Has the catechism that has been [her]3944-your sister religious lesson , for all [her]3944-your sister life , been [your]0-i religious lesson , for all [your]0-i life , too ? "[47-philip] [I]0-i said : " Yes "[0-i] - and [I]0-i was in such a rage that [I]0-i said it out loud . If [Philip]47-philip had handed [me]0-i [his]47-philip cane , and had advised [me]0-i to give [the young hussies who were answerable for this dreadful state of things a good beating]1415-the young hussies who were answerable for this dreadful state of things a good beating , [I]0-i believe [I]0-i should have done it . [Papa]58-papa turned [his]58-papa back on [me]0-i and offered [the girls]1062-the girls a last chance : " Do [you]1062-the girls feel sorry for what [you]1062-the girls have done ? Do [you]1062-the girls ask to be forgiven ? "[58-papa] Neither [the one]1060-the one nor [the other]432-the other answered [him]58-papa . [He]58-papa called across [the room]3541-the room to [the teachers]1384-the teachers : " [Those two pupils]4483-those two pupils are expelled [the school]1387-the school . "[58-papa] [Both the women]1421-both the women looked horrified . [The elder of the two]4220-the elder of the two approached [him]58-papa , and tried to plead for a milder sentence . [He]4220-the elder of the two answered in one stern word : " Silence ! "[4220-the elder of the two] - and left [the schoolroom]1381-the schoolroom , without even a passing bow to [Philip]47-philip . And this , after [he]4220-the elder of the two had cordially shaken hands with [[my]0-i poor dear]4461-my poor dear , not half an hour before . [I]0-i ought to have made affectionate allowance for [his]4220-the elder of the two nervous miseries ; [I]0-i ought to have run after [him]4220-the elder of the two , and begged [his]4220-the elder of the two pardon . There must be something wrong , [I]0-i am afraid , in [girls]602-girls loving anybody but [[their]602-girls fathers]1426-their fathers . When [Helena]52-helena led the way out by another door , [I]0-i ran after [Philip]47-philip ; and [I]0-i asked [him]47-philip to forgive [me]0-i . [I]0-i do n't know what [I]0-i said ; it was all confusion . The fear of having forfeited [his]47-philip fondness must , [I]0-i suppose , have shaken [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i remember entreating [Helena]52-helena to say a kind word for [me]0-i . [She]52-helena was so clever , [she]52-helena had behaved so well , [she]52-helena had deserved that [Philip]47-philip should listen to [her]52-helena . " Oh , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried out to [him]47-philip desperately , " what must [you]47-philip think of [me]0-i ? "[47-philip] [Helena]52-helena seemed to be hardly as much interested in this happy ending of [my]0-i anxieties as [I]0-i might have anticipated . [She]52-helena walked on by [herself]52-helena . Perhaps [she]52-helena was thinking of [poor papa]1427-poor papa 's strange outbreak of excitement , and grieving over it . [We]1428-we had only a little way to walk , before [we]1428-we passed the door of [[Philip]47-philip 's hotel]1429-philip 's hotel . [He]47-philip had not yet received the expected letter from [[his]47-philip father]3972-his father - the cruel letter which might recall [him]47-philip to [Ireland]7-ireland . [She]52-helena was as kind again as ever ; [she]52-helena consented to wait with [me]0-i for [Philip]47-philip , at the door . " From [[my]47-philip father]615-my father , at last , "[47-philip] [he]47-philip said - and gave [me]0-i the letter to read . [I]0-i may be [Mrs. Philip Dunboyne]91-philip before the year is out . CHAPTER XXV . [HELENA]52-helena 'S DIARY . [They]1434-they all notice at [home]258-home that [I]0-i am looking worn and haggard . "[1436-that hideous old maid] [Poor deluded Eunice]53-eunice showed [her]53-eunice sisterly sympathy : " Do n't joke about it , [Selina]96-selina : ca n't [you]96-selina see that [Helena]52-helena is ill ? "[53-eunice] [I]0-i have been ill ; ill of [my]0-i own wickedness . But the recovery to [my]0-i tranquillity will bring with it the recovery of [my]0-i good looks . [My]0-i fatal passion for [Philip]47-philip promises to be the utter destruction of everything that is good in [me]0-i . Well ! what is good in [me]0-i may not be worth keeping . There is a fate in these things . If [I]0-i am destined to rob [Eunice]53-eunice of the one dear object of [her]53-eunice love and hope - how can [I]0-i resist ? The one kind thing [I]0-i can do is to keep [her]53-eunice in ignorance of what is coming , by acts of affectionate deceit . Besides , if [she]53-eunice suffers , [I]0-i suffer too . In [the length and breadth of [England]4-england]1438-the length and breadth of england , [I]0-i doubt if there is [a much more wicked young woman]1439-a much more wicked young woman to be found than [myself]0-i . Is it nothing to feel that , and to endure it as [I]0-i do ? Upon [my]0-i word , there is no excuse for [me]0-i ! Is this sheer impudence ? No ; it is the bent of [my]0-i nature . [I]0-i have a tendency to self - examination , accompanied by one merit - [I]0-i do n't spare [myself]0-i . There are excuses for [Eunice]53-eunice . [She]53-eunice lives in [a fools ' paradise]1440-a fools ' paradise ; and [she]53-eunice sees in [[her]53-eunice lover]1441-her lover a radiant creature , shining in the halo thrown over [him]1441-her lover by [her]53-eunice own self - delusion , Nothing of this sort is to be said for [me]0-i . [I]0-i see [Philip]47-philip as [he]47-philip is . [My]0-i penetration looks into the lowest depths of [his]47-philip character - when [I]0-i am not in [his]47-philip company . There seems to be a foundation of good , somewhere in [his]47-philip nature . [He]47-philip despises and hates [himself]47-philip [he]47-philip has confessed it to [me]0-i , when [Eunice]53-eunice is with [him]47-philip - still believing in [her]53-eunice false sweetheart . But how long do these better influences last ? [I]0-i have only to show [myself]0-i , in [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister 's absence , and [Philip]47-philip is [mine]0-i body and soul . [His]47-philip vanity and [his]47-philip weakness take possession of [him]47-philip the moment [he]47-philip sees [my]0-i face . [He]47-philip is [one of [those men]1444-those men]1443-one of those men - even in [my]0-i little experience [I]0-i have met with [them]1444-those men - who are born to be led by [women]195-women . If [Eunice]53-eunice had possessed [my]0-i strength of character , [he]47-philip would have been true to [her]53-eunice for life . Ought [I]0-i not , in justice to [myself]0-i , to have lifted [my]0-i heart high above the reach of [such a creature as this]1446-such a creature as this ? Certainly [I]0-i ought ! [I]0-i know it , [I]0-i feel it . And yet , there is some fascination in having [him]47-philip which [I]0-i am absolutely unable to resist . What , [I]0-i ask [myself]0-i , has fed the new flame which is burning in [me]0-i ? Did it begin with gratified pride ? [I]0-i might well feel proud when [I]0-i found [myself]0-i admired by [a man of [his]47-philip beauty , set off by such manners and such accomplishments as [his]47-philip]1447-a man of his beauty , set off by such manners and such accomplishments as his . Or , has the growth of this masterful feeling been encouraged by the envy and jealousy stirred in [me]0-i , when [I]0-i found [Eunice]53-eunice [[my]0-i inferior]1448-my inferior in every respect distinguished by the devotion of [a handsome lover]1449-a handsome lover , and having a brilliant marriage in view - while [I]0-i was left neglected , with no prospect of changing [my]0-i title from [Miss]1450-miss to [Mrs.]1451-mrs. ? Vain inquiries ! [My]0-i wicked heart seems to have secrets of its own , and to keep them a mystery to [me]0-i . What has become of [my]0-i excellent education ? [I]0-i do n't care to inquire ; [I]0-i have got beyond the reach of good books and religious examples . Among [my]0-i other blamable actions there may now be reckoned disobedience to [[my]0-i father]615-my father . [I]0-i have been reading novels in secret . At first [I]0-i tried some of the famous English works , published at a price within the reach of small purses . Very well written , no doubt - but with one unpardonable drawback , so far as [I]0-i am concerned . [[Our]1453-our celebrated native authors]1454-our celebrated native authors address [themselves]1454-our celebrated native authors to [good people]1455-good people , or to [penitent people who want to be made good]1456-penitent people who want to be made good ; not to [wicked readers like [me]0-i]1457-wicked readers like me . Arriving at this conclusion , [I]0-i tried another experiment . In [a small bookseller 's shop]1458-a small bookseller 's shop [I]0-i discovered some cheap translations of French novels . Here , [I]0-i found what [I]0-i wanted - sympathy with sin . [Here]225-here , there was opened to [me]0-i [a new world inhabited entirely by [unrepentant people]1461-unrepentant people]1460-a new world inhabited entirely by unrepentant people ; [the magnificent women diabolically beautiful]1462-the magnificent women diabolically beautiful ; [the satanic men dead to every sense of virtue]1463-the satanic men dead to every sense of virtue , and alive - perhaps rather dirtily alive - to the splendid fascinations of crime . [I]0-i know now that Love is above everything but itself . Love is the one law that [we]1453-our are bound to obey . How deep ! how consoling ! how admirably true ! [The novelists of [England]4-england]1464-the novelists of england have reason indeed to hide [their]1464-the novelists of england heads before [the novelists of [France]16-france]1465-the novelists of france . All that [I]0-i have felt , and have written here , is inspired by [these wonderful authors]1466-these wonderful authors . [I]0-i have relieved [my]0-i mind , and may now return to the business of [my]0-i diary - the record of domestic events . An overwhelming disappointment has fallen on [Eunice]53-eunice . [Our]1453-our dinner - party has been put off . The state of [father]3936-father 's health is answerable for this change in [our]1453-our arrangements . That wretched scene at [the school]1387-the school , complicated by [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister 's undutiful behavior at the time , so seriously excited [him]3936-father that [he]3936-father passed a sleepless night , and kept [[his]3936-father bedroom]1470-his bedroom throughout the day . [Eunice]53-eunice 's total want of discretion added , no doubt , to [his]3936-father sufferings : [she]53-eunice rudely intruded on [him]3936-father to express [her]53-eunice regret and to ask [his]3936-father pardon . Having carried [her]53-eunice point , [she]53-eunice was at leisure to come to [me]0-i , and to ask how amazingly simple of [her]53-eunice ! what [she]53-eunice and [Philip]47-philip were to do next . " [We]4497-we had arranged it all so nicely , "[830-the poor wretch] [the poor wretch]830-the poor wretch began . " [Philip]47-philip was to have been so clever and agreeable at dinner , and was to have chosen [his]47-philip time so very discreetly , that [papa]3927-papa would have been ready to listen to anything [he]47-philip said . Oh , [we]4497-we should have succeeded ; [I]830-the poor wretch have n't a doubt of it ! [Our]4497-we only hope , [Helena]52-helena , is in [you]52-helena . What are [we]4497-we to do now ? "[830-the poor wretch] " Wait , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " Wait ? "[53-eunice] [she]53-eunice repeated , hotly . " Is [my]53-eunice heart to be broken ? and , what is more cruel still , is [Philip]47-philip to be disappointed ? [I]53-eunice expected something more sensible , [[my]53-eunice dear]3949-my dear , from [you]52-helena . What possible reason can there be for waiting ? "[53-eunice] The reason - if [I]0-i could only have mentioned it - was beyond dispute . [I]0-i wanted time to quiet [Philip]47-philip 's uneasy conscience , and to harden [his]47-philip weak mind against outbursts of violence , on [Eunice]53-eunice 's part , which would certainly exhibit themselves when [she]53-eunice found that [she]53-eunice had lost [[her]53-eunice lover]1441-her lover , and lost [him]47-philip to [me]0-i . [I]0-i reminded [her]53-eunice of the irritable condition of [[our]1473-our father]595-our father 's nerves , and gave it as [my]0-i opinion that [he]47-philip would certainly say No , if [she]53-eunice was unwise enough to excite [him]47-philip on the subject of [Philip]47-philip , in [his]47-philip present frame of mind . These unanswerable considerations seemed to produce the right effect on [her]53-eunice . " [I]53-eunice suppose [you]0-i know best , "[53-eunice] was all [she]53-eunice said . And then [she]53-eunice left [me]0-i . [I]0-i let [her]53-eunice go without feeling any distrust of this act of submission on [her]53-eunice part ; it was such a common experience , in [my]0-i life , to find [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister guiding [herself]596-my sister by [my]0-i advice . But experience is not always to be trusted . Events soon showed that [I]0-i had failed to estimate [Eunice]53-eunice 's resources of obstinacy and cunning at their true value . Half an hour later [I]0-i heard the street door closed , and looked out of the window . [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall was leaving [the house]314-the house ; [no one]455-no one was with [her]66-miss jillgall . CHAPTER XXVI . [HELENA 'S DIARY]93-helena . The event of to - day began with the delivery of a message summoning [me]0-i to [[[my]0-i father]615-my father 's study]634-my father 's study . Why had [he]47-philip now called personally ? Noticing that [father]3936-father seemed to be annoyed , [I]0-i tried to make an opportunity of receiving [Philip]47-philip [myself]0-i . [He]47-philip was too well - bred to allow any visible signs of embarrassment to escape [him]47-philip . But when [he]47-philip shook hands with [me]0-i , [I]0-i felt a little trembling in [his]47-philip fingers , through the delicate gloves which fitted [him]47-philip like a second skin . Was it the true object of [his]47-philip visit to try the experiment designed by [Eunice]53-eunice and [himself]47-philip , and deferred by the postponement of [our]1491-our dinner - party ? Impossible surely that [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister could have practiced on [his]47-philip weakness , and persuaded [him]47-philip to return to [[his]47-philip first love]1493-his first love ! "[47-philip] [Philip]47-philip 's voice suddenly became an angry voice . " Once for all , [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu , "[47-philip] [he]47-philip said , " will [you]63-mr. gracedieu let [me]47-philip speak ? It 's about [[your]63-mr. gracedieu daughter]4519-your daughter - "[47-philip] " No more of it , [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip ! "[615-my father] [[My]0-i father]615-my father was now as loud as [Philip]47-philip . " [I]615-my father do n't desire to hold a private conversation with [you]63-mr. gracedieu on the subject of [[my]615-my father daughter]249-my daughter . "[615-my father] " If [you]47-philip have any personal objection to [me]615-my father , [sir]3443-sir , be so good as to state it plainly . "[615-my father] " [You]47-philip have no right to ask [me]615-my father to do that . "[615-my father] " [You]47-philip refuse to do it ? "[615-my father] " Positively . "[615-my father] " [You]47-philip are not very civil , [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu . "[615-my father] " If [I]47-philip speak without ceremony , [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip , [you]47-philip have [yourself]47-philip to thank for it . "[47-philip] [Philip]47-philip replied to this in a tone of savage irony . " [You]47-philip are [a minister of religion]4522-a minister of religion , and [you]47-philip are [an old man]4523-an old man . Two privileges - and [you]47-philip presume on [them]4524-them both . Good - morning . "[47-philip] [I]0-i drew back into a corner , just in time to escape discovery in the character of [a listener]1514-a listener . [Eunice]53-eunice never moved . When [Philip]47-philip dashed into [the room]3541-the room , banging the door after [him]47-philip , [she]53-eunice threw [herself]53-eunice impulsively on [his]47-philip breast : " Oh , [Philip]47-philip ! [Philip]47-philip ! what have [you]47-philip done ? Why did n't [you]47-philip keep [your]47-philip temper ? "[53-eunice] " Did [you]53-eunice hear what [[your]53-eunice father]3954-your father said to [me]47-philip ? "[47-philip] [he]47-philip asked . " Yes , [dear]4177-dear ; but [you]53-eunice ought to have controlled [yourself]53-eunice - [you]53-eunice ought , indeed , for [my]53-eunice sake . " If [I]47-philip am to get the better of [my]47-philip temper , [I]47-philip must be left alone . "[47-philip] " Oh , yes ! Go back to [Papa]58-papa , and beg [him]58-papa to forgive [you]53-eunice . "[47-philip] " [I]53-eunice 'll see [him]58-papa damned first ! "[53-eunice] If ever [a stupid girl]1516-a stupid girl deserved such an answer as this , [the girl]377-the girl was [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister . [I]0-i had hitherto with some difficulty refrained from interfering . But when [Eunice]53-eunice tried to follow [Philip]47-philip out of [the house]314-the house , [I]0-i could hesitate no longer ; [I]0-i held [her]53-eunice back . " [[You]53-eunice fool]4528-you fool , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " have n't [you]53-eunice made mischief enough already ? "[0-i] " What am [I]53-eunice to do ? "[53-eunice] [she]53-eunice burst out , helplessly . " Do what [I]53-eunice told [you]53-eunice to do yesterday - wait . "[53-eunice] Before [she]53-eunice could reply , or [I]0-i could say anything more , the door that led to [the landing]1520-the landing was opened softly and slyly , and [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall peeped in . [Eunice]53-eunice instantly left [me]0-i , and ran to [the meddling old maid]1521-the meddling old maid . [They]1522-they whispered to [each other]3725-each other . [I]0-i was only too glad to get rid of [them]1522-they both , and to take the opportunity of writing to [Philip]47-philip . [I]0-i insisted on an explanation of [his]47-philip conduct while [I]0-i was in [the study]4243-the study - to be given within an hour 's time , at a place which [I]0-i appointed . " [You]596-my sister are not to attempt to justify [yourself]596-my sister in writing , "[0-i] [I]0-i added in conclusion . " Let [your]596-my sister reply merely inform [me]0-i if [you]596-my sister can keep the appointment . The rest , when [we]4529-we meet . "[0-i] [Maria]64-maria took the letter to [the hotel]1214-the hotel , with instructions to wait . [Philip]47-philip 's reply reached [me]0-i without delay . It pledged [him]47-philip to justify [himself]47-philip as [I]0-i had desired , and to keep the appointment . [My]0-i own belief is that the event of to - day will decide [his]47-philip future and [mine]0-i . CHAPTER XXVII . [EUNICE 'S DIARY]53-eunice . Indeed , [I]0-i am [a most unfortunate creature]1527-a most unfortunate creature ; everything turns out badly with [me]0-i . [[My]0-i good , true friend]1528-my good , true friend , [[my]0-i dear]3949-my dear [Selina]96-selina , has become the object of a hateful doubt in [my]0-i secret mind . [I]0-i am afraid [she]96-selina is keeping something from [me]0-i . Talking with [her]96-selina about [my]0-i troubles , [I]0-i heard for the first time that [she]96-selina had written again to [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen . The object of [her]96-selina letter was to tell [[her]96-selina friend]4240-her friend of [my]0-i engagement to [young Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip . [I]0-i asked [her]96-selina why [she]96-selina had done this . The answer informed [me]0-i that there was no knowing , in the present state of [my]0-i affairs , how soon [I]0-i might not want the help of [a clever woman]1531-a clever woman . [I]0-i ought , [I]0-i suppose , to have been satisfied with this . But there seemed to be something not fully explained yet . Then again , after telling [Selina]96-selina what [I]0-i heard in [the study]4243-the study , and how roughly [Philip]47-philip had spoken to [me]0-i afterward , [I]0-i asked [her]96-selina what [she]96-selina thought of it . [She]96-selina made an incomprehensible reply : " [[My]96-selina sweet child]1306-my sweet child , [I]96-selina must n't think of it - [I]96-selina am too fond of [you]1306-my sweet child . "[96-selina] It was impossible to make [her]96-selina explain what this meant . [She]96-selina began to talk of [Philip]47-philip ; assuring [me]0-i which was quite needless that [she]96-selina had done [her]96-selina best to fortify and encourage [him]47-philip , before [he]47-philip called on [papa]3927-papa . When [I]0-i asked [her]96-selina to help [me]0-i in another way - that is to say , when [I]0-i wanted to find out where [Philip]47-philip was at that moment - [she]96-selina had no advice to give [me]0-i . [I]0-i told [her]96-selina that [I]0-i should not enjoy a moment 's ease of mind until [I]0-i and [[my]0-i dear one]1534-my dear one were reconciled . [She]96-selina only shook [her]96-selina head and declared that [she]96-selina was sorry for [me]0-i . When [I]0-i hit on the idea of ringing for [Maria]64-maria , [this little woman , so bright , and quick]1535-this little woman , so bright , and quick and eager to help [me]0-i at other times , said " [I]1535-this little woman , so bright , and quick leave it to [you]0-i , [dear]4177-dear , "[1535-this little woman , so bright , and quick] and turned to the piano close to which [I]0-i was sitting , and played softly and badly stupid little tunes . " [Maria]64-maria , did [you]0-i open the door for [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip when [he]47-philip went away just now ? "[1535-this little woman , so bright , and quick] " No , [miss]4033-miss . "[1535-this little woman , so bright , and quick] Nothing but ill - luck for [me]0-i ! If [I]0-i had been left to [my]0-i own devices , [I]0-i should now have let [the housemaid]900-the housemaid go . But [Selina]96-selina contrived to give [me]0-i a hint , on a strange plan of [her]96-selina own . Still at the piano , [she]96-selina began to confuse talking to [herself]96-selina with playing to [herself]96-selina . The notes went tinkle , tinkle - and the tongue mixed up words with the notes in this way : " Perhaps [they]4533-they have been talking in [the kitchen]4167-the kitchen about [Philip]47-philip ? "[96-selina] The suggestion was not lost on [me]0-i . [I]0-i said to [Maria]64-maria - who was standing at the other end of [the room]3541-the room , near the door - " Did [you]64-maria happen to hear which way [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip went when [he]47-philip left [us]4535-us ? "[0-i] " [I]0-i know where [he]47-philip was , [miss]4033-miss , half an hour ago . "[0-i] " Where was [he]47-philip ? "[0-i] " At [the hotel]1214-the hotel . "[96-selina] [Selina]96-selina went on with [her]96-selina hints in the same way as before . " How does [she]96-selina know - ah , how does [she]96-selina know ? "[96-selina] was the vocal part of the performance this time . [My]0-i clever inquiries followed the vocal part as before : " How do [you]64-maria know that [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip was at [the hotel]1214-the hotel ? "[0-i] " [I]96-selina was sent [there]4103-there with a letter for [him]47-philip , and waited for the answer . "[96-selina] There was no suggestion required this time . The one possible question was : " Who sent [you]96-selina ? "[64-maria] [Maria]64-maria replied , after first reserving a condition : " [You]96-selina wo n't tell upon [me]64-maria , [miss]4033-miss ? "[64-maria] [I]0-i promised not to tell . [Selina]96-selina suddenly left off playing . " Well , "[0-i] [I]0-i repeated , " who sent [you]96-selina ? "[0-i] " [Miss Helena]52-helena . "[96-selina] [Selina]96-selina looked round at [me]0-i . [Her]96-selina little eyes seemed to have suddenly become big , they stared [me]0-i so strangely in the face . [I]0-i do n't know whether [she]96-selina was in a state of fright or of wonder . As for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i simply lost the use of [my]0-i tongue . [Maria]64-maria , having no more questions to answer , discreetly left [us]1538-us together . Why should [Helena]52-helena write to [Philip]47-philip at all - and especially without mentioning it to [me]0-i ? Here was a riddle which was more than [I]0-i could guess . [I]0-i asked [Selina]96-selina to help [me]0-i . [She]52-helena might at least have tried , [I]0-i thought ; but [she]52-helena looked uneasy , and made excuses . [I]0-i said : " Suppose [I]0-i go to [Helena]52-helena , and ask [her]52-helena why [she]52-helena wrote to [Philip]47-philip ? "[0-i] And [Selina]96-selina said : " Suppose [you]0-i do , [dear]4177-dear . "[96-selina] [I]0-i rang for [Maria]64-maria once more : " Do [you]64-maria know where [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister is ? "[0-i] " Just gone out , [miss]4033-miss . "[0-i] There was no help for it but to wait till [she]64-maria came back , and to get through the time in the interval as [I]0-i best might . But for one circumstance , [I]0-i might not have known what to do . The truth is , there was a feeling of shame in [me]0-i when [I]0-i remembered having listened at the study door . Curious notions come into [one]431-one 's head - [one]431-one does n't know how or why . It struck [me]0-i that [I]0-i might make a kind of atonement for having been mean enough to listen , if [I]0-i went to [papa]3927-papa , and offered to keep [him]3927-papa company in [his]3927-papa solitude . If [we]1542-we fell into pleasant talk , [I]0-i had a sly idea of [my]0-i own - [I]0-i meant to put in a good word for poor [Philip]47-philip . When [I]0-i confided [my]0-i design to [Selina]96-selina , [she]96-selina shut up the piano and ran across [the room]3541-the room to [me]0-i . But somehow [she]96-selina was not like [her]96-selina old self again , yet . " [[You]0-i good little soul]4544-you good little soul , [you]0-i are always right . Look at [me]96-selina again , [Euneece]77-euneece . Are [you]0-i beginning to doubt [me]96-selina ? Oh , [[my]96-selina darling]350-my darling , do n't do that ! It is n't using [me]96-selina fairly . [I]96-selina ca n't bear it - [I]96-selina ca n't bear it ! "[96-selina] [I]0-i took [her]96-selina hand ; [I]0-i was on the point of speaking to [her]96-selina with the kindness [she]96-selina deserved from [me]0-i . On a sudden [she]96-selina snatched [her]96-selina hand away and ran back to the piano . When [she]96-selina was seated on the music - stool , [her]96-selina face was hidden from [me]0-i . At that moment [she]96-selina broke into a strange cry - it began like a laugh , and it ended like a sob . " Go away to [papa]3927-papa ! Do n't mind [me]96-selina - [I]96-selina 'm [a creature of impulse]4547-a creature of impulse - ha ! ha ! ha ! a little hysterical - the state of the weather - [I]96-selina get rid of these weaknesses , [[my]96-selina dear]3949-my dear , by singing to [myself]96-selina . [I]96-selina have a favorite song : ' [My]96-selina heart is light , [my]96-selina will is free . ' - Go away ! oh , for [God]38-god 's sake , go away ! "[96-selina] [I]0-i had heard of hysterics , of course ; knowing nothing about them , however , by [my]0-i own experience . What could have happened to agitate [her]96-selina in this extraordinary manner ? Had [Helena]52-helena 's letter anything to do with it ? Was [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister indignant with [Philip]47-philip for swearing in [my]0-i presence ; and had [she]596-my sister written [him]47-philip an angry letter , in [her]596-my sister zeal on [my]0-i behalf ? But [Selina]96-selina could not possibly have seen the letter - and [Helena]52-helena who is often hard on [me]0-i when [I]0-i do stupid things showed little indulgence for [me]0-i , when [I]0-i was so unfortunate as to irritate [Philip]47-philip . [I]0-i gave up the hopeless attempt to get at the truth by guessing , and went away to forget [my]0-i troubles , if [I]0-i could , in [[my]0-i father]615-my father 's society . After knocking twice at the door of [the study]4243-the study , and receiving no reply , [I]0-i ventured to look in . The sofa in [this room]347-this room stood opposite the door . [Papa]58-papa was resting on it , but not in comfort . There were twitching movements in [his]58-papa feet , and [he]58-papa shifted [his]58-papa arms this way and that as if no restful posture could [he]58-papa found for them . But what frightened [me]0-i was this . [His]58-papa eyes , staring straight at the door by which [I]0-i had gone in , had an inquiring expression , as if [he]58-papa actually did not know [me]0-i ! [I]0-i stood midway between the door and the sofa , doubtful about going nearer to [him]58-papa . [He]58-papa said : " Who is it ? "[58-papa] This to [me]0-i - to [[his]58-papa own daughter]1548-his own daughter . [He]58-papa said : " What do [you]0-i want ? "[58-papa] [I]0-i really could not bear it . [I]0-i went up to [him]58-papa . [I]0-i said : " [Papa]58-papa , have [you]58-papa forgotten [Eunice]53-eunice ? "[0-i] [My]0-i name seemed if one may say such a thing to bring [him]58-papa to [himself]58-papa again . [He]58-papa sat upon the sofa - and laughed as [he]58-papa answered [me]0-i . " [[My]58-papa dear child]3943-my dear child , what delusion has got into that pretty little head of [yours]3943-my dear child ? Fancy [her]1548-his own daughter thinking that [I]58-papa had forgotten [[my]58-papa own daughter]454-my own daughter ! [I]58-papa was lost in thought , [Eunice]53-eunice . For the moment , [I]58-papa was what [they]4551-they call [an absent man]4552-an absent man . Did [I]58-papa ever tell [you]3943-my dear child the story of [the absent man]4553-the absent man ? [He]58-papa went to call upon [some acquaintance of [his]58-papa]4554-some acquaintance of his ; and when [the servant]3631-the servant said , ' What name , [sir]3443-sir ? ' [He]58-papa could n't answer . [He]58-papa was obliged to confess that [he]58-papa had forgotten [his]58-papa own name . [The servant]3631-the servant said , ' That 's very strange . ' [The absent man]4553-the absent man at once recovered [himself]4553-the absent man . ' That 's it ! ' [he]1549-he said : ' [my]58-papa name is Strange . ' [Droll]95-droll , is n't it ? If [I]58-papa had been calling on [a friend]3678-a friend to - day , [I]58-papa daresay [I]58-papa might have forgotten [my]58-papa name , too . Much to think of , [Eunice]53-eunice - too much to think of . "[58-papa] Leaving the sofa with a sigh , as if [he]1549-he was tired of it , [he]1549-he began walking up and down . [He]1549-he seemed to be still in good spirits . " Well , [[my]1549-he dear]3949-my dear , "[1549-he] [he]1549-he said , " what can [I]1549-he do for [you]53-eunice ? "[1549-he] " [I]1549-he came here , [papa]3927-papa to see if there was anything [I]1549-he could do for [You]53-eunice . "[1549-he] [He]1549-he looked at some sheets of paper , strung together , and laid on the table . They were covered with writing from [his]1549-he dictation in [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister 's hand . " [I]1549-he ought to get on with [my]1549-he work , "[1549-he] [he]1549-he said . " Where is [Helena]52-helena ? "[1549-he] [I]0-i told [him]1549-he that [she]596-my sister had gone out , and begged leave to try what [I]0-i could do to supply [[her]596-my sister place]1551-her place . The request seemed to please [him]1549-he ; but [he]1549-he wanted time to think . [I]0-i waited ; noticing that [his]1549-he face grew gradually worried and anxious . There came a vacant look into [his]1549-he eyes which it grieved [me]0-i to see ; [he]1549-he appeared to have quite lost [himself]1549-he again . " Read the last page , "[1549-he] [he]1549-he said , pointing to the manuscript on the table ; " [I]1549-he do n't remember where [I]1549-he left off . "[1549-he] [I]0-i turned to the last page . As well as [I]0-i could tell , it related to some publication , which [he]1549-he was recommending to [religious persons of [our]1553-our way of thinking]1552-religious persons of our way of thinking . Before [I]0-i had read half - way through it , [he]1549-he began to dictate , speaking so rapidly that [my]0-i pen was not always able to follow [him]1549-he . [My]0-i handwriting is as bad as bad can be when [I]0-i am hurried . To make matters worse still , [I]0-i was confused . What [he]1549-he was now saying seemed to have nothing to do with what [I]0-i had been reading . Let [me]0-i try if [I]0-i can call to mind the substance of it . [He]1549-he began in the most strangely sudden way by asking : " Why should there be any fear of discovery , when every possible care had been taken to prevent it ? The danger from unexpected events was far more disquieting . [A man]3697-a man might find [himself]3697-a man bound in honor to disclose what it had been the chief anxiety of [his]3697-a man life to conceal . For example , could [he]1549-he let [an innocent person]4563-an innocent person be the victim of deliberate suppression of the truth - no matter how justifiable that suppression might appear to be ? On the other hand , dreadful consequences might follow an honorable confession . There might be a cruel sacrifice of tender affection ; there might be a shocking betrayal of innocent hope and trust . "[1549-he] [I]0-i remember those last words , just as [he]1549-he dictated them , because [he]1549-he suddenly stopped there ; looking , [poor dear]1554-poor dear , distressed and confused . [He]1549-he put [his]1549-he hand to [his]1549-he head , and went back to the sofa . " [I]1549-he 'm tired , "[1549-he] [he]1549-he said . " Wait for [me]1549-he while [I]1549-he rest . "[1549-he] In a few minutes [he]1549-he fell asleep . It was a deep repose that came to [him]1549-he now ; and , though [I]0-i do n't think it lasted much longer than half an hour , it produced a wonderful change in [him]1549-he for the better when [he]1549-he woke . [He]1549-he spoke quietly and kindly ; and when [he]1549-he returned to [me]0-i at the table and looked at the page on which [I]0-i had been writing , [he]1549-he smiled . " Oh , [[my]1549-he dear]3949-my dear , what bad writing ! [I]1549-he declare [I]1549-he ca n't read what [I]1549-he [myself]1549-he told [you]0-i to write . No ! no ! do n't be downhearted about it . [You]0-i are not used to writing from dictation ; and [I]1549-he daresay [I]1549-he have been too quick for [you]0-i . "[1549-he] [He]1549-he kissed [me]0-i and encouraged [me]0-i . " [You]0-i know how fond [I]1549-he am of [[my]1549-he little girl]233-my little girl , "[1549-he] [he]1549-he said ; " [I]1549-he am afraid [I]1549-he like [[my]1549-he Eunice]4566-my eunice just the least in [the world]364-the world more than [I]1549-he like [[my]1549-he Helena]4568-my helena . Ah , [you]233-my little girl are beginning to look a little happier now ! "[1549-he] [He]1549-he had filled [me]0-i with such confidence and such pleasure that [I]0-i could not help thinking of [[my]0-i sweetheart]1160-my sweetheart . Oh dear , when shall [I]0-i learn to be distrustful of [my]0-i own feelings ? The temptation to say a good word for [Philip]47-philip quite mastered any little discretion that [I]0-i possessed . [I]0-i said to [papa]58-papa : " If [you]58-papa knew how to make [me]0-i happier than [I]0-i have ever been in all [my]0-i life before , would [you]58-papa do it ? "[0-i] " Of course [I]0-i would . "[0-i] " Then send for [Philip]47-philip , [dear]4177-dear , and be a little kinder to [him]47-philip , this time . "[1549-he] [His]1549-he pale face turned red with anger ; [he]1549-he pushed [me]0-i away from [him]1549-he . " [That man]351-that man again ! "[1549-he] [he]1549-he burst out . " Am [I]1549-he never to hear the last of [him]351-that man ? Go away , [Eunice]53-eunice . [You]53-eunice are of no use [here]225-here . "[1549-he] [He]1549-he took up [my]0-i unfortunate page of writing and ridiculed it with a bitter laugh . " What is this fit for ? "[1549-he] [He]1549-he crumpled it up in [his]1549-he hand and tossed it into the fire . [I]0-i ran out of [the room]3541-the room in such a state of mortification that [I]0-i hardly knew what [I]0-i was about . If [some hard - hearted person]1557-some hard - hearted person had come to [me]0-i with a cup of poison , and had said : " [Eunice]53-eunice , [you]53-eunice are not fit to live any longer ; take this , "[1557-some hard - hearted person] [I]0-i do believe [I]0-i should have taken it . If [I]0-i thought of anything , [I]0-i thought of going back to [Selina]72-selina . [My]0-i ill luck still pursued [me]0-i ; [she]72-selina had disappeared . [I]0-i looked about in a helpless way , completely at a loss what to do next - so stupefied , [I]0-i may even say , that it was some time before [I]0-i noticed a little three - cornered note on the table by which [I]0-i was standing . The note was addressed to [me]0-i : " EVER - DEAREST [EUNEECE]77-euneece - [I]0-i have tried to make [myself]0-i useful to [you]77-euneece , and have failed . But how can [I]0-i see the sad sight of [your]77-euneece wretchedness , and not feel the impulse to try again ? [I]0-i have gone to [the hotel]1214-the hotel to find [Philip]47-philip , and to bring [him]47-philip back to [you]77-euneece [a penitent and faithful man]4573-a penitent and faithful man . " Wait for [her]77-euneece , after reading that note ! How could [she]77-euneece expect it ? [I]0-i had only to follow [her]77-euneece , and to find [Philip]47-philip . In another minute , [I]0-i was on [my]0-i way to [the hotel]1214-the hotel . CHAPTER XXVIII . [HELENA]52-helena 'S DIARY . Looking at the last entry in [my]0-i Journal , [I]0-i see [myself]0-i anticipating that the event of to - day will decide [Philip]47-philip 's future and [mine]0-i . This has proved prophetic . All further concealment is now at an end . Forced to it by fate , or helped to it by chance , [Eunice]53-eunice has made the discovery of [[her]53-eunice lover]1441-her lover 's infidelity . "[0-i] In all human probability " as [[my]0-i father]615-my father says in [his]615-my father sermons , [we]4578-our [two sisters]4579-two sisters are enemies for life . [I]0-i am not suspected , as [Eunice]53-eunice is , of making appointments with [a sweetheart]4405-a sweetheart . So [I]0-i am free to go out alone , and to go where [I]0-i please . [Philip]47-philip and [I]0-i were punctual to [our]4578-our appointment this afternoon . [Our]4578-our place of meeting was in [a secluded corner of [the town park]4582-the town park]4581-a secluded corner of the town park . [We]4578-our found a rustic seat in [[our]4578-our retirement]4583-our retirement , set up [one]431-one would suppose as a concession to the taste of [visitors who are fond of solitude]4585-visitors who are fond of solitude . The view in front of [us]4578-our was bounded by the park wall and railings , and [our]4578-our seat was prettily approached on one side by [a plantation of young trees]4586-a plantation of young trees . No entrance gate was near ; [no carriage road]4587-no carriage road crossed the grass . [A more safe and more solitary nook for conversation]4588-a more safe and more solitary nook for conversation , between [two persons desiring to be alone]4589-two persons desiring to be alone , it would be hard to find in [most public parks]4590-most public parks . [Lovers]1338-lovers are said to know it well , and to be especially fond of it toward evening . [We]4578-our were there in broad daylight , and [we]4578-our had the seat to [ourselves]4578-our . [My]0-i memory of what passed between [us]4578-our is , in some degree , disturbed by the formidable interruption which brought [our]4578-our talk to an end . But among other things , [I]0-i remember that [I]0-i showed [him]4592-him no mercy at the outset . At one time [I]0-i was indignant ; at another [I]0-i was scornful . [I]0-i declared , in regard to [my]0-i object in meeting [him]4592-him , that [I]0-i had changed [my]0-i mind , And had decided to shorten a disagreeable interview by waiving [my]0-i right to an explanation , and bidding [him]4592-him farewell . [Eunice]53-eunice , as [I]0-i pointed out , had the first claim to [him]4592-him ; [Eunice]53-eunice was much more likely to suit [him]4592-him , as a companion for life , than [I]0-i was . "[0-i] In short , " [I]0-i said , in conclusion , "[0-i] [my]0-i inclination for once takes sides with [my]0-i duty , and leaves [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister in undisturbed possession of [young Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip . " With this satirical explanation , [I]0-i rose to say good - by . [I]0-i had merely intended to irritate [him]4592-him . [He]4592-him showed a superiority to anger for which [I]0-i was not prepared . "[0-i] Be so kind as to sit down again , " [he]4592-him said quietly . [He]4592-him took [my]0-i letter from [his]4592-him pocket , and pointed to that part of it which alluded to [his]4592-him conduct , when [we]4593-we had met in [[[my]0-i father]615-my father 's study]634-my father 's study . "[0-i] [You]0-i have offered [me]0-i the opportunity of saying a word in [my]0-i own defense , " [he]4592-him went on . "[0-i] [I]0-i prize that privilege far too highly to consent to [your]0-i withdrawing it , merely because [you]0-i have changed [your]0-i mind . Let [me]0-i at least tell [you]0-i what [my]0-i errand was , when [I]0-i called on [[your]0-i father]3954-your father . Loving [you]0-i , and [you]0-i only , [I]0-i had forced [myself]0-i to make a last effort to be true to [[your]0-i sister]3944-your sister . Remember that , [Helena]52-helena , and then say - is it wonderful if [I]0-i was beside [myself]0-i , when [I]0-i found [You]0-i in [the study]4243-the study ? " "[0-i] When [you]0-i tell [me]0-i [you]0-i were beside [yourself]0-i , " [I]0-i said , "[0-i] do [you]0-i mean , ashamed of [yourself]0-i ? " That touched [him]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i mean nothing of the kind , " [he]0-i burst out . "[0-i] After the hell on earth in which [I]0-i have been living between [[you]0-i two sisters]3947-you two sisters , [a man]3697-a man has n't virtue enough left in [him]3697-a man to be ashamed . [He]3697-a man 's half mad - that 's what [he]3697-a man is . Look at [my]0-i position ! [I]0-i had made up [my]0-i mind never to see [you]0-i again ; [I]0-i had made up [my]0-i mind if [I]0-i married [Eunice]53-eunice to rid [myself]0-i of [my]0-i own miserable life when [I]0-i could endure it no longer . If [I]0-i had dared to look at [you]0-i , or to speak to [you]0-i , what do [you]0-i think would have become of [my]0-i resolution to sacrifice [myself]0-i ? " "[0-i] What has become of it now ? " [I]0-i asked . "[0-i] Tell [me]0-i first if [I]0-i am forgiven , " [he]0-i said - "[0-i] and [you]0-i shall know . " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i deserve to be forgiven ? " It has been discovered by [wiser heads]4596-wiser heads than [mine]0-i that [weak people]4597-weak people are always in extremes . So far , [I]0-i had seen [Philip]47-philip in the vain and violent extreme . [He]47-philip now shifted suddenly to the sad and submissive extreme . When [I]0-i asked [him]0-i if [he]0-i deserved to be forgiven , [he]0-i made the humblest of all replies - [he]0-i sighed and said nothing . "[0-i] If [I]0-i did [my]0-i duty to [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister , " [I]0-i reminded [him]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i should refuse to forgive [you]0-i , and send [you]0-i back to [Eunice]53-eunice . " "[0-i] [[Your]0-i father]3954-your father 's language and [[your]0-i father]3954-your father 's conduct , " [he]0-i answered , "[0-i] have released [me]0-i from that entanglement . If [you]0-i refuse to forgive [me]0-i , neither [you]0-i nor [she]53-eunice will see anything more of [Philip Dunboyne]47-philip ; [I]0-i promise [you]0-i that . Are [you]0-i satisfied now ? " After holding out against [him]0-i resolutely , [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i beginning to yield . When [a man]3697-a man has once taken [their]3697-a man fancy , what [helplessly weak creatures]4599-helplessly weak creatures [women]195-women are ! [I]0-i saw through [his]0-i vacillating weakness - and yet [I]0-i trusted [him]0-i , with both eyes open . [My]0-i looking - glass is opposite to [me]0-i while [I]0-i write . It shows [me]0-i a contemptible [Helena]52-helena . [I]0-i lied , and said [I]0-i was satisfied - to please [him]0-i . "[0-i] Am [I]0-i forgiven ? " [he]0-i asked . It is absurd to put it on record . Of course , [I]0-i forgave [him]0-i . What a good Christian [I]0-i am , after all ! [He]0-i took [my]0-i willing hand . "[0-i] [[My]0-i lovely darling]1568-my lovely darling , " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] [our]1569-our marriage rests with [you]1568-my lovely darling . Whether [[your]1568-my lovely darling father]3954-your father approves of it or not , say the word ; claim [me]0-i , and [I]0-i am [yours]1568-my lovely darling for life . " [I]1568-my lovely darling must have been infatuated by [his]0-i voice and [his]0-i look ; [my]1568-my lovely darling heart must have been burning under the pressure of [his]0-i hand on [mine]0-i . Was it [my]1568-my lovely darling modesty or [my]1568-my lovely darling self - control that deserted [me]1568-my lovely darling ? [I]1568-my lovely darling let [him]0-i take [me]1568-my lovely darling in [his]0-i arms . Again , and again , and again [I]1568-my lovely darling kissed [him]0-i . [We]4601-we were deaf to what [we]4601-we ought to have heard ; [we]4601-we were blind to what [we]4601-we ought to have seen . Before [we]4601-we were conscious of a movement among the trees , [we]4601-we were discovered . [[My]1568-my lovely darling sister]596-my sister flew at [me]1568-my lovely darling like a wild animal . [Her]596-my sister furious hands fastened themselves on [my]1568-my lovely darling throat . [Philip]47-philip started to [his]47-philip feet . When [he]0-i touched [her]596-my sister , in the act of forcing [her]596-my sister back from [me]1568-my lovely darling , [Eunice]53-eunice 's raging strength became utter weakness in an instant . [Her]596-my sister arms fell helpless at [her]596-my sister sides - [her]596-my sister head drooped - [she]596-my sister looked at [him]47-philip in silence which was dreadful , at such a moment as that . [He]47-philip shrank from the unendurable reproach in those tearless eyes . Meanly , [he]47-philip turned away from [her]596-my sister . Meanly , [I]1568-my lovely darling followed [him]47-philip . Looking back for an instant , [I]1568-my lovely darling saw [her]596-my sister step forward ; perhaps to stop [him]47-philip , perhaps to speak to [him]47-philip . Like [strangers]875-strangers , walking separate one from the other , [we]4604-we left [her]596-my sister to [[her]596-my sister companion]4605-her companion - [the hideous traitress who was [[my]1568-my lovely darling enemy]4607-my enemy and [[her]596-my sister friend]4240-her friend]4606-the hideous traitress who was my enemy and her friend . CHAPTER XXIX . [HELENA 'S DIARY]93-helena . On reaching [the street]670-the street which led to [[Philip]47-philip 's hotel]1429-philip 's hotel , [we]1571-we spoke to [each other]3725-each other for the first time . "[1568-my lovely darling] What are [we]1571-we to do ? " [I]1568-my lovely darling said . "[1568-my lovely darling] Leave [this place]443-this place , " [he]47-philip answered . "[1568-my lovely darling] Together ? " [I]1568-my lovely darling asked . "[1568-my lovely darling] Yes . " To leave [us]1571-we for a while , after what had happened , might be the wisest thing which [a man]3697-a man , in [Philip]47-philip 's critical position , could do . But if [I]1568-my lovely darling went with [him]47-philip - unprovided as [I]1568-my lovely darling was with [any friend of [my]1568-my lovely darling own sex]4613-any friend of my own sex , whose character and presence might sanction the step [I]1568-my lovely darling had taken - [I]1568-my lovely darling should be lost beyond redemption . Is [any man that ever lived worth that sacrifice]4614-any man that ever lived worth that sacrifice ? [I]1568-my lovely darling thought of [[[my]1568-my lovely darling father]615-my father 's house]4616-my father 's house closed to [me]1568-my lovely darling , and of [[our]1571-we friends]669-our friends ashamed of [me]1568-my lovely darling . [I]1568-my lovely darling have owned , in some earlier part of [my]1568-my lovely darling Journal , that [I]1568-my lovely darling am not very patient under domestic cares . But the possibility of [Eunice]53-eunice being appointed [housekeeper]4618-housekeeper , with [my]1568-my lovely darling power , in [my]1568-my lovely darling place , was more than [I]1568-my lovely darling could calmly contemplate . "[1568-my lovely darling] No , " [I]1568-my lovely darling said to [Philip]47-philip . "[1568-my lovely darling] [Your]1573-your absence , at such a time as this , may help [us]1574-us both ; but , come what may of it , [I]0-i must remain at [home]258-home . " [He]47-philip yielded , without an attempt to make [me]0-i alter [my]0-i mind . There was a sullen submission in [his]47-philip manner which it was not pleasant to see . Was [he]47-philip despairing already of [himself]47-philip and of [me]0-i ? Had [Eunice]53-eunice aroused the watchful demons of shame and remorse ? "[0-i] Perhaps [you]0-i are right , " [he]47-philip said , gloomily . "[0-i] Good - by . " [My]0-i anxiety put the all - important question to [him]47-philip without hesitation . "[0-i] Is it good - by forever , [Philip]47-philip ? " [His]47-philip reply instantly relieved [me]47-philip : "[47-philip] God forbid ! " But [I]47-philip wanted more : "[47-philip] [You]47-philip still love [me]0-i ? " [I]47-philip persisted . "[47-philip] More dearly than ever ! " "[47-philip] And yet [you]0-i leave [me]0-i ! " [He]47-philip turned pale . "[0-i] [I]0-i leave [you]0-i because [I]0-i am afraid . " "[0-i] Afraid of what ? " "[0-i] Afraid to face [Eunice]53-eunice again . " The only possible way out of [our]1577-our difficulty that [I]0-i could see , now occurred to [me]0-i . "[0-i] Suppose [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister can be prevailed on to give [you]47-philip up ? " [I]596-my sister suggested . "[596-my sister] Would [you]47-philip come back to [us]1577-our in that case ? " "[47-philip] Certainly ! "[47-philip] " Engaged to [you]0-i , "[47-philip] [he]47-philip answered , " in spite of obstacles and in spite of time . "[47-philip] " And while [you]47-philip are away from [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i ventured to add , " [we]1577-our shall write to [each other]3725-each other ? "[0-i] " Go where [I]47-philip may , "[47-philip] [he]47-philip said , " [you]0-i shall always hear from [me]47-philip . "[47-philip] [I]0-i could ask no more , and [he]47-philip could concede no more . The impression evidently left on [him]47-philip by [Eunice]53-eunice 's terrible outbreak , was far more serious than [I]0-i had anticipated . [I]0-i was [myself]0-i depressed and ill at ease . No expressions of tenderness were exchanged between [us]1579-us . There was something horrible in [our]1579-us barren farewell . [We]1579-us merely clasped hands , at parting . [He]47-philip went [his]47-philip way - and [I]0-i went [mine]0-i . There are some occasions when [women]195-women set an example of courage to [men]1581-men . [some people]853-some people might say , if [they]853-some people could look into this diary ! [Maria]64-maria opened the door ; [she]64-maria told [me]0-i that [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister had already returned , accompanied by [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall .
