[I]3444-this woman wo n't distress [myself]3444-this woman by saying a word more . It would be too humiliating to let [you]4638-you see [an honest woman]4639-an honest woman in tears . [[Your]4638-you sister]3944-your sister has a spirit of [her]3944-your sister own , thank [God]38-god ! [She]3944-your sister wo n't inhabit [the same room]4641-the same room with [you]4638-you ; [she]3944-your sister never desires to see [your]4638-you false face again . [I]3444-this woman take [the poor soul]4407-the poor soul 's dresses and things away - and as [a religious person]4643-a religious person [I]3444-this woman wait , confidently wait , for the judgment that will fall on [you]4638-you ! "[3444-this woman] [She]1595-her caught up the dresses all together ; some of them were in [her]1595-her arms , some of them fell on [her]1595-her shoulders , and one of them towered over [her]1595-her head . Smothered in gowns , [she]1595-her bounced out of [the room]3541-the room like [[a walking milliner]1597-a walking milliner 's shop]1598-a walking milliner 's shop . [I]0-i have to thank [the wretched old creature]1599-the wretched old creature for a moment of genuine amusement , at a time of devouring anxiety . The meanest insect , [they]1600-they say , has its use in [this world]1601-this world - and why not [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall ? In half an hour more , an unexpected event raised [my]0-i spirits . [I]0-i heard from [Philip]47-philip . On [his]47-philip return to [the hotel]1214-the hotel [he]47-philip had found a telegram waiting for [him]47-philip . [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip [the elder]3966-the elder had arrived in [London]3-london ; and [Philip]47-philip had arranged to join [[his]47-philip father]3972-his father by [the next train]828-the next train . [He]47-philip sent [me]0-i the address , and begged that [I]0-i would write and tell [him]47-philip [my]0-i news from [home]258-home by the next day 's post . Welcome , thrice welcome , to [Mr. Dunboyne the elder]47-philip ! If [Philip]47-philip can manage , under [my]0-i advice , to place [me]0-i favorably in the estimation of [this rich old man]1607-this rich old man , [his]47-philip presence and authority may do for [us]1608-us what [we]1608-us can not do for [ourselves]1608-us . Here is surely an influence to which [[my]0-i father]615-my father must submit , no matter how unreasonable or how angry [he]615-my father may be when [he]615-my father hears what has happened . [I]0-i begin already to feel hopeful of the future . CHAPTER XXX . [EUNICE]53-eunice 'S DIARY . Through the day , and through the night , [I]0-i feel a misery that never leaves [me]0-i - [I]0-i mean the misery of fear . [I]0-i am trying to find out some harmless means of employing [myself]0-i , which will keep evil remembrances from [me]0-i . If [I]0-i do n't succeed , [my]0-i fear tells [me]0-i what will happen . [I]0-i shall be in danger of going mad . [I]0-i dare not confide in [any living creature]1610-any living creature . [I]0-i do n't know what [other persons]1611-other persons might think of [me]0-i , or how soon [I]0-i might find [myself]0-i perhaps in [an asylum]1612-an asylum . In this helpless condition , doubt and fright seem to be driving [me]0-i back to [my]0-i Journal . [I]0-i wonder whether [I]0-i shall find harmless employment [here]225-here . [I]0-i have heard of [old people]1614-old people losing [their]1614-old people memories . What would [I]0-i not give to be old ! [I]0-i remember ! oh , how [I]0-i remember ! One day after another [I]0-i see [Philip]47-philip , [I]0-i see [Helena]52-helena , as [I]0-i first saw [them]1615-them when [I]0-i was among the trees in [the park]4624-the park . [[My]0-i sweetheart]1160-my sweetheart 's arms , that once held [me]0-i , hold [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister now . [She]596-my sister kisses [him]47-philip , kisses [him]47-philip , kisses [him]47-philip . Is there no way of making [myself]0-i see something else ? [I]0-i want to get back to remembrances that do n't burn in [my]0-i head and tear at [my]0-i heart . How is it to be done ? [I]0-i have tried books - no ! [I]0-i have tried going out to look at [the shops]1619-the shops - no ! [I]0-i have tried saying [my]0-i prayers - no ! And now [I]0-i am making [my]0-i last effort ; trying [my]0-i pen . [My]0-i black letters fall from it , and take their places on the white paper . Will [my]0-i black letters help [me]0-i ? Where can [I]0-i find something consoling to write down ? Where ? Where ? [Selina]96-selina - poor [Selina]96-selina , so fond of [me]0-i , so sorry for [me]0-i . When [I]0-i was happy , [she]96-selina was happy , too . It was always amusing to hear [her]96-selina talk . Oh , [my]0-i memory , be good to [me]0-i ! Save [me]0-i from [Philip]47-philip and [Helena]52-helena . [I]0-i want to remember the pleasant days when [[my]0-i kind little friend]1620-my kind little friend and [I]0-i used to gossip in [the garden]637-the garden . No : the days in [the garden]637-the garden wo n't come back . What else can [I]0-i think of ? ....... The recollections that [I]0-i try to encourage keep away from [me]0-i . The other recollections that [I]0-i dread , come crowding back . Still [Philip]47-philip ! Still [Helena]52-helena ! But [Selina]96-selina mixes [herself]96-selina up with [them]1623-them . Let [me]0-i try again if [I]0-i can think of [Selina]96-selina . How delightfully good to [me]0-i and patient with [me]0-i [she]96-selina was , on [our]1624-our dismal way [home]258-home from [the park]4624-the park ! And how affectionately [she]96-selina excused [herself]96-selina for not having warned [me]0-i of it , when [she]96-selina first suspected that [[my]0-i own sister]1627-my own sister and [[my]0-i worst enemy]1628-my worst enemy were [one and the same]1629-one and the same ! " [I]1630-i know [I]1630-i was wrong , [[my]1630-i dear]3949-my dear , to let [my]1630-i love and pity close [my]1630-i lips . But remember how happy [you]3949-my dear were at the time . The thought of making [you]3949-my dear miserable was more than [I]1630-i could endure - [I]1630-i am so fond of [you]3949-my dear ! Yes ; [I]1630-i began to suspect [them]4645-them , on the day when [they]4645-them first met at [the station]1220-the station . And , [I]1630-i am afraid , [I]1630-i thought it just likely that [you]3949-my dear might be as cunning as [I]1630-i was , and have noticed [them]4645-them , too . "[1630-i] Oh , how ignorant [she]1630-i must have been of [my]0-i true thoughts and feelings ! How strangely [people]673-people seem to misunderstand [[their]673-people dearest friends]1632-their dearest friends ! knowing , as [I]0-i did , that [I]0-i could never love [any man]3517-any man but [Philip]47-philip , could [I]0-i be wicked enough to suppose that [Philip]47-philip would love [any woman]1634-any woman but [me]0-i ? [I]0-i explained to [Selina]96-selina how [he]47-philip had spoken to [me]0-i , when [we]1635-we were walking together on [the bank of [the river]1361-the river]1360-the bank of the river . Shall [I]0-i ever forget those exquisite words ? " [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was [a better man]4458-a better man , [Eunice]53-eunice ; [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was good enough to be worthy of [you]96-selina . "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [Selina]96-selina if [she]96-selina thought [he]47-philip was deceiving [me]0-i when [he]47-philip said that . [She]96-selina comforted [me]0-i by owning that [he]47-philip must have been in earnest , at the time - and then [she]96-selina distressed [me]0-i by giving the reason why . " [[My]96-selina love]4648-my love , [you]96-selina must have innocently said something to [him]47-philip , when [you]96-selina and [he]47-philip were alone , which touched [his]47-philip conscience when [he]47-philip had a conscience , and made [him]47-philip ashamed of [himself]47-philip . Ah , [you]96-selina were too fond of [him]47-philip to see how [he]47-philip changed for the worse , when [[your]96-selina vile sister]4649-your vile sister joined [you]96-selina , and took possession of [him]47-philip again . It made [my]96-selina heart ache to see [you]96-selina so unsuspicious of [them]4650-they . [You]96-selina asked [me]96-selina , [[my]96-selina poor dear]4461-my poor dear , if [they]4650-they had quarreled - [you]96-selina believed [they]4650-they were tired of walking by [the river]1361-the river , when it was [you]96-selina [they]4650-they were tired of - and [you]96-selina wondered why [Helena]52-helena took [him]47-philip to see [the school]1387-the school . [[My]96-selina child]242-my child ! [she]52-helena was [the leading spirit at [the school]1387-the school]4655-the leading spirit at the school , and [you]96-selina were [nobody]305-nobody . [Her]52-helena vanity saw the chance of making [him]47-philip compare [you]96-selina at a disadvantage with [[your]96-selina clever sister]4658-your clever sister . [I]96-selina declare , [Euneece]77-euneece , [I]96-selina lose [my]96-selina head if [I]96-selina only think of it ! All the strong points in [my]96-selina character seem to slip away from [me]96-selina . Would [you]96-selina believe it ? - [I]96-selina have neglected [that sweet infant]4659-that sweet infant at [the cottage]4660-the cottage ; [I]96-selina have even let [Mrs. Molly]64-maria have [[her]64-maria baby]304-her baby back again . If [I]96-selina had the making of the laws , [Philip Dunboyne]47-philip and [Helena Gracedieu]52-helena should be hanged together on the same gallows . [I]96-selina see [I]96-selina shock [you]4662-you . Do n't let [us]4663-us talk of it ! Oh , do n't let [us]4663-us talk of it ! "[96-selina] And here am [I]0-i writing of it ! What [I]0-i had determined not to do , is what [I]0-i have done . Am [I]0-i losing [my]0-i senses already ? The very names that [I]0-i was most anxious to keep out of [my]0-i memory stare [me]0-i in the face in the lines that [I]0-i have just written . [Philip]47-philip again ! [Helena]52-helena again ! ....... Another day , and something new that must and will be remembered , shrink from it as [I]0-i may . This afternoon , [I]0-i met [Helena]52-helena on the stairs . [She]52-helena stopped , and eyed [me]0-i with a wicked smile ; [she]52-helena held out [her]52-helena hand . " [We]4664-we are likely to meet often , while [we]4664-we are in [the same house]4665-the same house , "[52-helena] [she]52-helena said ; " had n't [we]4664-we better consult appearances , and pretend to be as fond of each other as ever ? "[52-helena] [I]0-i took no notice of [her]52-helena hand ; [I]0-i took no notice of [her]52-helena shameless proposal . [She]52-helena tried again : " After all , it is n't [my]52-helena fault if [Philip]47-philip likes [me]52-helena better than [he]47-philip likes [you]0-i . Do n't [you]52-helena see that ? "[52-helena] [I]0-i still refused to speak to [her]52-helena . [She]52-helena still persisted . " How black [you]0-i look , [Eunice]53-eunice ! Are [you]0-i sorry [you]0-i did n't kill [me]0-i , when [you]0-i had [your]0-i hands on [my]0-i throat ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said : " Yes . "[0-i] [She]52-helena laughed , and left [me]0-i . [I]0-i was obliged to sit down on the stair - [I]0-i trembled so . [My]0-i own reply frightened [me]0-i . [I]0-i tried to find out why [I]0-i had said Yes . [I]0-i do n't remember being conscious of meaning anything . It was as if [somebody else]3922-somebody else had said Yes - not [I.]0-i Perhaps [I]0-i was provoked , and the word escaped [me]0-i before [I]0-i could stop it . Could [I]0-i have stopped it ? [I]0-i do n't know . ....... Another sleepless night . Did [I]0-i pass the miserable hours in writing letters to [Philip]47-philip and then tearing them up ? Or did [I]0-i only fancy that [I]0-i wrote to [him]47-philip ? [I]0-i have just looked at the fireplace . The torn paper in it tells [me]0-i that [I]0-i did write . Why did [I]0-i destroy [my]0-i letters ? [I]0-i might have sent one of them to [Philip]47-philip . After what has happened ? Oh , no ! no ! Having been many days away from [the Girls]50-the girls ' Scripture Class , it seemed to be possible that going back to [the school]1387-the school and the teaching might help [me]0-i to escape from [myself]0-i . Nothing succeeds with [me]0-i . [I]0-i found it impossible to instruct [the girls]1062-the girls as usual ; [their]1062-the girls stupidity soon reached the limit of [my]0-i patience - suffocated [me]0-i with rage . [One of [them]1062-the girls]1076-one of them , [a poor , fat , feeble creature]1642-a poor , fat , feeble creature , began to cry when [I]0-i scolded [her]1076-one of them . [I]0-i looked with envy at the tears rolling over [her]1076-one of them big round cheeks . If [I]0-i could only cry , [I]0-i might perhaps bear [my]0-i hard fate with submission . [I]0-i walked toward [home]258-home by a roundabout way ; feeling as if want of sleep was killing [me]0-i by inches . In [the High Street]1644-the high street , [I]0-i saw [Helena]52-helena ; [she]52-helena was posting a letter , and was not aware that [I]0-i was near [her]52-helena . Leaving [the post - office]1645-the post - office , [she]52-helena crossed [the street]670-the street , and narrowly escaped being run over . Suppose the threatened accident had really taken place - how should [I]0-i have felt , if it had ended fatally ? What [a fool]767-a fool [I]0-i am to be putting questions to [myself]0-i about things that have not happened ! The walking tired [me]0-i ; [I]0-i went straight [home]258-home . Before [I]0-i could ring the bell , the house door opened , and [the doctor]162-the doctor came out . [He]162-the doctor stopped to speak to [me]0-i . While [I]0-i had been away [he]162-the doctor said , something had happened at [home]258-home [he]162-the doctor neither knew nor wished to know what which had thrown [[my]0-i father]615-my father into a state of violent agitation . [The doctor]162-the doctor had administered composing medicine . " [[My]162-the doctor patient]4666-my patient is asleep now , "[162-the doctor] [he]162-the doctor told [me]0-i ; " but remember what [I]162-the doctor said to [you]0-i the last time [we]4667-we met ; a longer rest than [any doctor]4668-any doctor 's prescription can give [him]4666-my patient is what [he]4666-my patient wants . [You]0-i are not looking well [yourself]0-i , [[my]162-the doctor dear]3949-my dear . What is the matter ? "[162-the doctor] [I]0-i told [him]162-the doctor of [my]0-i wretched restless nights ; and asked if [I]0-i might take some of the composing medicine which [he]162-the doctor had given to [[my]0-i father]615-my father . [He]162-the doctor forbade [me]0-i to touch a drop of it . " What is physic for [[your]0-i father]3954-your father , [[you]0-i foolish child]4671-you foolish child , is not physic for [a young creature like [you]0-i]4672-a young creature like you , "[162-the doctor] [he]162-the doctor said . " Count a thousand , if [you]0-i ca n't sleep to - night , or turn [your]0-i pillow . [I]162-the doctor wish [you]0-i pleasant dreams . "[162-the doctor] [He]162-the doctor went away , amused at [his]162-the doctor own humor . [I]0-i found [Selina]96-selina waiting to speak with [me]0-i , on the subject of [poor papa]1427-poor papa . [She]96-selina had been startled on hearing [his]1427-poor papa voice , loud in anger . In the fear that something serious had happened , [she]96-selina left [[her]96-selina room]1655-her room to make inquiries , and saw [Helena]52-helena on the landing of [the flight of stairs beneath]1656-the flight of stairs beneath , leaving [the study]4243-the study . After waiting till [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister was out of the way , [Selina]96-selina ventured to present [herself]96-selina at [the study]4243-the study door , and to ask if [she]96-selina could be of any use . [[My]0-i father]615-my father , walking excitedly up and down [the room]3541-the room , declared that both [[his]615-my father daughters]927-his daughters had behaved infamously , and that [he]615-my father would not suffer [them]927-his daughters to speak to [him]615-my father again until [they]927-his daughters had come to [their]927-his daughters senses , on the subject of [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip . [He]615-my father would enter into no further explanation ; and [he]615-my father had ordered , rather than requested , [Selina]96-selina to leave [him]615-my father . Having obeyed , [she]96-selina tried next to find [me]0-i , and had just looked into [the dining - room]1663-the dining - room to see if [I]0-i was [there]4103-there , when [she]96-selina was frightened by the sound of a fall in [the room above]1665-the room above - that is to say , in [the study]4243-the study . Running [upstairs]3864-upstairs again , [she]96-selina had found [him]615-my father insensible on the floor and had sent for [the doctor]162-the doctor . " And mind this , "[96-selina] [Selina]96-selina continued , " [the person who has done the mischief]4673-the person who has done the mischief is [the person whom [I]96-selina saw leaving [the study]4243-the study]4674-the person whom i saw leaving the study . What [[your]0-i unnatural sister]4676-your unnatural sister said to provoke [[her]4676-your unnatural sister father]614-her father - "[96-selina] " That [[your]0-i unnatural sister]4676-your unnatural sister will tell [you]0-i [herself]4676-your unnatural sister , "[52-helena] [Helena]52-helena 's voice added . [She]52-helena had opened the door while [we]1669-we were too much absorbed in [our]1669-we talk to hear [her]52-helena . [Selina]96-selina attempted to leave [the room]3541-the room . [I]0-i caught [her]52-helena by the hand , and held [her]52-helena back . [I]0-i was afraid of what [I]0-i might do if [she]52-helena left [me]0-i by [myself]0-i . Never have [I]0-i felt anything like the rage that tortured [me]0-i , when [I]0-i saw [Helena]52-helena looking at [us]1669-we with the same wicked smile on [her]52-helena lips that had insulted [me]0-i when [we]1669-we met on the stairs . " Have [we]1669-we anything to be ashamed of ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [Selina]96-selina . " Stay where [you]96-selina are . "[0-i] " [You]0-i may be of some use , [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall , if [you]0-i stay , "[596-my sister] [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister suggested . " [Eunice]53-eunice seems to be trembling . Is [she]53-eunice angry , or is [she]53-eunice ill ? "[596-my sister] The sting of this was in the tone of [her]596-my sister voice . It was the hardest thing [I]0-i ever had to do in [my]0-i life - but [I]0-i did succeed in controlling [myself]0-i . " Go on with what [you]96-selina have to say , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " and do n't notice [me]0-i . "[0-i] " [You]0-i are not very polite , [[my]596-my sister dear]3949-my dear , but [I]596-my sister can make allowances . Oh , come ! come ! putting up [your]0-i hands to stop [your]0-i ears is too childish . [You]0-i would do better to express regret for having misled [[your]0-i father]3954-your father . Yes ! [you]0-i did mislead [him]3954-your father . Only a few days since , [you]0-i left [him]3954-your father to suppose that [you]0-i were engaged to [Philip]47-philip . It became [my]596-my sister duty , after that , to open [his]3954-your father eyes to the truth ; and if [I]596-my sister unhappily provoked [him]3954-your father , it was [your]0-i fault . [I]596-my sister was strictly careful in the language [I]596-my sister used . [I]596-my sister said : ' [Dear father]4681-dear father , [you]4681-dear father have been misinformed on a very serious subject . The only marriage engagement for which [your]4681-dear father kind sanction is requested , is [my]596-my sister engagement . [I]596-my sister have consented to become [Mrs. Philip Dunboyne]91-philip . ' "[596-my sister] " Stop ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " Why am [I]0-i to stop ? "[0-i] " Because [I]596-my sister have something to say . [You]0-i and [I]596-my sister are looking at [each other]3725-each other . Does [my]596-my sister face tell [you]0-i what is passing in [my]596-my sister mind ? "[596-my sister] " [Your]0-i face seems to be paler than usual , "[1672-she] [she]1672-she answered - " that 's all . "[1672-she] " No , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " that is not all . The devil that possessed [me]0-i , when [I]0-i discovered [you]0-i with [Philip]47-philip , is not cast out of [me]0-i yet . Silence [the sneering devil that is in [You]0-i]4683-the sneering devil that is in you , or [we]4684-we may both live to regret it . "[0-i] Whether [I]0-i did or did not frighten [her]1672-she , [I]0-i can not say . This only [I]0-i know - [she]1672-she turned away silently to the door , and went out . [I]0-i dropped on the sofa . That horrid hungering for revenge , which [I]0-i felt for the first time when [I]0-i knew how [Helena]52-helena had wronged [me]0-i , began to degrade and tempt [me]0-i again . In the effort to get away from this new evil self of [mine]0-i , [I]0-i tried to find sympathy in [Selina]96-selina , and called to [her]96-selina to come and sit by [me]0-i . [She]96-selina seemed to be startled when [I]0-i looked at [her]96-selina , but [she]96-selina recovered [herself]96-selina , and came to [me]0-i , and took [my]0-i hand . " [I]96-selina wish [I]96-selina could comfort [you]0-i ! "[96-selina] [she]96-selina said , in [her]96-selina kind simple way . " Keep [my]0-i hand in [your]96-selina hand , "[0-i] [I]0-i told [her]96-selina ; " [I]96-selina am drowning in [dark water]4685-dark water - and [I]96-selina have nothing to hold by but [you]96-selina . "[96-selina] " Oh , [[my]96-selina darling]350-my darling , do n't talk in that way ! "[96-selina] " [Good Selina]96-selina ! [dear Selina]96-selina ! [You]96-selina shall talk to [me]0-i . Say something harmless - tell [me]0-i a melancholy story - try to make [me]0-i cry . "[0-i] [[My]0-i poor little friend]1673-my poor little friend looked sadly bewildered . " [I]96-selina 'm more likely to cry [myself]96-selina , "[96-selina] [she]96-selina said . " This is so heart - breaking - [I]96-selina almost wish [I]96-selina was back in the time , before [you]96-selina came [home]258-home , the time when [[your]96-selina detestable sister]4688-your detestable sister first showed how [she]4688-your detestable sister hated [me]96-selina . [I]96-selina was happy , meanly happy , in the spiteful enjoyment of provoking [her]4688-your detestable sister . Oh , [Euneece]77-euneece , [I]96-selina shall never recover [my]96-selina spirits again ! All the pity in [the world]364-the world would not be pity enough for [you]96-selina . So hardly treated ! so young ! so forlorn ! [[Your]96-selina good father]4690-your good father too ill to help [you]96-selina ; [[your]96-selina poor mother]4691-your poor mother - "[96-selina] [I]0-i interrupted [her]1674-you ; [she]1674-you had interested [me]0-i in something better than [my]0-i own wretched self . [I]0-i asked directly if [she]1674-you had known [[my]0-i mother]833-my mother . " [[My]0-i dear child]3943-my dear child , [I]0-i never even saw [her]833-my mother ! "[0-i] " Has [[my]1674-you father]615-my father never spoken to [you]1674-you about [her]833-my mother ? "[1674-you] " Only once , when [I]0-i asked [him]615-my father how long [she]833-my mother had been dead . [He]615-my father told [me]0-i [you]1674-you lost [her]833-my mother while [you]1674-you were [an infant]3484-an infant , and [he]615-my father told [me]0-i no more . [I]0-i was looking at [her]833-my mother portrait in [the study]4243-the study , only yesterday . [I]0-i think it must be a bad portrait ; [[your]1674-you mother]4696-your mother 's face disappoints [me]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i had arrived at the same conclusion years since . But [I]0-i shrank from confessing it . " At any rate , "[96-selina] [Selina]96-selina continued , " [you]1674-you are not like [her]833-my mother . [Nobody]305-nobody would ever guess that [you]1674-you were [the child of [that lady]3768-that lady]4698-the child of that lady , with the long slanting forehead and the restless look in [her]833-my mother eyes . "[96-selina] What [Selina]96-selina had said of [me]0-i and [[my]0-i mother]833-my mother 's portrait , [other friends]1677-other friends had said . There was nothing that [I]0-i know of to interest [me]0-i in hearing it repeated - and yet it set [me]0-i pondering on the want of resemblance between [[my]0-i mother]833-my mother 's face and [mine]0-i , and wondering not for the first time what sort of woman [[my]0-i mother]833-my mother was . When [[my]0-i father]615-my father speaks of [her]833-my mother , no words of praise that [he]615-my father can utter seem to be good enough for [her]833-my mother . Oh , [me]0-i , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was a little more like [[my]0-i mother]833-my mother ! It began to get dark ; [Maria]64-maria brought in the lamp . The sudden brightness of the flame struck [my]0-i aching eyes , as if it had been a blow from a knife . [I]0-i was obliged to hide [my]0-i face in [my]0-i handkerchief . [Compassionate Selina]96-selina entreated [me]0-i to go to bed . " Rest [your]0-i poor eyes , [[my]96-selina child]242-my child , and [your]0-i weary head - and try at least to get some sleep . "[96-selina] [She]96-selina found [me]0-i very docile ; [I]0-i kissed [her]96-selina , and said good - night . [I]0-i had [my]0-i own idea . When all was quiet in [the house]314-the house , [I]0-i stole out into [the passage]4318-the passage and listened at the door of [[[my]0-i father]615-my father 's room]1685-my father 's room . [I]0-i heard [his]615-my father regular breathing , and opened the door and went in . The composing medicine , of which [I]0-i was in search , was not on the table by [his]615-my father bedside . [I]0-i found it in the cupboard - perhaps placed purposely out of [his]615-my father reach . [They]1686-they say that some physic is poison , if [you]1687-you take too much of it . The label on the bottle told [me]0-i what the dose was . [I]0-i dropped it into the medicine glass , and swallowed it , and went back to [[my]0-i father]615-my father . Very gently , so as not to wake [him]615-my father , [I]0-i touched [poor papa]1427-poor papa 's forehead with [my]0-i lips . " [I]0-i must have some of [your]615-my father medicine , "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered to [him]615-my father ; " [I]0-i want it , [dear]4177-dear , as badly as [you]615-my father do . "[0-i] Then [I]0-i returned to [[my]0-i own room]1690-my own room - and lay down in bed , waiting to be composed . CHAPTER XXXI . EUNICE 'S DIARY . [My]0-i restless nights are passed in [[Selina]96-selina 's room]1691-selina 's room . [Her]96-selina bed remains near the window . [My]0-i bed has been placed opposite , near the door . [Our]1692-our night - light is hidden in a corner , so that the faint glow of it is all that [we]1692-our see . What trifles these are to write about ! But [they]1693-they mix [themselves]1693-they up with what [I]0-i am determined to set down in [my]0-i Journal , and then to close the book for good and all . [I]0-i had not disturbed [[my]0-i little friend]1694-my little friend 's enviable repose , either when [I]0-i left [[our]1692-our bed - chamber]1695-our bed - chamber , or when [I]0-i returned to it . The night was quiet , and the stars were out . Nothing moved but the throbbing at [my]0-i temples . The lights and shadows in [[our]1692-our half - darkened room]1696-our half - darkened room , which at other times suggest strange resemblances to [my]0-i fancy , failed to disturb [me]0-i now . [I]0-i was in a darkness of [my]0-i own making , having bound a handkerchief , cooled with water , over [my]0-i hot eyes . There was nothing to interfere with the soothing influence of the dose that [I]0-i had taken , if [[my]0-i father]615-my father 's medicine would only help [me]0-i . [I]0-i began badly . The clock in [the hall]1431-the hall struck the quarter past the hour , the half - past , the three - quarters past , the new hour . Time was awake - and [I]0-i was awake with Time . It was such a trial to [my]0-i patience that [I]0-i thought of going back to [[[my]0-i father]615-my father 's room]1685-my father 's room , and taking a second dose of the medicine , no matter what the risk might be . On attempting to get up , [I]0-i became aware of a change in [me]0-i . There was a dull sensation in [my]0-i limbs which seemed to bind them down on the bed . It was the strangest feeling . [My]0-i will said , Get up - and [my]0-i heavy limbs said , No . [I]0-i lay quite still , thinking desperate thoughts , and getting nearer and nearer to the end that [I]0-i had been dreading for so many days past . Having been as well educated as [most girls]1701-most girls , [my]0-i lessons in history had made [me]0-i acquainted with assassination and murder . Horrors which [I]0-i had recoiled from reading in past happy days , now returned to [my]0-i memory ; and , this time , [they]1702-they interested instead of revolting [me]0-i . [I]0-i counted the three first ways of killing as [I]0-i happened to remember them , in [my]0-i books of instruction : - a way by stabbing ; a way by poison ; a way in a bed , by suffocation with a pillow . On that dreadful night , [I]0-i never once called to mind what [I]0-i find [myself]0-i remembering now - the harmless past time , when [[our]1703-our friends]669-our friends used to say : " [Eunice]53-eunice is [a good girl]973-a good girl ; [we]1703-our are all fond of [Eunice]53-eunice . "[669-our friends] Shall [I]0-i ever be [the same lovable creature]1705-the same lovable creature again ? While [I]0-i lay thinking , a strange thing happened . [Philip]47-philip , who had haunted [me]0-i for days and nights together , vanished out of [my]0-i thoughts . [My]0-i memory of the love which had begun so brightly , and had ended so miserably , became a blank . Nothing was left but [my]0-i own horrid visions of vengeance and death . For a while , the strokes of the clock still reached [my]0-i ears . But it was an effort to count them ; [I]0-i ended in letting them pass unheeded . Soon afterward , the round of [my]0-i thoughts began to circle slowly and more slowly . The strokes of the clock died out . The round of [my]0-i thoughts stopped . All this time , [my]0-i eyes were still covered by the handkerchief which [I]0-i had laid over them . The darkness began to weigh on [my]0-i spirits , and to fill [me]0-i with distrust . [I]0-i found [myself]0-i suspecting that there was some change - perhaps an unearthly change - passing over [the room]3541-the room . To remain blindfolded any longer was more than [I]0-i could endure . [I]0-i lifted [my]0-i hand - without being conscious of the heavy sensation which , some time before , had laid [my]0-i limbs helpless on the bed - [I]0-i lifted [my]0-i hand , and drew the handkerchief away from [my]0-i eyes . The faint glow of the night - light was extinguished . But [the room]3541-the room was not quite dark . There was a ghastly light trembling over it ; like nothing that [I]0-i have ever seen by day ; like nothing that [I]0-i have ever seen by night . [I]0-i dimly discerned [Selina]96-selina 's bed , and the frame of the window , and the curtains on either side of [it]3541-the room - but not the starlight , and not the shadowy tops of the trees in [the garden]637-the garden . The light grew fainter and fainter ; the objects in [the room]3541-the room faded slowly away . Darkness came . It may be a saying hard to believe - but , when [I]0-i declare that [I]0-i was not frightened , [I]0-i am telling the truth . Whether [the room]3541-the room was lighted by awful light , or sunk in awful dark , [I]0-i was equally interested in the expectation of what might happen next . [I]0-i listened calmly for what [I]0-i might hear : [I]0-i waited calmly for what [I]0-i might feel . A touch came first . [I]0-i feel it creeping on [my]0-i face - like a little fluttering breeze . The sensation pleased [me]0-i for a while . Soon it grew colder , and colder , and colder , till it froze [me]0-i . " Oh , no more ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried out . " [You]4703-you are killing [me]0-i with an icy death ! "[0-i] The dead - cold touches lingered a moment longer - and left [me]0-i . The first sound came . It was the sound of a whisper on [my]0-i pillow , close to [my]0-i ear . [My]0-i strange insensibility to fear remained undisturbed . The whisper was welcome , it kept [me]0-i company in [the dark room]1711-the dark room . [It]1712-it said to [me]0-i : " Do [you]0-i know who [I]1712-it am ? "[1712-it] [I]0-i answered : " No . "[1712-it] [It]1712-it said : " Who have [you]0-i been thinking of this evening ? "[1712-it] [I]0-i answered : " [[My]0-i mother]833-my mother . "[0-i] [The whisper]1713-the whisper said : " [I]1713-the whisper am [[your]0-i mother]4696-your mother . "[1713-the whisper] " Oh , [mother]4706-mother , command the light to come back ! Show [yourself]0-i to [me]1713-the whisper ! "[1713-the whisper] " No . "[1713-the whisper] " Why not ? "[1713-the whisper] " [My]1713-the whisper face was hidden when [I]1713-the whisper passed from life to death . [My]1713-the whisper face [no mortal creature]4707-no mortal creature may see . "[1713-the whisper] " Oh , [mother]4706-mother , touch [me]1713-the whisper ! Kiss [me]1713-the whisper ! "[1713-the whisper] " No . "[1713-the whisper] " Why not ? "[1713-the whisper] " [My]1713-the whisper touch is poison . [My]1713-the whisper kiss is death . "[1713-the whisper] The sense of fear began to come to [me]0-i now . [I]0-i moved [my]0-i head away on the pillow . The whisper followed [my]0-i movement . " Leave [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [You]0-i are [an Evil Spirit]4709-an evil spirit . "[0-i] [The whisper]1713-the whisper answered : " [I]1713-the whisper am [[your]0-i mother]4696-your mother . "[1713-the whisper] " [You]0-i come to tempt [me]1713-the whisper . "[1713-the whisper] " [I]1713-the whisper come to harden [your]0-i heart . Daughter of [mine]1713-the whisper , whose blood is cool ; daughter of [mine]1713-the whisper , who tamely submits - [you]0-i have loved . Is it true ? "[1713-the whisper] " It is true . "[1713-the whisper] " [The man [you]0-i loved]4711-the man you loved has deserted [you]0-i . Is it true ? "[1713-the whisper] " It is true . "[1713-the whisper] " [A woman]222-a woman has lured [him]4711-the man you loved away to [herself]222-a woman . [A woman]222-a woman has had no mercy on [you]0-i , or on [him]4711-the man you loved . Is it true ? "[1713-the whisper] " It is true . "[1713-the whisper] " If [she]222-a woman lives , what crime toward [you]0-i will [she]222-a woman commit next ? "[1713-the whisper] " If [she]222-a woman lives , [she]222-a woman will marry [him]4711-the man you loved . "[1713-the whisper] " Will [you]0-i let [her]222-a woman live ? "[1713-the whisper] " Never . "[1713-the whisper] " Have [I]1713-the whisper hardened [your]0-i heart against [her]222-a woman ? "[1713-the whisper] " Yes . "[1713-the whisper] " Will [you]0-i kill [her]222-a woman ? "[1713-the whisper] " Show [me]1713-the whisper how . "[1713-the whisper] There was a sudden silence . [I]0-i was still left in the darkness ; feeling nothing , hearing nothing . Even the consciousness that [I]0-i was lying on [my]0-i bed deserted [me]0-i . [I]0-i had no idea that [I]0-i was in [the bedroom]1590-the bedroom ; [I]0-i had no knowledge of where [I]0-i was . The ghastly light that [I]0-i had seen already dawned on [me]0-i once more . [I]0-i was no longer in [my]0-i bed , no longer in [[my]0-i room]3615-my room , no longer in [the house]314-the house . Without wonder , without even a feeling of surprise , [I]0-i looked round . [The place]3869-the place was familiar to [me]0-i . [I]0-i was alone in [the Museum of [our town]511-our town]1719-the museum of our town . The light flowed along in front of [me]0-i . [I]0-i followed , from room to room in [the Museum]1721-the museum , where the light led . First , through [the picture - gallery]1722-the picture - gallery , hung with the works of modern masters ; then , through [the room]3541-the room filled with specimens of stuffed animals . The lion and the tiger , the vulture of [the Alps]19-the alps and the great albatross , looked like living creatures threatening [me]0-i , in the supernatural light . [I]0-i entered [the third room]1724-the third room , devoted to the exhibition of ancient armor , and the weapons of [all nations]1725-all nations . Here the light rose higher , and , leaving [me]0-i in darkness where [I]0-i stood , showed a collection of swords , daggers , and knives arranged on the wall in imitation of the form of a star . The whisper sounded again , close at [my]0-i ear . It echoed [my]0-i own thought , when [I]0-i called to mind the ways of killing which history had taught [me]0-i . It said : " Kill [her]4714-her with the knife . "[0-i] No . [My]0-i heart failed [me]0-i when [I]0-i thought of the blood . [I]0-i hid the dreadful weapons from [my]0-i view . [I]0-i cried out : " Let [me]0-i go ! let [me]0-i go ! "[0-i] Again , [I]0-i was lost in darkness . Again , [I]0-i had no knowledge in [me]0-i of where [I]0-i was . Again , after an interval , the light showed [me]0-i the new place in which [I]0-i stood . [I]0-i was alone in [the burial - ground of [[our]1727-our parish church]1728-our parish church]1726-the burial - ground of our parish church . The light led [me]0-i on , among the graves , to the lonely corner in which the great yew tree stands ; and , rising higher , revealed the solemn foliage , brightened by the fatal red fruit which hides in itself the seeds of death . The whisper tempted [me]0-i again . It followed again the train of [my]0-i own thought . [It]1729-it said : " Kill [her]52-helena by poison . "[1729-it] No . Revenge by poison steals its way to its end . The base deceitfulness of [Helena]52-helena 's crime against [me]0-i seemed to call for a day of reckoning that hid itself under no disguise . [I]0-i raised [my]0-i cry to be delivered from the sight of the deadly tree . The changes which [I]0-i have tried to describe followed once more the confession of what [I]0-i felt ; the darkness was dispelled for the third time . [I]0-i was standing in [[Helena]52-helena 's room]1730-helena 's room , looking at [her]52-helena as [she]52-helena lay asleep in [her]52-helena bed . [She]52-helena was quite still now ; but [she]52-helena must have been restless at some earlier time . The bedclothes were disordered , [her]52-helena head had sunk so low that the pillow rose high and vacant above [her]52-helena . There , colored by a tender flush of sleep , was the face whose beauty put [my]0-i poor face to shame . There , was [the sister who had committed the worst of murders]1731-the sister who had committed the worst of murders - [the wretch who had killed in [me]0-i all that made life worth having]1732-the wretch who had killed in me all that made life worth having . While that thought was in [my]0-i mind , [I]0-i heard the whisper again . " Kill [her]52-helena openly , "[1733-the tempter mother] [the tempter mother]1733-the tempter mother said . " Kill [her]52-helena daringly . Faint heart , do [you]0-i still want courage ? Rouse [your]0-i spirit ; look ! see [yourself]0-i in the act ! "[1733-the tempter mother] The temptation took a form which now tried [me]0-i for the first time . As if a mirror had reflected the scene , [I]0-i saw [myself]0-i standing by the bedside , with the pillow that was to smother [the sleeper]1734-the sleeper in [my]0-i hands . [I]0-i heard the whispering voice telling [me]0-i how to speak the words that warned and condemned [her]52-helena : " Wake ! [you]0-i who have taken [him]3581-the man from [me]0-i ! Wake ! and meet [your]0-i doom . "[0-i] [I]0-i saw [her]52-helena start up in bed . The sudden movement disordered the nightdress over [her]52-helena bosom and showed the miniature portrait of [a man]3697-a man , hung round [her]52-helena neck . [The man]3581-the man was [Philip]47-philip . The likeness was looking at [me]0-i . So dear , so lovely - those eyes that had once been the light of [my]0-i heart , mourned for [me]0-i and judged [me]0-i now . [They]1737-me saw the guilty thought that polluted [me]0-i ; [they]1737-me brought [me]0-i to [my]0-i knees , imploring [him]3581-the man to help [me]0-i back to [my]0-i better self : " One last mercy , [dear]4177-dear , to comfort [me]1737-me under the loss of [you]4177-dear . Let the love that was once [my]1737-me life , be [[my]1737-me good angel]4716-my good angel still . Save [me]1737-me , [Philip]47-philip , even though [you]47-philip forsake [me]1737-me - save [me]1737-me from [myself]1737-me ! "[1737-me] ....... There was a sudden cry . The agony of it pierced [my]0-i brain - drove away the ghastly light - silenced the tempting whispers . [I]0-i came to [myself]0-i . [I]0-i saw - and not in a dream . [Helena]52-helena had started up in [her]52-helena bed . That cry of terror , at the sight of [me]0-i in [[her]52-helena room]1655-her room at night , had burst from [her]52-helena lips . The miniature of [Philip]47-philip hung round [her]52-helena neck , a visible reality . Though [my]0-i head was dizzy , though [my]0-i heart was sinking , [I]0-i had not lost [my]0-i senses yet . All that the night lamp could show [me]0-i , [I]0-i still saw ; and [I]0-i heard the sound , faintly , when the door of [the bed - chamber]1739-the bed - chamber was opened . Alarmed by that piercing cry , [[my]0-i father]615-my father came hurrying into [the room]3541-the room . Not a word passed between [us]1742-us three . The whispers that [I]0-i had heard were wicked ; the thoughts that had been in [my]0-i mind were vile . Had [they]1743-they left some poison in the air of [the room]3541-the room , which killed the words on [our]1742-us lips ? [[My]0-i father]615-my father looked at [Helena]52-helena . With a trembling hand [she]52-helena pointed to [me]0-i . [He]615-my father put [his]615-my father arm round [me]0-i and held [me]0-i up . [I]0-i remember [his]615-my father leading [me]0-i away - and [I]0-i remember nothing more . [My]0-i last words are written . [I]0-i lock up this journal of misery - never , [I]0-i hope and pray , to open it again . - - Second Period continued . EVENTS IN [THE FAMILY]550-the family , RELATED BY [THE GOVERNOR]148-the governor . - - CHAPTER XXXII . [THE MIDDLE - AGED LADY]1748-the middle - aged lady . In the year 1870 [I]0-i found [myself]0-i compelled to submit to the demands of [two hard task - masters]1749-two hard task - masters . Advancing age and failing health reminded [the Governor of [the Prison]147-the prison]1750-the governor of the prison of [his]1750-the governor of the prison duty to [[his]1750-the governor of the prison successor]1752-his successor , in one unanswerable word - Resign . When [they]1753-they have employed [us]1754-us and interested [us]1754-us , for the greater part of [our]1754-us lives , [we]1754-us bid farewell to [our]1754-us duties - even to the gloomy duties of [a prison]3518-a prison - with a sense of regret . [My]0-i view of the future presented a vacant prospect indeed , when [I]0-i looked at [my]0-i idle life to come , and wondered what [I]0-i should do with it . Loose on [the world]364-the world - at [my]0-i age ! - [I]0-i drifted into [domestic refuge]1757-domestic refuge , under the care of [[my]0-i two dear and [good sons]1759-good sons]1758-my two dear and good sons . After a while never mind how long a while [I]0-i began to grow restless under the heavy burden of idleness . Having nothing else to complain of , [I]0-i complained of [my]0-i health , and consulted [a doctor]1760-a doctor . [That sagacious man]1761-that sagacious man hit on the right way of getting rid of [me]0-i - [he]1761-that sagacious man recommended traveling . This was unexpected advice . After some hesitation , [I]0-i accepted it reluctantly . [The instincts of age]1762-the instincts of age recoil from making new acquaintances , contemplating new places , and adopting new habits . Besides , [I]0-i hate railway traveling . However , [I]0-i contrived to get as far as [Italy]2-italy , and stopped to rest at [Florence]20-florence . Here , [I]0-i found pictures by [the old masters]1763-the old masters that [I]0-i could really enjoy , [a public park that [I]0-i could honestly admire]1764-a public park that i could honestly admire , and [an excellent friend and colleague of former days]1765-an excellent friend and colleague of former days ; once [chaplain to [the prison]147-the prison]1766-chaplain to the prison , now [clergyman in charge of [the English Church]1769-the english church]1768-clergyman in charge of the english church . [We]1770-we met in [the gallery of the Pitti Palace]1771-the gallery of the pitti palace ; and [he]1761-that sagacious man recognized [me]0-i immediately . [I]0-i was pleased to find that the lapse of years had made so little difference in [my]0-i personal appearance . [The traveler who advances as far as [Florence]20-florence , and does not go on to [Rome]21-rome]1772-the traveler who advances as far as florence , and does not go on to rome , must be regardless indeed of the opinions of [[his]1772-the traveler who advances as far as florence , and does not go on to rome friends]570-his friends . Let [me]0-i not attempt to conceal it - [I]0-i am [that insensible traveler]1774-that insensible traveler . Over and over again , [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i : " [Rome]21-rome must be done "[0-i] ; and over and over again [I]0-i put off doing it . To own the truth , the fascinations of [Florence]20-florence , aided by [the society of [[my]0-i friend]3475-my friend]1775-the society of my friend , laid so strong a hold on [me]0-i that [I]0-i believe [I]0-i should have ended [my]0-i days in [the delightful Italian city]1777-the delightful italian city , but for the dangerous illness of [one of [[my]0-i sons]3494-my sons]1778-one of my sons . This misfortune hurried [me]0-i back to [England]4-england , in dread , every step of the way , of finding that [I]0-i had arrived too late . The journey thank [God]38-god ! proved to have been taken without need . [[My]0-i son]1780-my son was no longer in danger , when [I]0-i reached [London]3-london in the year 1875 . At that date [I]0-i was near enough to the customary limit of human life to feel the necessity of rest and quiet . In other words , [my]0-i days of travel had come to their end . Having established [myself]0-i in [[my]0-i own country]1781-my own country , [I]0-i did not forget to let [old friends]755-old friends know where [they]755-old friends might find [me]0-i . Among those to whom [I]0-i wrote was [another colleague of past years , who still held [his]1783-another colleague of past years , who still held his medical appointment in the prison medical appointment in [the prison]147-the prison]1783-another colleague of past years , who still held his medical appointment in the prison . When [I]0-i received [the doctor]162-the doctor 's reply , it inclosed a letter directed to [me]0-i at [[my]0-i old quarters]1786-my old quarters in [[the Governor]148-the governor 's rooms]4187-the governor 's rooms . "[3443-sir] Either way , [my]0-i reply might lead to serious consequences . [I]0-i hesitated . [He]3443-sir threatened [me]0-i with [his]3443-sir poor feeble hand . It was only the anger of a moment ; [his]3443-sir humor changed to supplication . [He]3443-sir reminded [me]0-i piteously of bygone days : " [You]0-i used to be [a kind - hearted man]4771-a kind - hearted man . Has age hardened [you]0-i ? "[0-i] [He]3443-sir sank back gently in [his]3443-sir chair . " Oh , the relief of it ! "[3443-sir] [he]3443-sir said . "[77-euneece] The wretched English language is n't half strong enough for [me]0-i , " [she]66-miss jillgall declared with a look of fury . [I]77-euneece took a liberty . " CHAPTER XXXV . [THE FUTURE]4851-the future LOOKS GLOOMY . " [My]0-i interest as [a man]3697-a man and , what is more , [an old man in the coming disclosure]4858-an old man in the coming disclosure was too serious to be trifled with in this way . Is it the good or the evil fortune of [mortals]4860-mortals that the comic side of life , and the serious side of life , are perpetually in collision with each other ? [We]4861-we burst out laughing , at a moment of grave importance to [us]4861-we both . Perfectly inappropriate , and perfectly natural . But [we]4861-we were neither of [us]4861-we philosophers , and [we]4861-we were ashamed of [our]4861-we own merriment the moment it had ceased . [The writer]1794-the writer - [an Irish gentleman]4867-an irish gentleman , named [Dunboyne]47-philip confided to [me]47-philip that [his]1794-the writer marriage had associated [him]1794-the writer with [the murderess]3525-the murderess , who had then been recently executed , as [brother - in - law]4869-brother - in - law to [that infamous woman]4870-that infamous woman . What [a wife]4022-a wife and what [a mother]223-a mother was lost there - and all for want of a pretty face ! Could [we]4912-we rejoice in an act of infidelity which had embittered and darkened the gentle harmless life of [the victim]4921-the victim ? Or could [we]4912-we , on the other hand , encourage the ruthless deceit , the hateful treachery , which had put [the wicked Helena]52-helena - with no exposure to dread if [she]52-helena married - into [[her]52-helena wronged sister]4922-her wronged sister 's place ? Impossible ! In the one case as in the other , impossible ! Equally hopeless did the prospect appear , when [I]0-i tried to determine what [my]0-i own individual course of action ought to be . In [my]0-i calmer moments , the idea had occurred to [my]0-i mind of going to [Dunboyne]47-philip the younger , and , if [he]47-philip had any sense of shame left , exerting [my]0-i influence to lead [him]47-philip back to [[his]47-philip betrothed wife]4923-his betrothed wife . How could [I]0-i now do this , consistently with [my]0-i duty to [[the young man]4367-the young man 's father]4925-the young man 's father ; knowing what [I]0-i knew , and not forgetting that [I]0-i had [myself]0-i advised [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu to keep the truth concealed , when [I]0-i was equally ignorant of [Philip Dunboyne]47-philip 's parentage and of [Helena Gracedieu]52-helena 's treachery ? Even if events so ordered it that the marriage of [Eunice]53-eunice might yet take place - without any interference exerted to produce that result , one way or the other , on [my]0-i part - it would be just as impossible for [me]0-i to speak out now , as it had been in the long - past years when [I]0-i had so cautiously answered [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip 's letter . But what would [he]47-philip think of [me]0-i if accident led , sooner or later , to the disclosure which [I]0-i had felt bound to conceal ? The more [I]0-i tried to forecast the chances of the future , the darker and the darker was the view that faced [me]0-i . To [my]0-i sinking heart and wearied mind , [good Dame Nature]102-good dame nature presented a more acceptable prospect , when [I]0-i happened to look out of the window of [[my]0-i room]3615-my room . There [I]0-i saw the trees and flowerbeds of [a garden]4927-a garden , tempting [me]0-i irresistibly under the cloudless sunshine of a fine day . [I]0-i was on [my]0-i way out , to recover heart and hope , when a knock at the door stopped [me]0-i . Had [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall returned ? When [I]0-i said "[0-i] Come in , " [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu opened the door , and entered [the room]3541-the room . [I]0-i waited anxiously for what [he]63-mr. gracedieu might say to [me]0-i next . CHAPTER XXXVI . [THE WANDERING MIND]103-the wandering mind . For the moment , [the Minister]161-the minister disappointed [me]0-i . Without speaking , without even looking up , [he]63-mr. gracedieu took out [his]63-mr. gracedieu pocketbook , and began to write in it . Constantly interrupted either by a trembling in the hand that held the pencil , or by a difficulty as [I]0-i imagined in expressing thoughts imperfectly realized - [his]63-mr. gracedieu patience gave way ; [he]63-mr. gracedieu dashed the book on the floor . "[0-i] [My]0-i mind is gone ! " [he]63-mr. gracedieu burst out . "[0-i] Oh , [Father]3936-father in Heaven , let death deliver [me]0-i from [a body without a mind]1979-a body without a mind ! " Who could hear [him]63-mr. gracedieu , and be guilty of the cruelty of preaching self - control ? [I]1980-you picked up the pocketbook , and offered to help [him]63-mr. gracedieu . "[1980-you] Do [you]1980-you think [you]1980-you can ? " [he]63-mr. gracedieu asked . "[0-i] [I]0-i can at least try . " "[0-i] [Good fellow]1981-good fellow ! What should [I]0-i do without [you]1981-good fellow ? See now ; here is [my]0-i difficulty . [I]0-i have got so many things to say , [I]0-i want to separate them - or else [they]1982-i will all run into [each other]3725-each other . Look at the book , " [[my]1982-i poor friend]4933-my poor friend said mournfully ; "[1982-i] [they]1982-i have run into [each other]3725-each other in spite of [me]0-i . " The entries proved to be nearly incomprehensible . Here and there [I]1982-i discovered some scattered words , which showed themselves more or less distinctly in the midst of the surrounding confusion . The first word that [I]1982-i could make out was "[1982-i] Education . " Helped by that hint , [I]1982-i trusted to guess - work to guide [me]1982-i in speaking to [him]1981-good fellow . It was necessary to be positive , or [he]1981-good fellow would have lost all faith in [me]1982-i . "[1982-i] Well ? " [he]1981-good fellow said impatiently . "[1982-i] Well , " [I]1981-good fellow answered , "[1981-good fellow] [you]1981-good fellow have something to say to [me]0-i about the education which [you]1981-good fellow have given to [[your]1981-good fellow daughters]1985-your daughters . " "[1981-good fellow] Do n't put them together ! " [he]1981-good fellow cried . "[4177-dear] [Dear]4177-dear , patient , [sweet Eunice]53-eunice must not be confounded with that [she]1987-she - devil - " "[1987-she] Hush , hush , [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu ! Think for a moment of what [she]52-helena has done - and then think of the religious education that [I]0-i have given [her]52-helena . Heartless ! Deceitful ! [The most ignorant creature in [the lowest dens of [this town]3450-this town]1991-the lowest dens of this town]1990-the most ignorant creature in the lowest dens of this town could have done nothing more basely cruel . And this , after years on years of patient Christian instruction on [my]0-i part ! What is religion ? What is education ? [I]0-i read a horrible book once [I]0-i forget who was [the author]1993-the author ; it called religion superstition , and education empty form . [I]0-i do n't know ; upon [my]0-i word [I]0-i do n't know that the book may not - Oh , [my]0-i tongue ! Why do n't [I]0-i keep a guard over [my]0-i tongue ? Are [you]3443-sir [a father]475-a father , too ? Do n't interrupt [me]0-i . Put [yourself]3443-sir in [my]0-i place , and think of it . Heartless , deceitful , and [[my]0-i daughter]249-my daughter . Give [me]0-i the pocketbook ; [I]0-i want to see which memorandum comes first . " [He]0-i had now wrought [himself]0-i into a state of excitement , which relieved [his]0-i spirits of the depression that had weighed on [them]4934-them up to this time . [His]0-i harmless vanity , always , as [I]1996-minister suspect , a latent quality in [his]0-i kindly nature , had already restored [his]0-i confidence . "[1996-minister] Ah , yes ; ' M ' stands for [Minister]1996-minister ; [I]0-i come first . Am [I]0-i to blame ? Am [I]0-i - [God]38-god forgive [me]0-i [my]0-i many sins - am [I]0-i heartless ? " "[2007-your wife 's child] Where does [her]1999-her wickedness come from ? " [he]1997-my good friend went on . "[3501-her mother] Not from [[her]1999-her mother]3501-her mother ; not from [me]0-i ; not from a neglected education . " [He]1997-my good friend suddenly stepped up to [me]3501-her mother and laid [his]1997-my good friend hands on [my]3501-her mother shoulders ; [his]1997-my good friend voice dropped to hoarse , moaning , awestruck tones . " It was so evidently desirable to prevent any continuation of such a train of thought as this , that [I]0-i could feel no hesitation in interrupting [him]1997-my good friend . "[0-i] Will [you]1997-my good friend hear what [I]0-i have to say ? " [I]0-i asked bluntly . "[0-i] [You]0-i are [the most eloquent man [I]0-i know]2009-the most eloquent man i know , with one exception - [myself]0-i . Of course - [myself]0-i . " "[0-i] It is mere waste of time , " [I]0-i continued , "[0-i] to regret the excellent education which [[your]1997-my good friend daughter]4519-your daughter has misused . " Making that reply , [I]0-i was tempted to add another word of truth . All education is at the mercy of two powerful counter - influences : the influence of temperament , and the influence of circumstances . But this was philosophy . How could [I]0-i expect [him]1997-my good friend to submit to philosophy ? "[0-i] What [we]2011-we know of [Miss Helena]52-helena , " [I]0-i went on , "[0-i] must be enough for [us]2011-we . "[0-i] [You]1997-my good friend must do more than that , [sir]3443-sir , " [I]1997-my good friend told [him]1997-my good friend . Let [me]0-i offer [you]3443-sir the writing materials which [I]0-i use in traveling . " [I]0-i placed them before [him]2019-this man . [He]2019-this man took up the pen ; [he]2019-this man arranged the paper ; [he]2019-this man was eager to begin . After writing a few words , [he]2019-this man stopped - reflected - tried again - stopped again - tore up the little that [he]2019-this man had done - and began a new letter , ending in the same miserable result . It was impossible to witness [his]2019-this man helplessness , to see how pitiably patient [he]2019-this man was over [his]2019-this man own incapacity , and to let the melancholy spectacle go on . [I]0-i proposed to write the letter ; authenticating it , of course , by [his]2019-this man signature . When [he]2019-this man allowed [me]0-i to take the pen , [he]2019-this man turned away [his]2019-this man face , ashamed to let [me]0-i see what [he]2019-this man suffered . Was this [the same man]4941-the same man , whose great nature had so nobly asserted itself in [the condemned cell]270-the condemned cell ? Poor mortality ! The letter was easily written . [I]0-i had only to inform [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip of [[his]47-philip son]3903-his son 's conduct ; repeating , in the plainest language that [I]0-i could use , what [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall had related to [me]0-i . " In silence , [the Minister]161-the minister read the letter , and attached [his]63-mr. gracedieu signature to it . In silence , [he]63-mr. gracedieu rose and took [my]47-philip arm . Crushed by the miserable discovery of the decay of [his]63-mr. gracedieu own faculties ! What could [I]47-philip do ? what could [I]47-philip say ? Nothing ! [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall was in [the drawing - room]4218-the drawing - room . With the necessary explanations , [I]47-philip showed [her]66-miss jillgall the letter . But as to the other qualifications , how hopeful is the prospect ! Good principles , and good temper ? Ha ! ha ! [Helena]52-helena has the principles of [Jezebel]104-jezebel , and the temper of [Lady Macbeth]105-lady macbeth . " After dashing off this striking sketch of character , [the fair artist]4954-the fair artist asked to look at [my]105-lady macbeth letter again , and observed that the address was wanting . In that case , do [you]2029-you think [your]2029-you letter would get to [London]3-london ? [I]0-i am afraid [you]2029-you detect a faint infusion of spitefulness in that question . Oh , for shame ! [I]0-i 'll post the letter [myself]0-i . " CHAPTER XXXVII . [THE SHAMELESS SISTER]106-the shameless sister . For some reason , which [[my]0-i unassisted penetration]4955-my unassisted penetration was unable to discover , [Miss Helena Gracedieu]52-helena kept out of [my]0-i way . At dinner , on the day of [my]0-i arrival , and at breakfast on the next morning , [she]52-helena was present of course ; ready to make [herself]52-helena agreeable in a modest way , and provided with the necessary supply of cheerful small - talk . But the meal having come to an end , [she]52-helena had [her]52-helena domestic excuse ready , and unostentatiously disappeared like [a well - bred young lady]4956-a well - bred young lady . [I]0-i never met [her]52-helena on the stairs , never found [myself]0-i intruding on [her]52-helena in [the drawing - room]4218-the drawing - room , never caught [her]52-helena getting out of [my]0-i way in [the garden]637-the garden . As much at a loss for an explanation of these mysteries as [I]0-i was , [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall 's interest in [my]0-i welfare led [her]66-miss jillgall to caution [me]0-i in a vague and general way . "[0-i] Take [my]0-i word for it , [dear Mr. Governor]43-mr. governor , [she]2032-she has some design on [you]43-mr. governor . Will [you]43-mr. governor allow [an insignificant old maid]2033-an insignificant old maid to offer a suggestion ? Oh , thank [you]43-mr. governor ; [I]0-i will venture to advise . Please look back at [your]43-mr. governor experience of [the very worst female prisoner [you]43-mr. governor ever had to deal with]2034-the very worst female prisoner you ever had to deal with - and be guided accordingly if [Helena]52-helena catches [you]43-mr. governor at a private interview . " In less than half an hour afterward , [Helena]52-helena caught [me]52-helena . [I]52-helena was writing in [[my]52-helena room]3615-my room , when [the maidservant]4960-the maidservant came in with a message : "[52-helena] [Miss Helena]52-helena 's compliments , [sir]3443-sir , and would [you]3443-sir please spare [her]52-helena half an hour , [downstairs]4170-downstairs ? " [My]3443-sir first excuse was of course that [I]3443-sir was engaged . This was disposed of by a second message , provided beforehand , no doubt , for an anticipated refusal : "[3443-sir] [Miss Helena]52-helena wished [me]0-i to say , [sir]3443-sir , that [her]52-helena time is [your]3443-sir time . " [I]0-i was still obstinate ; [I]0-i pleaded next that [my]0-i day was filled up . A third message had evidently been prepared , even for this emergency : "[0-i] [Miss Helena]52-helena will regret , [sir]3443-sir , having the pleasure deferred , but [she]52-helena will leave [you]3443-sir to make [your]3443-sir own appointment for to - morrow . " Persistency so inveterate as this led to a result which [[Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu 's cautious daughter]4961-mr. gracedieu 's cautious daughter had not perhaps contemplated : it put [me]52-helena on [my]52-helena guard . There seemed to be a chance , to say the least of it , that [I]52-helena might serve [Eunice]53-eunice 's interests if [I]52-helena discovered what [the enemy]4885-the enemy had to say . [I]52-helena locked up [my]52-helena writing - declared [myself]52-helena incapable of putting [Miss Helena]52-helena to needless inconvenience - and followed [the maid]4963-the maid to [the lower floor of [the house]314-the house]4964-the lower floor of the house . [The room to which [I]52-helena was conducted]4966-the room to which i was conducted proved to be empty . [I]52-helena looked round [me]52-helena . If [I]52-helena had been told that [a man lived [there]4103-there]4967-a man lived there who was absolutely indifferent to appearances , [I]52-helena should have concluded that [his]4967-a man lived there views were faithfully represented by [[his]4967-a man lived there place of abode]4969-his place of abode . The chairs and tables reminded [me]52-helena of [a railway waiting - room]4970-a railway waiting - room . The shabby little bookcase was the mute record of a life indifferent to literature . The carpet was of that dreadful drab color , still the cherished favorite of [the average English mind]4971-the average english mind , in spite of every protest that can be entered against it , on behalf of Art . The ceiling , recently whitewashed ; made [my]52-helena eyes ache when [they]4972-they looked at it . On either side of the window , flaccid green curtains hung helplessly with nothing to loop them up . The writing - desk and the paper - case , viewed as specimens of woodwork , recalled the ready - made bedrooms on show in [cheap shops]4973-cheap shops . The books , mostly in slate - colored bindings , were devoted to the literature which is called religious ; [I]52-helena only discovered three worldly publications among them - Domestic Cookery , Etiquette for [Ladies]3532-ladies , and Hints on the Breeding of Poultry . An ugly little clock , ticking noisily in a black case , and two candlesticks of base metal placed on either side of it , completed the ornaments on the chimney - piece . Neither pictures nor prints hid the barrenness of the walls . [I]52-helena saw no needlework and no flowers . The one object in the place which showed any pretensions to beauty was a looking - glass in an elegant gilt frame - sacred to vanity , and worthy of [the office that [it]4103-there filled]4975-the office that it filled . Such was [[Helena Gracedieu]52-helena 's sitting - room]4976-helena gracedieu 's sitting - room . [I]52-helena really could not help thinking : How like [her]52-helena ! [She]52-helena came in with a face perfectly adapted to the circumstances - pleased and smiling ; amiably deferential , in consideration of the claims of [[[her]52-helena father]614-her father 's guest]4978-her father 's guest - and , to [my]52-helena surprise , in some degree suggestive of one of [those incorrigible female prisoners , to whom [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall had referred [me]52-helena when [she]66-miss jillgall offered a word of advice]4979-those incorrigible female prisoners , to whom miss jillgall had referred me when she offered a word of advice . "[52-helena] How kind of [you]2039-you to come so soon ! Excuse [my]0-i receiving [you]2039-you in [[my]0-i housekeeping - room]2040-my housekeeping - room ; [we]2041-we shall not be interrupted [here]225-here . Very plainly furnished , is it not ? [I]0-i dislike ostentation and display . Ornaments are out of place in [a room devoted to domestic necessities]2043-a room devoted to domestic necessities . [I]0-i hate domestic necessities . [You]2039-you notice the looking - glass ? It 's a present . [I]0-i should never have put such a thing up . Perhaps [my]0-i vanity excuses it . " [She]66-miss jillgall pointed the last remark by a look at [herself]66-miss jillgall in the glass ; using it , while [she]66-miss jillgall despised it . Yes : there was a handsome face , paying [her]66-miss jillgall its reflected compliment - but not so well matched as it might have been by [a handsome figure]4980-a handsome figure . [Her]66-miss jillgall feet were too large ; [her]66-miss jillgall shoulders were too high ; the graceful undulations of [a well - made girl]4981-a well - made girl were absent when [she]66-miss jillgall walked ; and [her]66-miss jillgall bosom was , to [my]0-i mind , unduly developed for [her]66-miss jillgall time of life . [She]66-miss jillgall sat down by [me]0-i with [her]66-miss jillgall back to the light . Happening to be opposite to the window , [I]0-i offered [her]66-miss jillgall the advantage of a clear view of [my]0-i face . [She]66-miss jillgall waited for [me]0-i , and [I]0-i waited for [her]66-miss jillgall - and there was an awkward pause before [we]2044-two people spoke . [She]66-miss jillgall set the example . "[0-i] Is n't it curious ? " [she]66-miss jillgall remarked . "[0-i] When [two people]2044-two people have something particular to say to each other , and nothing to hinder [them]2044-two people , [they]2044-two people never seem to know how to say it . [You]2045-you are the oldest , [sir]3443-sir . Why do n't [you]3443-sir begin ? " "[3443-sir] Because [I]0-i have nothing particular to say . " "[0-i] In plain words , [you]0-i mean that [I]0-i must begin ? " "[0-i] If [you]0-i please . " "[0-i] Very well . [I]0-i want to know whether [I]0-i have given [you]2045-you and [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall , of course as much time as [you]2045-you want , and as many opportunities as [you]2045-you could desire ? " "[0-i] Pray go on , [Miss Helena]52-helena . " "[52-helena] Have [I]0-i not said enough already ? " "[0-i] Not enough , [I]0-i regret to say , to convey [your]2045-you meaning to [me]0-i . " [She]66-miss jillgall drew [her]66-miss jillgall chair a little further away from [me]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i am sadly disappointed , " [she]66-miss jillgall said . "[0-i] [I]0-i had such a high opinion of [your]2045-you perfect candor . [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i : There is such a striking expression of frankness in [his]2047-his face . Another illusion gone ! [I]0-i hope [you]2045-you wo n't think [I]0-i am offended , if [I]0-i say a bold word . [I]0-i am only [a young girl]4091-a young girl , to be sure ; but [I]0-i am not quite such a fool as [you]2045-you take [me]0-i for . Do [you]2045-you really think [I]0-i do n't know that [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall has been telling [you]2045-you everything that is bad about [me]0-i ; putting every mistake that [I]0-i have made , every fault that [I]0-i have committed , in the worst possible point of view ? And [you]2045-you have listened to [her]66-miss jillgall - quite naturally ! And [you]2045-you are prejudiced , strongly prejudiced , against [me]0-i - what else could [you]2045-you be , under the circumstances ? [I]0-i do n't complain ; [I]0-i have purposely kept out of [your]2045-you way , and out of [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall 's way ; in short , [I]0-i have afforded [you]2045-you every facility , as the prospectuses say . [I]0-i only want to know if [my]0-i turn has come at last . Once more , have [I]0-i given [you]2045-you time enough , and opportunities enough ? " "[0-i] A great deal more than enough . " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i mean that [you]0-i have made up [your]0-i mind about [me]0-i without stopping to think ? " "[0-i] That is exactly what [I]0-i mean . " [I]0-i got up to go . With an ironical gesture of remonstrance , [she]52-helena signed to [me]0-i to sit down again . "[0-i] Must [I]0-i remind [you]2045-you , [dear sir]4184-dear sir , of [our]2051-our famous native virtue ? [You]0-i talked of treachery just how . [I]0-i deny the treachery . Please give [me]0-i a hearing . " [I]52-helena returned to [my]52-helena chair . "[52-helena] Or would [you]52-helena prefer waiting , " [she]52-helena went out , "[52-helena] till [[my]0-i sister]596-my sister comes here later in the day , and continues what [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall has begun , with the great advantage of being young and nice - looking ? " When the female mind gets into this state , [no wise man]4982-no wise man answers the female questions . "[66-miss jillgall] Am [I]0-i to take silence as meaning Go on ? Ordinary audacity is one of those forms of insolence which mature experience dismisses with contempt . [This girl]3898-this girl 's audacity struck down all resistance , for one shocking reason : it was unquestionably sincere . Strong conviction of [her]3898-this girl own virtue stared at [me]0-i in [her]3898-this girl proud and daring eyes . At that time , [I]0-i was not aware of what [I]0-i have learned since . What [I]0-i said had been so plainly perhaps so rudely expressed , that misinterpretation of it seemed to be impossible . [She]3898-this girl mistook [me]0-i , nevertheless . The most merciless disclosure of the dreary side of human destiny is surely to be found in the failure of words , spoken or written , so to answer their purpose that [we]4994-we can trust them , in [our]4994-we attempts to communicate with [each other]3725-each other . Although [he]161-the minister would certainly not consent to receive [her]944-his daughter personally , [she]944-his daughter would be at liberty to adopt a written method of communication with [him]161-the minister , and the letter might be addressed in such a manner as to pique [his]161-the minister curiosity . If [Helena]52-helena 's vindictive purpose had been already accomplished - and if [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu left [me]2101-my master no alternative but to present [[his]161-the minister unworthy wife]5024-his unworthy wife in [her]5024-his unworthy wife true character - [I]2101-my master can honestly say that [I]2101-my master dreaded the consequences , not as they might affect [myself]2101-my master , but as they might affect [[my]2101-my master unhappy friend]5025-my unhappy friend in [his]161-the minister enfeebled state of body and mind . When [I]2101-my master entered [[his]161-the minister room]4945-his room , [he]161-the minister was still in bed . The bed - curtains were so drawn , on the side nearest to the window , as to keep the light from falling too brightly on [his]161-the minister weak eyes . In the shadow thus thrown on [him]161-the minister , it was not possible to see [his]161-the minister face plainly enough , from the open side of the bed , to arrive at any definite conclusion as to what might be passing in [his]161-the minister mind . After having been awake for some hours during the earlier part of the night , [he]161-the minister had enjoyed a long and undisturbed sleep . "[2101-my master] [I]0-i feel stronger this morning , " [he]161-the minister said , "[0-i] and [I]0-i wish to speak to [you]2102-you while [my]0-i mind is clear . " If the quiet tone of [his]161-the minister voice was not an assumed tone , [he]161-the minister was surely ignorant of all that had passed between [[his]161-the minister daughter]944-his daughter and [myself]0-i . "[0-i] [Eunice]53-eunice will be [here]225-here soon , " [he]161-the minister proceeded , "[0-i] and [I]0-i ought to explain why [I]0-i have sent for [her]53-eunice to come and meet [you]2102-you . " [He]161-the minister spoke more clearly and collectedly than [I]2105-i had heard [him]161-the minister speak yet . Here and there [I]2105-i detected hesitations and repetitions , which [I]2105-i have purposely passed over . The substance of what [he]161-the minister said to [me]2105-i is all that [I]2105-i shall present in this place . Careful as [I]2105-i have been to keep [my]2105-i record of events within strict limits , [I]2105-i have written at a length which [I]2105-i was far indeed from contemplating when [I]2105-i accepted [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu 's invitation . "[2105-i] [You]2105-i have left it to [my]0-i discretion , " [I]0-i added , "[0-i] to decide a question in which [you]2105-i are seriously interested , relating to [[your]2105-i daughters]1985-your daughters . Have [I]0-i no excuse for regretting that [I]0-i have not been admitted to [your]2105-i confidence a little more freely ? " "[2105-i] [You]2105-i have every excuse , " [he]161-the minister answered . "[2105-i] But [you]2105-i trouble [me]0-i all the same . There was something else that [I]0-i had to say to [you]2105-i - and [your]2105-i curiosity gets in the way . " [He]161-the minister said this with a sullen emphasis . In [my]0-i position , the worst of evils was suspense . [I]0-i told [him]161-the minister that [my]0-i curiosity could wait ; and [I]0-i begged that [he]161-the minister would relieve [his]161-the minister mind of what was pressing on it at the moment . Do n't be afraid of distressing [me]53-eunice . [I]53-eunice never cry now . "[53-eunice] " Because [you]53-eunice are so sorry for [me]53-eunice ? "[53-eunice] " No words can say how sorry [I]53-eunice am ! "[53-eunice] When [I]0-i remember that the first feeling [she]2170-she roused in [me]0-i was nothing worthier of [a professing Christian]39-christian than astonishment , [I]0-i drop in [my]0-i own estimation to the level of [a savage]2171-a savage . " Do [you]2170-she really mean , "[0-i] [I]0-i was base enough to ask , " that [you]2170-she have forgiven [him]47-philip ? " Do [I]2170-she surprise [you]0-i ? "[2170-she] [she]2170-she asked simply . " Perhaps love will bear any humiliation . Or perhaps [I]2174-i am only [a poor weak creature]273-a poor weak creature . [You]0-i do n't know what a comfort it was to [me]2174-i to keep the few letters that [I]2174-i received from [Philip]47-philip . Old as [I]0-i was , versed as [I]0-i was in the hard knowledge of how to keep the mask on in the hour of need , this was not to be done . " When [you]0-i were young [yourself]0-i , "[53-eunice] [she]53-eunice said , " did [you]0-i know what it was to love , and to be loved - and then to lose it all ? "[53-eunice] It is not given to [many men]3635-many men to marry [the woman who has been the object of [their]3635-many men first love]2179-the woman who has been the object of their first love . [My]0-i early life had been darkened by a sad story ; never confided to [any living creature]1610-any living creature ; banished resolutely from [my]0-i own thoughts . For forty years past , that part of [my]0-i buried self had lain quiet in its grave - and the chance touch of an innocent hand had raised the dead , and set [us]2177-us face to face again ! Did [I]0-i know what it was to love , and to be loved , and then to lose it all ? " Too well , [[my]0-i child]242-my child ; too well ! "[0-i] That was all [I]0-i could say to [her]2174-i .
