If [she]2188-her had been [[my]0-i own child]1116-my own child , [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i could have felt for [her]2188-her more truly than [I]0-i felt at that moment . [I]0-i only looked at [her]2188-her ; [I]0-i only said : " Cry ! "[0-i] The love that was in [her]2188-her heart rose , and poured its tenderness into [her]2188-her eyes . [I]0-i had longed to see the tears that would comfort [her]2188-her . The tears came . There was silence between [us]2192-us for a while . It was possible for [me]0-i to think . In the absence of physical resemblance between [parent]2193-parent and [child]4017-child , is an unfavorable influence exercised on the tendency to moral resemblance ? Assuming the possibility of such a result as this , [Eunice]53-eunice entirely unlike [[her]53-eunice mother]3501-her mother must , as [I]0-i concluded , have been possessed of [qualities formed to resist , as well as of qualities doomed to undergo , the infection of evil]2196-qualities formed to resist , as well as of qualities doomed to undergo , the infection of evil . While , therefore , [I]0-i resigned [myself]0-i to recognize the existence of the hereditary maternal taint , [I]0-i firmly believed in the counterbalancing influences for good which had been part of [the girl]377-the girl 's birthright . [They]2198-they had been derived , perhaps , from the better qualities in [[her]377-the girl father]614-her father 's nature ; they had been certainly developed by the tender care , the religious vigilance , which had guarded [the adopted child]468-the adopted child so lovingly in [[the Minister]161-the minister 's household]2202-the minister 's household ; and [they]2198-they had served [their]2198-they purpose until time brought with it the change , for which the tranquil domestic influences were not prepared . With the great , the vital transformation , which marks the ripening of [the girl]377-the girl into [the woman]179-the woman 's maturity of thought and passion , a new power for Good , strong enough to resist the latent power for Evil , sprang into being , and sheltered [Eunice]53-eunice under the supremacy of Love . Love ill - fated and ill - bestowed - but love that no profanation could stain , that no hereditary evil could conquer - the True Love that had been , and was , and would be , [the guardian angel of [Eunice]53-eunice 's life]2205-the guardian angel of eunice 's life . If [I]0-i am asked whether [I]0-i have ventured to found this opinion on what [I]0-i have observed in one instance only , [I]0-i reply that [I]0-i have had other opportunities of investigation , and that [my]0-i conclusions are derived from experience which refers to more instances than one . [No man]5126-no man in [his]5126-no man senses can doubt that physical qualities are transmitted from [parents]2207-parents to [children]283-children . But inheritance of moral qualities is less easy to trace . Here , the exploring mind finds its progress beset by obstacles . That those obstacles have been sometimes overcome [I]0-i do not deny . Moral resemblances have been traced between [parents]2207-parents and [children]283-children . While , however , [I]0-i admit this , [I]0-i doubt the conclusion which sees , in inheritance of moral qualities , a positive influence exercised on moral destiny . There are inherent emotional forces in humanity to which the inherited influences must submit ; they are essentially [influences under control]2211-influences under control - influences which can be encountered and forced back . That [we]2212-us , who inhabit [this little planet]2213-this little planet , may be [the doomed creatures of fatality]2214-the doomed creatures of fatality , from the cradle to the grave , [I]0-i am not prepared to dispute . But [I]0-i absolutely refuse to believe that it is a fatality with no higher origin than can be found in [our]2212-us accidental obligation to [[our]2212-us fathers]2215-our fathers and [mothers]2216-mothers . Still absorbed in these speculations , [I]0-i was disturbed by a touch on [my]0-i arm . [I]0-i looked up . [Eunice]53-eunice 's eyes were fixed on a shrubbery , at some little distance from [us]2212-us , which closed the view of [the garden]637-the garden on that side . [I]0-i noticed that [she]53-eunice was trembling . Nothing to alarm [her]53-eunice was visible that [I]0-i could discover . [I]0-i asked what [she]53-eunice had seen to startle [her]53-eunice . [She]53-eunice pointed to the shrubbery . " Look again , "[53-eunice] [she]53-eunice said . This time [I]0-i saw [a woman]222-a woman 's dress among the shrubs . [The woman]179-the woman [herself]179-the woman appeared in a moment more . It was [Helena]52-helena . [She]52-helena carried a small portfolio , and [she]52-helena approached [us]2212-us with a smile . CHAPTER XLI . [THE WHISPERING VOICE]2220-the whispering voice . [I]0-i looked at [Eunice]53-eunice . [She]53-eunice had risen , startled by [her]53-eunice first suspicion of [the person who was approaching [us]2212-us through the shrubbery]2221-the person who was approaching us through the shrubbery ; but [she]53-eunice kept [her]53-eunice place near [me]0-i , only changing [her]53-eunice position so as to avoid confronting [Helena]52-helena . [Her]53-eunice quickened breathing was all that told [me]0-i of the effort [she]53-eunice was making to preserve [her]53-eunice self - control . Entirely free from unbecoming signs of hurry and agitation , [Helena]52-helena opened [her]52-helena business with [me]0-i by means of an apology . " Pray excuse [me]53-eunice for disturbing [you]0-i . [I]53-eunice am obliged to leave [the house]314-the house on one of [my]53-eunice tiresome domestic errands . If [you]0-i will kindly permit it , [I]53-eunice wish to express , before [I]53-eunice go , [my]53-eunice very sincere regret for what [I]53-eunice was rude enough to say , when [I]53-eunice last had the honor of seeing [you]0-i . May [I]53-eunice hope to be forgiven ? How - do - [you]0-i - do , [Eunice]53-eunice ? Have [you]0-i enjoyed [your]0-i holiday in [the country]3999-the country ? "[53-eunice] [Eunice]53-eunice neither moved nor answered . Having some doubt of what might happen if [the two girls]4727-the two girls remained together , [I]0-i proposed to [Helena]52-helena to leave [the garden]637-the garden and to let [me]0-i hear what [she]52-helena had to say , in [the house]314-the house . " Quite needless , "[52-helena] [she]52-helena replied ; " [I]52-helena shall not detain [you]0-i for more than a minute . Please look at this . "[52-helena] [She]52-helena offered to [me]0-i the portfolio that [she]52-helena had been carrying , and pointed to a morsel of paper attached to it , which contained this inscription : " [Philip]47-philip 's Letters To [Me]52-helena . Private . [Helena Gracedieu]52-helena . "[52-helena] " [I]52-helena have a favor to ask , "[52-helena] [she]52-helena said , " and a proof of confidence in [you]0-i to offer . Will [you]0-i be so good as to look over what [you]0-i find in [my]52-helena portfolio ? [I]52-helena am unwilling to give up the hopes that [I]52-helena had founded on [our]5140-our interview , when [I]52-helena asked for it . The letters will , [I]52-helena venture to think , plead [my]52-helena cause more convincingly than [I]52-helena was able to plead it for [myself]52-helena . [I]52-helena wish to forget what passed between [us]5140-our , to the last word . To the last word , "[52-helena] [she]52-helena repeated emphatically - with a look which sufficiently informed [me]0-i that [I]0-i had not been betrayed to [[her]52-helena father]614-her father yet . " Will [you]0-i indulge [me]52-helena ? "[52-helena] [she]52-helena asked , and offered [her]52-helena portfolio for the second time . A more impudent bargain could not well have been proposed to [me]0-i . [I]0-i was to read , and to be favorably impressed by , [Mr. Philip Dunboyne]47-philip 's letters ; and [Miss Helena]52-helena was to say nothing of that unlucky slip of the tongue , relating to [[her]52-helena mother]3501-her mother , which [she]52-helena had discovered to be a serious act of self - betrayal - thanks to [my]0-i confusion at the time . If [I]0-i had not thought of [Eunice]53-eunice , and of the desolate and loveless life to which [the poor girl]2227-the poor girl was so patiently resigned , [I]0-i should have refused to read [Miss Gracedieu]52-helena 's love - letters . But , as things were , [I]0-i was influenced by the hope innocently encouraged by [Eunice]53-eunice [herself]53-eunice that [Philip Dunboyne]47-philip might not be so wholly unworthy of [the sweet girl whom [he]47-philip had injured as [I]0-i had hitherto been too hastily disposed to believe]2228-the sweet girl whom he had injured as i had hitherto been too hastily disposed to believe . To act on this view with the purpose of promoting a reconciliation was impossible , unless [I]0-i had the means of forming a correct estimate of [the man]3581-the man 's character . It seemed to [me]0-i that [I]0-i had found the means . A fair chance of putting [his]3581-the man sincerity to a trustworthy test , was surely offered by the letters the confidential letters which [I]0-i had been requested to read . To feel this as strongly as [I]0-i felt it , brought [me]0-i at once to a decision . [I]0-i consented to take the portfolio - on [my]0-i own conditions . " Understand , [Miss Helena]52-helena , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " that [I]0-i make no promises . [I]0-i reserve [my]0-i own opinion , and [my]0-i own right of action . "[0-i] " [I]2230-i am not afraid of [your]0-i opinions or [your]0-i actions , "[2230-i] [she]2230-i answered confidently , " if [you]0-i will only read the letters . [I]2230-i hope [you]53-eunice will soon recover , [Eunice]53-eunice , in [the country]3999-the country air . "[2230-i] If the object of [the wretch]3660-the wretch was to exasperate [[her]2230-i victim]2232-her victim , [she]2230-i had completely failed . [Eunice]53-eunice remained as still as [a statue]2233-a statue . To all appearance , [she]53-eunice had not even heard what had been said to [her]53-eunice . [Helena]52-helena looked at [me]0-i , and touched [her]52-helena forehead with a significant smile . " Sad , is n't it ? "[52-helena] [she]52-helena said - and bowed , and went briskly away on [her]52-helena household errand . [We]2234-we were alone again . Still , [Eunice]53-eunice never moved . [I]0-i spoke to [her]53-eunice , and produced no impression . Beginning to feel alarmed , [I]0-i tried the effect of touching [her]53-eunice . With a wild cry , [she]53-eunice started into a state of animation . Almost at the same moment , [she]53-eunice weakly swayed to and fro as if the pleasant breeze in [the garden]637-the garden moved [her]53-eunice at its will , like the flowers . [I]0-i held [her]53-eunice up , and led [her]53-eunice to the seat . " There is nothing to be afraid of , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [She]53-eunice has gone . "[105-lady macbeth] Hardened as [I]0-i was - or ought to have been - the effect of what [I]0-i had just heard turned [me]0-i cold . [THE QUAINT PHILOSOPHER]113-the quaint philosopher . [No person]3479-no person came to [[my]0-i room]3615-my room , and nothing happened to interrupt [me]0-i while [I]0-i was reading [Mr. Philip Dunboyne]47-philip 's letters . One of them , let [me]0-i say at once , produced a very disagreeable impression on [me]0-i . [I]0-i have unexpectedly discovered [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen - in a postscript . [She]49-mrs. tenbruggen is making a living as [a Medical Rubber]2270-a medical rubber or [Masseuse]2271-masseuse , and is in professional attendance on [Mr. Dunboyne the elder]47-philip . More of this , a little further on . Having gone through the whole collection of [young Dunboyne]47-philip 's letters , [I]0-i set [myself]0-i to review the differing conclusions which the correspondence had produced on [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i call the papers submitted to [me]0-i a correspondence , because the greater part of [Philip]47-philip 's letters exhibit notes in pencil , evidently added by [Helena]52-helena . [These]2272-these express , for the most part , the interpretation which [she]52-helena had placed on passages that perplexed or displeased [her]52-helena ; and they have , as [Philip]47-philip 's rejoinders show , been employed as materials when [she]52-helena wrote [her]52-helena replies . On reflection , [I]0-i find [myself]0-i troubled by complexities and contradictions in the view presented of [this young man]2273-this young man 's character . To decide positively whether [I]0-i can justify to [myself]0-i and to [my]0-i regard for [Eunice]53-eunice , an attempt to reunite [the lovers]2274-the lovers , requires more time for consideration than [I]0-i can reasonably expect that [Helena]52-helena 's patience will allow . Having a quiet hour or two still before [me]0-i , [I]0-i have determined to make extracts from the letters for [my]0-i own use ; with the intention of referring to them while [I]0-i am still in doubt which way [my]0-i decision ought to incline . [I]0-i shall present [them]2275-them here , to speak for [themselves]2275-them . Is there any objection to this ? None that [I]0-i can see . In the first place , those extracts have a value of [their]2275-them own . [They]2275-them add necessary information to the present history of events . In the second place , [I]0-i am under no obligation to [[Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu 's daughter]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter which forbids [me]0-i to make use of [her]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter portfolio . [I]0-i told [her]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter that [I]0-i only consented to receive it , under reserve of [my]0-i own right of action - and [her]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter assent to that stipulation was expressed in the clearest terms . EXTRACTS FROM [MR . PHILIP DUNBOYNE]47-philip 'S LETTERS . First Extract . [You]2277-you blame [me]0-i , [dear Helena]52-helena , for not having paid proper attention to the questions put to [me]0-i in [your]52-helena last letter . [I]0-i have only been waiting to make up [my]0-i mind , before [I]0-i replied . First question : Do [I]0-i think it advisable that [you]52-helena should write to [[my]0-i father]615-my father ? No , [[my]0-i dear]3949-my dear ; [I]0-i beg [you]52-helena will defer writing , until [you]52-helena hear from [me]0-i again . Second question : Considering that [he]615-my father is still [a stranger to [you]52-helena]2280-a stranger to you , is there any harm in [your]52-helena asking [me]0-i what sort of man [[my]0-i father]615-my father is ? No harm , [[my]0-i sweet one]2282-my sweet one ; but , as [you]52-helena will presently see , [I]0-i am afraid [you]52-helena have addressed [yourself]52-helena to [the wrong person]2283-the wrong person . [[My]0-i father]615-my father is kind , in [his]615-my father own odd way - and learned , and rich - a more high - minded and honorable man as [I]0-i have every reason to believe does n't live . But if [you]52-helena ask [me]0-i which [he]615-my father prefers , [his]615-my father books or [[his]615-my father son]3903-his son , [I]0-i hope [I]0-i do [him]615-my father no injustice when [I]0-i answer , [his]615-my father books . [His]615-my father reading and [his]615-my father writing are obstacles between [us]2286-us which [I]0-i have never been able to overcome . This is the more to be regretted because [he]615-my father is charming , on the few occasions when [I]0-i find [him]615-my father disengaged . If [you]52-helena wish [I]0-i knew more about [[my]0-i father]615-my father , [we]2286-us are in complete agreement as usual - [I]0-i wish , too . But there is [a dear friend of [yours]52-helena and [mine]0-i , who is just [the person [we]2286-us want to help [us]2286-us]2289-the person we want to help us]2288-a dear friend of yours and mine , who is just the person we want to help us . Need [I]0-i say that [I]0-i allude to [Mrs. Staveley]59-mrs. staveley ? [I]0-i called on [her]59-mrs. staveley yesterday , not long after [she]59-mrs. staveley had paid a visit to [[my]0-i father]615-my father . Luck had favored [her]59-mrs. staveley . [She]59-mrs. staveley arrived just at the time when hunger had obliged [him]615-my father to shut up [his]615-my father books , and ring for something to eat . [Mrs. Staveley]59-mrs. staveley secured a favorable reception with [her]59-mrs. staveley customary tact and delicacy . [He]615-my father had a fowl for [his]615-my father dinner . [She]59-mrs. staveley knows [his]615-my father weakness of old ; [she]59-mrs. staveley volunteered to carve it for [him]615-my father . If [I]0-i can only repeat what [this clever woman]2291-this clever woman told [me]0-i of [their]2292-their talk , [you]2293-you will have a portrait of [Mr. Dunboyne the elder]47-philip - not perhaps a highly - finished picture , but , as [I]0-i hope and believe , a good likeness . [Mrs. Staveley]59-mrs. staveley began by complaining to [him]615-my father of the conduct of [[his]615-my father son]3903-his son . [I]0-i had promised to write to [her]59-mrs. staveley , and [I]0-i had never kept [my]0-i word . [She]59-mrs. staveley had reasons for being especially interested in [my]0-i plans and prospects , just then ; knowing [me]0-i to be attached please take notice that [I]0-i am quoting [her]59-mrs. staveley own language to [a charming friend of [hers]59-mrs. staveley , whom [I]0-i had first met at [[her]59-mrs. staveley house]2296-her house]2295-a charming friend of hers , whom i had first met at her house . To aggravate the disappointment that [I]0-i had inflicted , [the young lady]3971-the young lady had neglected [her]3971-the young lady , too . No letters , no information . Perhaps [[my]0-i father]615-my father would kindly enlighten [her]59-mrs. staveley ? Was the affair going on ? or was it broken off ? [[My]0-i father]615-my father held out [his]615-my father plate and asked for the other wing of the fowl . " It is n't a bad one for [London]3-london , "[615-my father] [he]615-my father said ; " wo n't [you]59-mrs. staveley have some [yourself]59-mrs. staveley ? "[59-mrs. staveley] [[My]0-i father]615-my father is too well - bred to speak to [a lady]210-a lady while [his]615-my father attention is absorbed by a fowl . "[59-mrs. staveley] " Yes ? "[59-mrs. staveley] " [You]59-mrs. staveley might ask [him]1780-my son if [he]1780-my son is engaged ? "[59-mrs. staveley] " Pardon [me]59-mrs. staveley . [I]59-mrs. staveley think [I]59-mrs. staveley might wait till [Philip]47-philip mentions it without asking . "[59-mrs. staveley] " What [an extraordinary man]5180-an extraordinary man [you]0-i are ! "[59-mrs. staveley] " Oh , no , no - only [a philosopher]5181-a philosopher . "[59-mrs. staveley] This tried [Mrs. Staveley]59-mrs. staveley 's temper . [You]2303-you know what [a perfectly candid person [[our]2305-our friend]2306-our friend]2304-a perfectly candid person our friend is . [She]59-mrs. staveley owned to [me]0-i that [she]59-mrs. staveley felt inclined to make [herself]59-mrs. staveley disagreeable . " That 's thrown away upon [me]59-mrs. staveley , "[59-mrs. staveley] [she]59-mrs. staveley said : " [I]59-mrs. staveley do n't know what [a philosopher]5181-a philosopher is . "[59-mrs. staveley] Let [me]0-i pause for a moment , dear [Helena]52-helena . [I]0-i have inexcusably forgotten to speak of [[my]0-i father]615-my father 's personal appearance . It wo n't take long . [I]0-i need only notice one interesting feature which , so to speak , lifts [his]615-my father face out of the common . [He]615-my father has an eloquent nose . [Persons possessing this rare advantage]2308-persons possessing this rare advantage are blest with powers of expression not granted to [their]2308-persons possessing this rare advantage ordinary fellow - creatures . [[My]0-i father]615-my father 's nose is a mine of information to [friends familiarly acquainted with it]2310-friends familiarly acquainted with it . It changes color like [a modest young lady]2311-a modest young lady 's cheek . It works flexibly from side to side like the rudder of [a ship]2312-a ship . On the present occasion , [Mrs. Staveley]59-mrs. staveley saw it shift toward the left - hand side of [his]615-my father face . A sigh escaped [the poor lady]2313-the poor lady . [Experience]114-experience told [her]2313-the poor lady that [[my]0-i father]615-my father was going to hold forth . " [You]2313-the poor lady do n't know what [a philosopher]5181-a philosopher is ! "[615-my father] [he]615-my father repeated . " Be so kind as to look at [me]615-my father . [I]615-my father am [a philosopher]5181-a philosopher . "[615-my father] [Mrs. Staveley]59-mrs. staveley bowed . " And [a philosopher]5181-a philosopher , [[my]59-mrs. staveley charming friend]5186-my charming friend , is [a man who has discovered a system of life]5187-a man who has discovered a system of life . Some systems assert themselves in volumes - [my]59-mrs. staveley system asserts itself in two words : Never think of anything until [you]5188-you have first asked [yourself]5188-you if there is an absolute necessity for doing it , at that particular moment . Thinking of things , when things need n't be thought of , is offering an opportunity to [Worry]115-worry ; and [Worry]115-worry is the favorite agent of [Death]116-death when [the destroyer]5189-the destroyer handles [his]5189-the destroyer work in a lingering way , and achieves premature results . Never look back , and never look forward , as long as [you]5188-you can possibly help it . Looking back leads the way to sorrow . And looking forward ends in the cruelest of all delusions : it encourages hope . The present time is the precious time . Live for the passing day : the passing day is all that [we]5190-we can be sure of . [You]5188-you suggested , just now , that [I]59-mrs. staveley should ask [[my]59-mrs. staveley son]1780-my son if [he]1780-my son was engaged to be married . ' Wait till [Philip]47-philip mentions it without asking ? ' There is the personal application of [my]59-mrs. staveley system . "[59-mrs. staveley] [Mrs. Staveley]59-mrs. staveley declined to tell [me]0-i whether [she]59-mrs. staveley had offered a bright example of gratitude to the rest of [the sex]2315-the sex . [He]47-philip protests against suspicions which [he]47-philip has not deserved . That [he]47-philip does sometimes think of [Eunice]53-eunice [he]47-philip sees no reason to deny . After having identified [my]0-i handwriting , [I]0-i waited with some curiosity to see whether [Helena]52-helena would let [her]52-helena anger honestly show itself , or whether [she]52-helena would keep it down . [She]52-helena kept it down . " Allow [me]52-helena to return good for evil . "[52-helena] The evil was uppermost , nevertheless , when [Miss Gracedieu]52-helena expressed [herself]52-helena in these self - denying terms . " [You]0-i are no doubt anxious to know if [[Philip]47-philip 's father]825-philip 's father has been won over to serve [your]0-i purpose . Here is [Philip]47-philip 's own account of it : the last of [his]47-philip letters that [I]0-i shall trouble [you]0-i to read . "[0-i] [I]0-i looked it over . The memorandum follows which [I]0-i made for [my]0-i own use : [An eccentric philosopher]2387-an eccentric philosopher is as capable as the most commonplace human being in existence of behaving like [an honorable man]412-an honorable man . "[123-mr. wellwood] Entering into details , after that ominous reply , [Mr. Wellwood]123-mr. wellwood did not hesitate to say that [[his]123-mr. wellwood patient]2413-his patient 's nerves were completely shattered . Disease of the brain had , as [he]123-mr. wellwood feared , been already set up . " As to the causes which have produced this lamentable break - down , "[162-the doctor] [the doctor]162-the doctor continued , " [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu has been in the habit of preaching extempore twice a day on Sundays , and sometimes in the week as well - and has uniformly refused to spare [himself]63-mr. gracedieu when [he]63-mr. gracedieu was in most urgent need of rest . If [you]5241-you have ever attended [[his]63-mr. gracedieu chapel]5242-his chapel , [you]5241-you have seen [a man]3697-a man in a state of fiery enthusiasm , feeling intensely every word that [he]63-mr. gracedieu utters . Think of such exhaustion as that implies going on for years together , and accumulating its wasting influences on a sensitively organized constitution . There is [a third person present]2453-a third person present , who will judge between [you]2454-you and [me]0-i . Look there ! " [He]0-i pointed solemnly to the portrait of [[his]0-i wife]174-his wife . It was a small picture , very simply framed ; representing the face in a "[2453-a third person present] three - quarter " view , and part of the figure only . As a work of art it was contemptible ; but , as a likeness , it answered its purpose . [[My]2453-a third person present unhappy friend]5025-my unhappy friend stood before [it]5275-it , in an attitude of dejection , covering [his]5025-my unhappy friend face with [his]5025-my unhappy friend hands . In the interval of silence that followed , [I]2453-a third person present was reminded that [an unseen friend]5276-an unseen friend was keeping watch outside . Alarmed by having heard the key turned in the lock , and realizing the embarrassment of the position in which [I]2453-a third person present was placed , [the doctor]162-the doctor had discovered a discreet way of communicating with [me]2453-a third person present . [He]0-i slipped one of [his]0-i visiting - cards under the door , with these words written on it : "[2453-a third person present] How can [I]0-i help [you]2454-you ? " [I]0-i took the pencil from [my]0-i pocketbook , and wrote on the blank side of the card : "[0-i] [He]0-i has thrown the key into [the garden]637-the garden ; look for it under the window . " A glance at [the Minister]161-the minister , before [I]0-i returned [my]0-i reply , showed that [his]161-the minister attitude was unchanged . Without being seen or suspected , [I]0-i , in [my]0-i turn , slipped the card under the door . The slow minutes followed each other - and still nothing happened . [My]0-i anxiety to see how [the doctor]162-the doctor 's search for the key was succeeding , tempted [me]0-i to approach the window . On [my]0-i way to it , the tail of [my]0-i coat threw down a little tray containing pens and pencils , which had been left close to the edge of the table . Slight as the noise of the fall was , it disturbed [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu . [He]0-i looked round vacantly . "[0-i] [I]0-i have been comforted by prayer , " [he]0-i told [me]0-i . " [He]0-i pointed to the portrait once more : "[2457-the lord] [My]0-i hands must not presume to touch it , while [I]0-i am still in doubt . Take it down . " [I]2458-you removed the picture and placed it , by [his]0-i directions , on a chair that stood midway between [us]5280-us . "[2458-you] [You]2458-you are wrong . [You]2458-you see [[my]0-i wife]446-my wife [herself]446-my wife . Stand here , and look at [[my]0-i wife]446-my wife with [me]0-i . " [We]5280-us stood together , with [our]5280-us eyes fixed on the portrait . " [he]0-i burst out . "[446-my wife] Not a blush of shame ! [Wretch]124-wretch , [you]124-wretch stand condemned by the atrocious composure that [I]0-i see in [your]124-wretch face ! " A first discovery of the odious suspicion of which [I]0-i was the object , dawned on [my]0-i mind at that moment . [My]0-i capacity for restraining [myself]0-i completely failed [me]0-i . [I]0-i spoke to [him]0-i as if [he]0-i had been [an accountable being]5281-an accountable being . "[0-i] Once for all , " [I]0-i said , "[0-i] tell [me]0-i what [I]0-i have a right to know . [Your]2461-i life depends on how [you]2461-i answer [me]0-i . " Was there a weapon concealed in [the room]3541-the room ? or had [he]0-i got it in the pocket of [his]0-i dressing - gown ? [I]2461-i listened for the sound of [the doctor]162-the doctor 's returning footsteps in [the passage]4318-the passage outside , and heard nothing . [My]2461-i life had once depended , years since , on [my]2461-i success in heading the arrest of [an escaped prisoner]5285-an escaped prisoner . [I]2461-i was not conscious , then , of feeling [my]2461-i energies weakened by fear . But [that man]351-that man was not mad ; and [I]2461-i was younger , in those days , by a good twenty years or more . At [my]2461-i later time of life , [I]2461-i could show [[my]2461-i old friend]4756-my old friend that [I]2461-i was not afraid of [him]351-that man - but [I]2461-i was conscious of an effort in doing it . [I]2461-i opened the paper . "[2461-i] Am [I]0-i to read this to [myself]0-i ? " [I]0-i asked . "[0-i] Or am [I]0-i to read it aloud ? " "[0-i] Read it aloud ! " In these terms , [[his]351-that man daughter]944-his daughter addressed [him]2464-dearest father : "[0-i] [I]0-i have been so unfortunate , [dearest father]2464-dearest father , as to displease [you]2464-dearest father , and [I]0-i dare not hope that [you]2464-dearest father will consent to receive [me]0-i . What it is [my]0-i painful duty to tell [you]2464-dearest father , must be told in writing . " Grieved as [I]0-i am to distress [you]2464-dearest father , in [your]2464-dearest father present state of health , [I]0-i must not hesitate to reveal what it has been [my]0-i misfortune - [I]0-i may even say [my]0-i misery , when [I]0-i think of [[my]0-i mother]833-my mother - to discover . All that [I]2495-i could do to spare [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall , [I]2495-i did . [I]2495-i was obliged to acknowledge that there had been an outbreak of violence , and that the portrait of [[the Minister]161-the minister 's wife]3800-the minister 's wife had been destroyed by [the Minister]161-the minister [himself]161-the minister . [I]2495-i hastened to add that [I]2495-i should go to [the hotel]1214-the hotel , and should wait [there]4103-there until the next day , in the hope of hearing better news . THE DECISION OF [EUNICE]53-eunice . [Eunice]53-eunice ran out to meet [us]2591-us , and opened the gate . [She]53-eunice was instantly folded in [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall 's arms . " [Darling Euneece]77-euneece , [you]77-euneece remember [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen 's name , [I]0-i am sure ? "[2597-i] [She]2597-i put [her]2597-i arm round [Eunice]53-eunice 's waist and led [her]53-eunice to [the house]314-the house door . When [[the farmer]2250-the farmer 's wife]2602-the farmer 's wife presented [herself]2602-the farmer 's wife , [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen was so irresistibly amiable , and took such flattering notice of [the children]341-the children , that [the harmless British matron]2604-the harmless british matron actually blushed with pleasure . " [I]2597-i 'm sure , [ma'am]3962-ma'am , [you]3962-ma'am must have [children]283-children of [your]3962-ma'am own , "[2597-i] [she]2597-i said . [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen cast [her]49-mrs. tenbruggen eyes on the floor , and sighed with pathetic resignation . Personally speaking , [he]2624-the master of the house presented a remarkable contrast to [the typical British farmer]2626-the typical british farmer . [He]2624-the master of the house was neither big nor burly ; [he]2624-the master of the house spoke English as well as [I]0-i did ; and there was nothing in [his]2624-the master of the house dress which would have made [him]2624-the master of the house a fit subject for a picture of rustic life . Good and Evil walk the ways of [this unintelligible world]2655-this unintelligible world , on the same free conditions . If [we]2654-we cling , as many of [us]2654-we do , to the comforting belief that [departed spirits]2656-departed spirits can minister to earthly creatures for good - can be felt moving in [us]2654-we , in a train of thought , and seen as visible manifestations , in a dream - with what pretense of reason can [we]2654-we deny that the same freedom of supernatural influence which is conceded to [the departed spirit]2657-the departed spirit , working for good , is also permitted to [the departed spirit]2657-the departed spirit , working for evil ? The hostile feeling thus set up might be trusted to keep watch on [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen 's proceedings , with a vigilance not attainable by the coarser observation of [a man]3697-a man . [I]52-helena started for [London]3-london by [the early train]5445-the early train in the morning . [My]52-helena way [home]258-home from [the terminus]5447-the terminus took [me]52-helena past [the hotel at which [the elder Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip was staying]5448-the hotel at which the elder mr. dunboyne was staying . [I]52-helena called on [him]47-philip . [He]47-philip was reported to be engaged ; that is to say , immersed in [his]47-philip books . The address on one of [Philip]47-philip 's letters had informed [me]52-helena that [he]47-philip was staying at [another hotel]5449-another hotel . Pursuing [my]52-helena inquiries in this direction , [I]52-helena met with a severe disappointment . [Mr. Philip Dunboyne]47-philip had left [the hotel]1214-the hotel that morning ; for what destination neither [the landlord]4512-the landlord nor [the waiter]2506-the waiter could tell [me]52-helena . [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall wrote , informing [me]52-helena in [her]66-miss jillgall strongest language that [Philip Dunboyne]47-philip had returned to [Helena]52-helena . " CHAPTER L. THE NEWS FROM [THE FARM]2245-the farm . " [I]2722-you am ashamed to mention [the poor dear Minister]5455-the poor dear minister in a postscript . The truth is , [I]2722-you do n't very well know what [I]2722-you am about . [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu is quiet , sleeps better than [he]63-mr. gracedieu did , eats with a keener appetite , gives no trouble . ' " ' [I]0-i tried , in every possible way , to get [him]2784-he to tell [me]0-i which of [[his]2784-he two daughters]5509-his two daughters was [the oldest]3948-the oldest . Last night [my]0-i mind was in a harassed state . [Philip]47-philip was , as usual , the cause of it . How do [I]0-i know that [his]47-philip thoughts are not wandering away to [Eunice]53-eunice ? Marriage ! Nothing will quiet these frightful doubts of [mine]0-i , nothing will reward [me]0-i for all that [I]0-i have suffered , nothing will warm [my]0-i heart with the delightful sense of triumph over [Eunice]53-eunice , but [my]0-i marriage to [Philip]47-philip . And what does [he]47-philip say , when [I]0-i urge it on [him]47-philip ? - yes , [I]0-i have fallen as low as that , in the despair which sometimes possesses [me]0-i . [He]47-philip has [his]47-philip answer , always the same , and always ready : " How are [we]2833-we to live ? where is the money ? "[47-philip] The maddening part of it is that [I]0-i can not accuse [him]47-philip of raising objections that do n't exist . [We]2833-we are poorer than ever [here]225-here , since [[my]0-i father]615-my father 's illness - and [Philip]47-philip 's allowance is barely enough to suffice [him]47-philip as [a single man]3841-a single man . Oh , how [I]0-i hate [the rich]2837-the rich ! It was useless to think of going to bed . How could [I]0-i hope to sleep , with [my]0-i head throbbing , and [my]0-i thoughts in this disturbed state ? [I]0-i put on [my]0-i comfortable dressing - gown , and sat down to try what reading would do to quiet [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i had borrowed the book from [the Library]2838-the library , to which [I]0-i have been a subscriber in secret for some time past . It was an old volume , full of what [we]2833-we should now call Gossip ; relating strange adventures , and scandalous incidents in family history which had been concealed from public notice . One of these last romances in real life caught a strong hold on [my]0-i interest . It was a strange case of intended poisoning , which had never been carried out . [A young married lady of rank , whose name was concealed under an initial letter]2839-a young married lady of rank , whose name was concealed under an initial letter , had suffered some unendurable wrong which was not mentioned at the hands of [[[her]2839-a young married lady of rank , whose name was concealed under an initial letter husband]168-her husband 's mother]2841-her husband 's mother . [The wife]4092-the wife was described as [a woman of strong passions]2843-a woman of strong passions , who had determined on a terrible revenge by taking the life of [[her]2839-a young married lady of rank , whose name was concealed under an initial letter mother - in - law]2844-her mother - in - law . There were difficulties in the way of [her]4092-the wife committing the crime without [an accomplice to help [her]4092-the wife]2845-an accomplice to help her ; and [she]4092-the wife decided on taking [[her]4092-the wife maid]2846-her maid , [an elderly woman]2847-an elderly woman , into [her]4092-the wife confidence . The poison was secretly obtained by [this person]4340-this person ; and the safest manner of administering it was under discussion between [the mistress]2849-the mistress and [the maid]4963-the maid , when the door of [the room]3541-the room was suddenly opened . [The husband]170-the husband , accompanied by [[his]170-the husband brother]2853-his brother , rushed in , and charged [[his]170-the husband wife]174-his wife with plotting the murder of [[his]170-the husband mother]2855-his mother . [The young lady [she]2856-the young lady she was only twenty - three was only twenty - three]2856-the young lady she was only twenty - three must have been [a person of extraordinary courage and resolution]2857-a person of extraordinary courage and resolution . [She]4092-the wife saw at once that [[her]4092-the wife maid]2846-her maid had betrayed [her]4092-the wife , and , with astonishing presence of mind , [she]4092-the wife turned on [the traitress]1940-the traitress , and said to [[her]4092-the wife husband]168-her husband : " There is [the wretch]3660-the wretch who has been trying to persuade [me]4092-the wife to poison [[your]168-her husband mother]4696-your mother ! "[4092-the wife] As it happened , [the old lady]2861-the old lady 's temper was violent and overbearing ; and [the maid]4963-the maid had complained of being ill - treated by [her]2861-the old lady , in the hearing of [the other servants]2863-the other servants . The circumstances made it impossible to decide which of [the two]1806-the two was really [the guilty woman]2865-the guilty woman . [The servant]3631-the servant was sent away , and [the husband]170-the husband and [wife]4767-wife separated soon afterward , under the excuse of incompatibility of temper . Years passed ; and the truth was only discovered by the death - bed confession of [the wife]4092-the wife . A remarkable story , which has made such an impression on [me]0-i that [I]0-i have written it in [my]0-i Journal . [I]0-i am not rich enough to buy the book . For the last two days , [I]0-i have been confined to [[my]0-i room]3615-my room with a bad feverish cold - caught , as [I]0-i suppose , by sitting at an open window reading [my]0-i book till nearly three o'clock in the morning . [I]0-i sent a note to [Philip]47-philip , telling [him]47-philip of [my]0-i illness . On the first day , [he]47-philip called to inquire after [me]0-i . On the second day , no visit , and no letter . Here is the third day - and no news of [him]47-philip as yet . [I]0-i am better , but not fit to go out . Let [me]0-i wait another hour , and , if that exertion of patience meets with no reward , [I]0-i shall send a note to [the hotel]1214-the hotel . No news of [Philip]47-philip . [I]0-i have sent to [the hotel]1214-the hotel . [The servant]3631-the servant has just returned , bringing [me]0-i back [my]0-i note . [The waiter]2506-the waiter informed [her]3631-the servant that [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip had gone away to [London]3-london by [the morning train]2875-the morning train . No apology or explanation left for [me]0-i . Can [he]47-philip have deserted [me]0-i ? [I]0-i am in such a frenzy of doubt and rage that [I]0-i can hardly write that horrible question . Is it possible - oh , [I]0-i feel it is possible that [he]47-philip has gone away with [Eunice]53-eunice . Do [I]0-i know where to find [them]2876-them ? if [I]0-i did know , what could [I]0-i do ? [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i could kill [them]2876-them both ! CHAPTER LIII . [HELENA 'S DIARY RESUMED]93-helena . After the heat of [my]0-i anger had cooled , [I]0-i made two discoveries . One cost [me]0-i a fee to [a messenger]5458-a messenger , and the other exposed [me]0-i to the insolence of [a servant]2878-a servant . [I]0-i pay willingly in [my]0-i purse and [my]0-i pride , when the gain is peace of mind . Through [[my]0-i messenger]2879-my messenger [I]0-i ascertained that [Eunice]53-eunice had never left [the farm]2245-the farm . What misery [[our]2883-our stupid housemaid]2884-our stupid housemaid might have spared [me]0-i , if [she]2884-our stupid housemaid had thought of putting that question when [I]0-i sent [her]2884-our stupid housemaid to [the hotel]1214-the hotel ! The rest of the day passed in vain speculations on [Philip]47-philip 's motive for this sudden departure . What poor weak creatures [we]2883-our are ! [I]0-i persuaded [myself]0-i to hope that anxiety for [our]2883-our marriage had urged [him]47-philip to make an effort to touch the heart of [[his]47-philip mean father]2886-his mean father . Shall [I]0-i see [him]47-philip to - morrow ? And shall [I]0-i have reason to be fonder of [him]47-philip than ever ? [We]2883-our met again to - day as usual . [He]47-philip has behaved infamously . When [I]0-i asked what had been [his]47-philip object in going to [London]3-london , [I]0-i was told that it was " a matter of business . "[47-philip] [He]47-philip made that idiotic excuse as coolly as if [he]47-philip really thought [I]0-i should believe it . [I]0-i submitted in silence , rather than mar [his]47-philip return to [me]0-i by the disaster of a quarrel . But this was an unlucky day . A harder trial of [my]0-i self - control was still to come . Without the slightest appearance of shame , [Philip]47-philip informed [me]0-i that [he]47-philip was charged with a message from [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen ! [She]49-mrs. tenbruggen wanted some Irish lace , and would [I]0-i be so good as to tell [her]49-mrs. tenbruggen which was [the best shop at which [she]49-mrs. tenbruggen could buy it]2887-the best shop at which she could buy it ? [We]2989-we followed the chaise . CHAPTER LVI . HELENA 'S DIARY RESUMED . When [we]2989-we had left [the town]205-the town behind [us]2989-we , [the coachman]2991-the coachman began to drive more slowly . [He]2986-the driver pointed with [his]2986-the driver whip to [the open road]2992-the open road and to the chaise in the distance . " If [we]2989-we keep too near [the gentleman]5663-the gentleman , [miss]4033-miss , [he]5663-the gentleman has only got to look back , and [he]5663-the gentleman 'll see [we]2989-we are following [him]5663-the gentleman . [He]2991-the coachman earned it . On getting [home]258-home , [I]3033-i found [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen walking up and down [the dining - room]1663-the dining - room , deep in thought . "[3034-i] Does [[my]0-i father]615-my father seem to improve under [your]3036-your treatment ? " [I]615-my father asked . "[615-my father] Very far from it , [[my]0-i dear]3949-my dear . "[0-i] None whatever . " [She]5718-her went away to attend on [a patient]5720-a patient . [I]0-i retired to [[my]0-i bedroom]381-my bedroom , and opened [my]0-i Diary . Again and again , [I]0-i read that remarkable story of the intended poisoning , and of the manner in which it had ended . [I]0-i sat thinking over this romance in real life till [I]0-i was interrupted by the announcement of dinner . [Mr. Philip Dunboyne]47-philip had returned . In [Miss Jillgall]66-miss jillgall 's absence [we]5722-we were alone at the table . [My]0-i appetite was gone . [I]0-i made a pretense of eating , and another pretense of being glad to see [[my]0-i devoted lover]5723-my devoted lover . [I]0-i talked to [him]5723-my devoted lover in the prettiest manner . "[0-i] Let [me]0-i feel [your]3042-you pulse . " [I]0-i laughed , and left [her]49-mrs. tenbruggen with [Mr. Philip Dunboyne]47-philip . Yes ; the effect which [she]49-mrs. tenbruggen had produced on [him]5723-my devoted lover - how , [she]49-mrs. tenbruggen knows best - had not passed away yet : [he]5723-my devoted lover was still talking . [The attendant]3548-the attendant told [me]0-i it had gone on for hours together . " When [I]52-helena had answered [him]5723-my devoted lover , [he]5723-my devoted lover beckoned [me]52-helena to come nearer . "[52-helena] [I]0-i am getting stronger every minute , " [he]5723-my devoted lover said . "[52-helena] [We]3043-i will go traveling to - morrow , and see the place where [you]3042-you were born . [He]5723-my devoted lover was wandering now . Sometimes , [he]5723-my devoted lover was addressing [[his]5723-my devoted lover congregation]774-his congregation ; sometimes , [he]5723-my devoted lover wondered what [they]774-his congregation would give [him]5723-my devoted lover for supper ; sometimes , [he]5723-my devoted lover talked of the flowers in [the garden]637-the garden . And then [he]5723-my devoted lover looked at [me]3043-i , and frowned , and said [I]3043-i prevented [him]5723-my devoted lover from thinking . [I]3043-i went back to [[my]3043-i bedroom]381-my bedroom , and opened [my]3043-i Diary , and read the story again . Was the poison of which [that resolute young wife]5737-that resolute young wife proposed to make use something that acted slowly , and told [the doctors]4106-the doctors nothing if [they]4106-the doctors looked for it after death ? Would it be running too great a risk to show the story to [the doctor]162-the doctor , and try to get a little valuable information in that way ? It would be useless . [He]5723-my devoted lover would make some feeble joke ; [he]5723-my devoted lover would say , [girls]602-girls and poisons are not fit company for [each other]3725-each other . But [I]3043-i might discover what [I]3043-i want to know in another way . [I]3043-i might call on [the doctor]162-the doctor , after [he]5723-my devoted lover has gone out on [his]5723-my devoted lover afternoon round of visits , and might tell [the servant]3631-the servant [I]3043-i would wait for [[his]5723-my devoted lover master]5744-his master 's return . From morning to night , nothing has been seen of [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen to - day . " In a few days more , "[47-philip] [he]47-philip said , " [I]47-philip shall ask for leave of absence . EVENTS IN [THE FAMILY]550-the family , RELATED BY [MISS JILLGALL]66-miss jillgall . CHAPTER LVIII . DANGER . " If anything of importance happens , [I]3084-i trust to [you]3084-i to write an account of it , and to send the writing to [me]3084-i . [I]3084-i will come to [you]3084-i at once , if [I]3084-i see reason to believe that [my]3084-i presence is required . "[3084-i] Those lines , in [your]3084-i last kind reply to [me]0-i , rouse [my]0-i courage , [dear Mr. Governor]43-mr. governor , and sharpen the vigilance which has always been one of the strong points in [my]0-i character . Every suspicious circumstance which occurs in [this house]731-this house will be so to speak seized on by [my]0-i pen , and will find itself so to speak again placed on its trial , before [your]3084-i unerring judgment ! Let [the wicked]3086-the wicked tremble ! [I]0-i mention no names . Taking up [my]0-i narrative where it came to an end when [I]0-i last wrote , [I]0-i have to say a word first on the subject of [my]0-i discoveries , in regard to [Philip]47-philip 's movements . The advertisement of [a private inquiry office]3087-a private inquiry office , which [I]0-i read in a newspaper , put the thing into [my]0-i head . [I]0-i provided [myself]0-i with money to pay the expenses by - [I]0-i blush while [I]0-i write it - pawning [my]0-i watch . This humiliation of [my]0-i poor self has been rewarded by success . Skilled investigation has proved that [our young man]3088-our young man has come to [his]47-philip senses again , exactly as [I]0-i supposed . On each occasion when [he]47-philip was suspiciously absent from [the house]314-the house , [he]47-philip has been followed to [the farm]2245-the farm . [I]0-i have been staying [there]4103-there [myself]0-i for a day or two , in the hope of persuading [Eunice]53-eunice to relent . The hope has not yet been realized . But [Philip]47-philip 's devotion , assisted by [my]0-i influence , will yet prevail . Let [me]0-i not despair . Whether [Helena]52-helena knows positively that [she]52-helena has lost [her]52-helena wicked hold on [Philip]47-philip [I]0-i can not say . It seems hardly possible that [she]52-helena could have made the discovery just yet . The one thing of which [I]0-i am certain is , that [she]52-helena looks like [a fiend]3092-a fiend . [Philip]47-philip has wisely taken [my]0-i advice , and employed pious fraud . [He]47-philip will get away from [the wretch]3660-the wretch , who has tempted [him]47-philip once and may tempt [him]47-philip again , under pretense of using the interest of [[his]47-philip friends]570-his friends in [London]3-london to find a place under [Government]30-government . [He]47-philip has not been very well for the last day or two , and the execution of [our]3095-our project is in consequence delayed . [I]0-i have news of [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen which will , [I]0-i think , surprise [you]3096-you . [She]52-helena has kept away from [us]3095-our in a most unaccountable manner . [I]0-i called on [her]52-helena at [the hotel]1214-the hotel , and heard [she]52-helena was engaged with [[her]52-helena lawyer]3098-her lawyer . On the next day , [she]52-helena suddenly returned to [her]52-helena old habits , and paid the customary visit . [I]0-i observed a similar alteration in [her]52-helena state of feeling . [She]52-helena is now coldly civil to [Helena]52-helena ; and [she]52-helena asks after [Eunice]53-eunice with a maternal interest touching to see - [I]0-i said to [her]52-helena : " [Elizabeth]41-elizabeth , [you]52-helena appear to have changed [your]52-helena opinion of [the two girls]4727-the two girls , since [I]0-i saw [you]52-helena . "[0-i] [She]52-helena answered , with a delightful candor which reminded [me]0-i of old times : " Completely ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said : " [A woman of [your]52-helena intellectual caliber]5752-a woman of your intellectual caliber , [dear]4177-dear , does n't change [her]5752-a woman of your intellectual caliber mind without a good reason for it . "[0-i] [Elizabeth]41-elizabeth cordially agreed with [me]0-i . [I]0-i ventured to be a little more explicit : " [You]41-elizabeth have no doubt made some interesting discovery . "[0-i] [Elizabeth]41-elizabeth agreed again ; and [I]0-i ventured again : " [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i may not ask what the discovery is ? "[0-i] " No , [Selina]96-selina , [you]96-selina may not ask . "[0-i] This is curious ; but it is nothing to what [I]0-i have got to tell [you]3099-you next . [I]0-i have just received some overwhelming news , in the form of a neat parcel , addressed to [myself]0-i . There has been a scandal at [the hotel]1214-the hotel . [That monster in human form]3103-that monster in human form , [[Elizabeth]41-elizabeth 's husband]3104-elizabeth 's husband , is aware of [[his]3104-elizabeth 's husband wife]174-his wife 's professional fame , has heard of the large sums of money which [she]174-his wife earns as [the greatest living professor of massage]3106-the greatest living professor of massage , has been long on the lookout for [her]174-his wife , and has discovered [her]174-his wife at last . "[174-his wife] [I]0-i do n't presume to correct [Elizabeth]41-elizabeth 's language . [I]0-i should have called [you]3115-you [The idol of [the Women]139-the women]3116-the idol of the women . The second inclosure contains , as [I]0-i suppose , a wedding present . It is carefully sealed - it feels no bigger than an ordinary letter - and it contains an inscription which [your]3115-you highly - cultivated intelligence may be able to explain . [I]0-i copy it as follows : " To be inclosed in another envelope , addressed to [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip [the elder]3966-the elder , at [Percy 's Private Hotel]31-percy 's private hotel , [London]3-london , and delivered by [a trustworthy messenger]5758-a trustworthy messenger , on the day when [Mr. Philip Dunboyne]47-philip is married to [Miss Eunice Gracedieu]53-eunice . [I]0-i wonder whether that circumstance will puzzle [you]3115-you as it has puzzled [me]0-i . [I]0-i have kept [my]0-i report back , so as to send [you]3115-you the last news relating to [Philip]47-philip 's state of health . When [I]0-i ask if [he]47-philip is in pain , [he]47-philip says : " It is n't exactly pain ; [I]47-philip feel as if [I]47-philip was sinking . Sometimes [I]47-philip am giddy ; and sometimes [I]47-philip find [myself]47-philip feeling thirsty and sick . "[47-philip] [I]0-i have no opportunity of looking after [him]47-philip as [I]0-i could wish ; for [Helena]52-helena insists on nursing [him]47-philip , assisted by [the housemaid]900-the housemaid . [Maria]64-maria is [a very good girl in [her]64-maria way]3119-a very good girl in her way , but too stupid to be of much use . [You]3122-you had some talk with [this experienced physician]3123-this experienced physician when [you]3122-you were [here]225-here , and [you]3122-you know what [a clever man]1295-a clever man [he]3123-this experienced physician is . [I]0-i will wait to send this to the post until [I]0-i can write in a more definite way . Two days more have passed . [The doctor]162-the doctor has put two very strange questions to [me]0-i . [I]0-i said none that [I]0-i knew of - and [I]0-i took the liberty of asking what [he]162-the doctor meant . For [God]38-god 's sake come here as soon as [you]3132-you possibly can . The whole burden is thrown on [me]0-i - and [I]0-i am quite unequal to it . [I]0-i received [the doctor]162-the doctor to - day in [the drawing - room]4218-the drawing - room . "[162-the doctor] When [we]3136-we were in [the garden]637-the garden , [he]162-the doctor noticed that [I]0-i was trembling . " In [[the Minister]161-the minister 's helpless state]5762-the minister 's helpless state there is nobody whom [I]162-the doctor can speak to but [yourself]0-i . "[162-the doctor] [I]0-i ventured to remind [him]162-the doctor that [he]162-the doctor might speak to [Helena]52-helena as well as to [myself]0-i . [He]162-the doctor looked as black as thunder when [I]0-i mentioned [her]52-helena name . All [he]162-the doctor said was , " No ! "[162-the doctor] But , oh , if [you]3138-you had heard [his]162-the doctor voice - and [he]162-the doctor so gentle and sweet - tempered at other times - [you]3138-you would have felt , as [I]0-i did , that [he]162-the doctor had [Helena]52-helena in [his]162-the doctor mind ! " Now , listen to this , "[162-the doctor] [he]162-the doctor went on . " Everything that [my]162-the doctor art can do for [Mr. Philip Dunboyne]47-philip , while [I]162-the doctor am at [his]47-philip bedside , is undone while [I]162-the doctor am away by [some other person]5763-some other person . [He]47-philip is worse to - day than [I]162-the doctor have seen [him]47-philip yet . "[162-the doctor] " Oh , [sir]3443-sir , do [you]3443-sir think [he]47-philip will die ? "[162-the doctor] " [He]47-philip will certainly die unless the right means are taken to save [him]47-philip , and taken at once . It is [my]162-the doctor duty not to flinch from telling [you]3443-sir the truth . [I]162-the doctor have made a discovery since yesterday which satisfies [me]162-the doctor that [I]162-the doctor am right . [Somebody]983-somebody is trying to poison [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip ; and [somebody]983-somebody will succeed unless [he]47-philip is removed from [this house]731-this house . "[162-the doctor] [I]0-i am [a poor feeble creature]3139-a poor feeble creature . [The doctor]162-the doctor caught [me]0-i , or [I]0-i should have dropped on the grass . It was not a fainting - fit . [I]0-i only shook and shivered so that [I]0-i was too weak to stand up . Encouraged by [the doctor]162-the doctor , [I]0-i recovered sufficiently to be able to ask [him]162-the doctor where [Philip]47-philip was to be taken to . [He]162-the doctor said : " To [the hospital]414-the hospital . [No poisoner]5769-no poisoner can follow [[my]162-the doctor patient]4666-my patient [there]4103-there . Persuade [him]4666-my patient to let [me]162-the doctor take [him]4666-my patient away , when [I]162-the doctor call again in an hour 's time . "[162-the doctor] As soon as [I]0-i could hold a pen , [I]0-i sent a telegram to [you]3142-you . Pray , pray come by [the earliest train]3143-the earliest train . [I]0-i also telegraphed to [old Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip , at [the hotel in [London]3-london]3144-the hotel in london . It was impossible for [me]0-i to face [Helena]52-helena ; [I]0-i own [I]0-i was afraid . [The cook]629-the cook kindly went [upstairs]3864-upstairs to see who was in [[Philip]47-philip 's room]3147-philip 's room . It was [the housemaid]900-the housemaid 's turn to look after [him]47-philip for a while . [I]0-i went instantly to [his]47-philip bedside . There was no persuading [him]47-philip to allow [himself]47-philip to be taken to [the hospital]414-the hospital . " [I]47-philip am dying , "[47-philip] [he]47-philip said . " If [you]0-i have any pity for [me]47-philip , send for [Euneece]77-euneece . Let [me]47-philip see [her]77-euneece once more , let [me]47-philip hear [her]77-euneece say that [she]77-euneece forgives [me]47-philip , before [I]47-philip die . "[47-philip] [I]0-i hesitated . It was too terrible to think of [Euneece]77-euneece in [the same house]4665-the same house with [[her]77-euneece sister]544-her sister . [Her]77-euneece life might be in danger ! [Philip]47-philip gave [me]0-i a look , a dreadful ghastly look . " If [you]0-i refuse , "[47-philip] [he]47-philip said wildly , " the grave wo n't hold [me]47-philip . [I]47-philip 'll haunt [you]0-i for the rest of [your]0-i life . "[47-philip] " [She]77-euneece shall hear that [you]47-philip are ill , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered - and ran out of [the room]3541-the room before [he]47-philip could speak again . What [I]0-i had promised to write , [I]0-i did write . But , placed between [Euneece]77-euneece 's danger and [Philip]47-philip 's danger , [my]0-i heart was all for [Euneece]77-euneece . Would [Helena]52-helena spare [her]77-euneece , if [she]77-euneece came to [Philip]47-philip 's bedside ? In such terror as [I]0-i never felt before in [my]0-i life , [I]0-i added a word more , entreating [her]77-euneece not to leave [the farm]2245-the farm . [I]0-i promised to keep [her]77-euneece regularly informed on the subject of [Philip]47-philip 's illness ; and [I]0-i mentioned that [I]0-i expected [the Governor]148-the governor to return to [us]3155-us immediately . " Do nothing , "[0-i] [I]0-i wrote , " without [his]148-the governor advice . "[0-i] [My]0-i letter having been completed , [I]0-i sent [the cook]629-the cook away with it , in a chaise . [She]77-euneece belonged to [the neighborhood]3157-the neighborhood , and [she]77-euneece knew [the farmhouse]2590-the farmhouse well . Nearly two hours afterward , [I]0-i heard the chaise stop at the door , and ran out , impatient to hear how [[my]0-i sweet girl]4391-my sweet girl had received [my]0-i letter . God help [us]3155-us all ! When [I]0-i opened the door , [the first person whom [I]0-i saw]3160-the first person whom i saw was [Euneece]77-euneece [herself]77-euneece . [CHAPTER LIX . DEFENSE]141-chapter lix . defense . [One surprise]3161-one surprise followed another , after [I]0-i had encountered [Euneece]77-euneece at the door . When [my]0-i fondness had excused [her]77-euneece for setting the well - meant advice in [my]0-i letter at defiance , [I]0-i was conscious of expecting to see [her]77-euneece in tears ; eager , distressingly eager , to hear what hope there might be of [Philip]47-philip 's recovery . [I]0-i saw no tears , [I]0-i heard no inquiries . [She]77-euneece was pale , and quiet , and silent . Not a word fell from [her]77-euneece when [we]3155-us met , not a word when [she]77-euneece kissed [me]0-i , not a word when [she]77-euneece led the way into [the nearest room]3162-the nearest room - [the dining - room]1663-the dining - room . It was only when [we]3155-us were shut in together that [she]77-euneece spoke . " Which is [[Philip]47-philip 's room]3147-philip 's room ? "[77-euneece] [she]77-euneece asked . [I]0-i pointed toward [the back dining - room]3164-the back dining - room , which had been made into [a bedroom for [Philip]47-philip]3165-a bedroom for philip . " Who is with [him]47-philip now ? "[3167-this sadly - changed girl] was the next strange thing [this sadly - changed girl]3167-this sadly - changed girl said to [me]0-i . " [Euneece]77-euneece got no further than that . [Her]77-euneece breath quickened , [her]77-euneece color faded away . [I]77-euneece had seen [people]673-people look as [she]77-euneece was looking now , when [they]673-people suffered under some sudden pain . Before [I]77-euneece could offer to help [her]77-euneece , [she]77-euneece rallied , and went on : "[77-euneece] Where , " [she]77-euneece began again , "[3168-the other nurse] is [the other nurse]3168-the other nurse ? " When [I]0-i remind [you]0-i , [dear Mr. Governor]43-mr. governor , that [my]0-i letter had carefully concealed from [her]77-euneece the horrible discovery made by [the doctor]162-the doctor , [your]0-i imagination will picture [my]0-i state of mind . [She]77-euneece saw that [I]0-i was overpowered . [Her]77-euneece sweet nature , so strangely frozen up thus far , melted at last . [[My]0-i dear]3949-my dear , [I]0-i have driven round by [[the doctor]162-the doctor 's house]3173-the doctor 's house - [I]0-i have seen [him]162-the doctor - [I]0-i have persuaded [him]162-the doctor , or perhaps [I]0-i ought to say surprised [him]162-the doctor , into telling [me]0-i the truth . But [the kind old man]3174-the kind old man is obstinate . [He]3174-the kind old man would n't believe [me]0-i when [I]0-i told [him]3174-the kind old man [I]0-i was on [my]0-i way here to save [Philip]47-philip 's life . ' " "[3174-the kind old man] [He]3174-the kind old man was right , [Euneece]77-euneece , entirely right . " "[3174-the kind old man] No , [dear]4177-dear , [he]3174-the kind old man was wrong . " [I]0-i persisted . "[0-i] Go back to [the farm]2245-the farm ! " "[0-i] Can [I]0-i see [Philip]47-philip ? " [she]242-my child asked . [I]0-i have heard [some insolent men]5775-some insolent men say that [women]195-women are like cats . If [they]5775-some insolent men mean that [we]5777-we do , figuratively speaking , scratch at times , [I]0-i am afraid [they]5775-some insolent men are not altogether wrong . An irresistible impulse made [me]0-i say to poor [Euneece]77-euneece : "[0-i] This is a change indeed , since [you]242-my child refused to receive [Philip]47-philip . " "[242-my child] Is there no change in the circumstances ? " [she]242-my child asked sadly . "[242-my child] Is n't [he]47-philip ill and in danger ? " [I]0-i begged [her]242-my child to forgive [me]0-i ; [I]0-i said [I]0-i meant no harm . " [She]242-my child put [her]242-my child arm round [me]140-miss jillgall , and made [me]140-miss jillgall get up from [my]140-miss jillgall chair . [I]140-miss jillgall was so easily persuaded by [her]242-my child , that the fear of what [Helena]52-helena 's jealousy and [Helena]52-helena 's anger might do was scarcely present in [my]140-miss jillgall thoughts . " "[4033-miss] [I]0-i am to call [her]52-helena , [miss]4033-miss , in ten minutes more . " "[52-helena] Wait in [the dining - room]1663-the dining - room , [Maria]64-maria , till [I]0-i come back to [you]64-maria . " [She]64-maria joined [me]0-i .
