It was not out of curiosity ; the feeling that urged [me]0-i was sympathy , when [I]0-i waited a moment to see [their]5783-their first meeting . [She]64-maria bent over [the poor , pallid , trembling , suffering man]5784-the poor , pallid , trembling , suffering man , and raised [him]5784-the poor , pallid , trembling , suffering man in [her]64-maria arms , and laid [his]5784-the poor , pallid , trembling , suffering man head on [her]64-maria bosom . "[0-i] [[My]0-i [Philip]47-philip]3190-my philip ! " [She]64-maria murmured those words in a kiss . [I]0-i closed the door , [I]0-i had a good cry ; and , oh , how it comforted [me]0-i ! There was only a minute to spare when [she]64-maria came out of [the room]3541-the room . [Maria]64-maria was waiting for [her]64-maria . [Euneece]77-euneece said , as quietly as ever : "[0-i] Go and call [Miss Gracedieu]52-helena . " [The girl]377-the girl looked at [her]64-maria , and saw - [I]3191-i do n't know what . [Maria]64-maria became alarmed . But [she]64-maria went up [the stairs]1016-the stairs , and returned in haste to tell [us]5788-us that [[her]64-maria young mistress]5789-her young mistress was coming down . The faint rustling of [Helena]52-helena 's dress as [she]52-helena left [[her]52-helena room]1655-her room reached [us]5788-us in the silence . [I]3191-i remained at the open door of [the dining - room]1663-the dining - room , and [Maria]64-maria approached and stood near [me]3191-i . [We]5788-us were both frightened . [Euneece]77-euneece stepped forward , and stood on the mat at the foot of the stairs , waiting . [Her]52-helena back was toward [me]3191-i ; [I]3191-i could only see that [she]52-helena was as still as a statue . The rustling of the dress came nearer . Oh , heavens ! what was going to happen ? [My]3191-i teeth chattered in [my]3191-i head ; [I]3191-i held by [Maria]64-maria 's shoulder . Drops of perspiration showed themselves on [the girl]377-the girl 's forehead ; [she]52-helena stared in vacant terror at [the slim little figure , posted firm and still on the mat]5793-the slim little figure , posted firm and still on the mat . [Helena]52-helena turned the corner of the stairs , and waited a moment on [the last landing]5794-the last landing , and saw [[her]52-helena sister]544-her sister . "[3191-i] [You]3191-i here ? " [she]52-helena said . "[3191-i] What do [you]3191-i want ? " There was no reply . [Helena]52-helena descended , until [she]52-helena reached the last stair but one . There , [she]52-helena stopped . [Her]52-helena staring eyes grew large and wild ; [her]52-helena hand shook as [she]52-helena stretched it out , feeling for the banister ; [she]52-helena staggered as [she]52-helena caught at it , and held [herself]52-helena up . The silence was still unbroken . Something in [me]3191-i , stronger than [myself]3191-i , drew [my]3191-i steps along [the hall]1431-the hall nearer and nearer to [the stair]5797-the stair , till [I]3191-i could see the face which had struck [that murderous wretch with terror]5798-that murderous wretch with terror . [I]3191-i looked . No ! it was not [[my]3191-i sweet girl]4391-my sweet girl ; it was a horrid transformation of [her]4391-my sweet girl . [I]3191-i saw [a fearful creature , with glittering eyes that threatened some unimaginable vengeance]5800-a fearful creature , with glittering eyes that threatened some unimaginable vengeance . [Her]4391-my sweet girl lips were drawn back ; they showed [her]4391-my sweet girl clinched teeth . A burning red flush dyed [her]4391-my sweet girl face . The hair of [her]4391-my sweet girl head rose , little by little , slowly . And , most dreadful sight of all , [she]4391-my sweet girl seemed , in the stillness of [the house]314-the house , to be listening to something . If [I]3191-i could have moved , [I]3191-i should have fled to [the first place of refuge [I]3191-i could find]5802-the first place of refuge i could find . If [I]3191-i could have raised [my]3191-i voice , [I]3191-i should have cried for help . [I]3191-i could do neither the one nor the other . [I]3191-i could only look , look , look ; held by the horror of it with a hand of iron . [Helena]52-helena must have roused [her]52-helena courage , and resisted [her]52-helena terror . [I]3191-i heard [her]52-helena speak : "[3191-i] Let [me]0-i by ! " "[3191-i] No . " Slowly , steadily , in a whisper , [Euneece]77-euneece made that reply . [Helena]52-helena tried once more - still fighting against [her]52-helena own terror : [I]3191-i knew it by the trembling of [her]52-helena voice . "[3191-i] Let [me]0-i by , " [she]52-helena repeated ; "[0-i] [I]0-i am on [my]0-i way to [[Philip]47-philip 's room]3147-philip 's room . " "[0-i] [You]0-i will never enter [[Philip]47-philip 's room]3147-philip 's room again . " "[0-i] Who will stop [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i will . " [She]52-helena had spoken in the same steady whisper throughout - but now [she]52-helena moved . [I]142-poisoner saw [her]52-helena set [her]52-helena foot on the first stair . [I]142-poisoner saw the horrid glitter in [her]52-helena eyes flash close into [Helena]52-helena 's face . [I]142-poisoner heard [her]52-helena say : "[142-poisoner] [Poisoner]142-poisoner , go back to [[your]142-poisoner room]4496-your room . " Silent and shuddering , [Helena]52-helena shrank away from [her]52-helena - daunted by [her]52-helena glittering eyes ; mastered by [her]52-helena lifted hand pointing up the stairs . [Helena]52-helena slowly ascended till [she]52-helena reached [the landing]1520-the landing . [She]52-helena turned and looked down ; [she]52-helena tried to speak . The pointing hand struck [her]52-helena dumb , and drove [her]52-helena up [the next flight of stairs]5804-the next flight of stairs . [She]52-helena was lost to view . Only the small rustling sound of the dress was to be heard , growing fainter and fainter ; then an interval of stillness ; then the noise of a door opened and closed again ; then no sound more - but a change to be seen : [the transformed creature]5805-the transformed creature was crouching on [her]5805-the transformed creature knees , still and silent , [her]5805-the transformed creature face covered by [her]5805-the transformed creature hands . [I]142-poisoner was afraid to approach [her]5805-the transformed creature ; [I]142-poisoner was afraid to speak to [her]5805-the transformed creature . After a time , [she]5805-the transformed creature rose . Suddenly , swiftly , with [her]5805-the transformed creature head turned away from [me]142-poisoner , [she]5805-the transformed creature opened the door of [[Philip]47-philip 's room]3147-philip 's room - and was gone . [I]142-poisoner looked round . There was only [Maria]64-maria in [the lonely hall]5807-the lonely hall . Shall [I]142-poisoner try to tell [you]5808-you what [my]142-poisoner sensations were ? It may sound strangely , but it is true - [I]142-poisoner felt like [a sleeper , who has half - awakened from a dream]5809-a sleeper , who has half - awakened from a dream . CHAPTER LX . [DISCOVERY]143-discovery . A little later , on that eventful day , when [I]142-poisoner was most in need of all that [your]5808-you wisdom and kindness could do to guide [me]142-poisoner , came the telegram which announced that [you]5808-you were helpless under an attack of gout . As soon as [I]142-poisoner had in some degree got over [my]142-poisoner disappointment , [I]142-poisoner remembered having told [Euneece]77-euneece in [my]142-poisoner letter that [I]142-poisoner expected [[her]77-euneece kind old friend]5810-her kind old friend to come to [us]5811-us . With the telegram in [my]142-poisoner hand [I]142-poisoner knocked softly at [Philip]47-philip 's door . The voice that bade [me]142-poisoner come in was the gentle voice that [I]142-poisoner knew so well . [Philip]47-philip was sleeping . There , by [his]47-philip bedside , with [his]47-philip hand resting in [her]77-euneece hand , was [Euneece]77-euneece , so completely restored to [her]77-euneece own sweet self that [I]142-poisoner could hardly believe what [I]142-poisoner had seen , not an hour since . [She]77-euneece talked of [you]142-poisoner , when [I]142-poisoner showed [her]77-euneece [your]142-poisoner message , with affectionate interest and regret . Look back , [[my]142-poisoner admirable friend]5812-my admirable friend , at what [I]142-poisoner have written on the two or three pages which precede this , and explain the astounding contrast if [you]142-poisoner can . [I]142-poisoner was left alone to watch by [Philip]47-philip , while [Euneece]77-euneece went away to see [[her]77-euneece father]614-her father . Soon afterward , [Maria]64-maria took [my]142-poisoner place ; [I]142-poisoner had been sent for to [the next room]1507-the next room to receive [the doctor]162-the doctor . [He]162-the doctor looked care - worn and grieved . [I]142-poisoner said [I]142-poisoner was afraid [he]162-the doctor had brought bad news with [him]162-the doctor . "[142-poisoner] The worst possible news , " [he]162-the doctor answered . "[142-poisoner] A terrible exposure threatens [this family]3195-this family , and [I]0-i am powerless to prevent it . " [He]162-the doctor then asked [me]0-i to remember the day when [I]0-i had been surprised by the singular questions which [he]162-the doctor had put to [me]0-i , and when [he]162-the doctor had engaged to explain [himself]162-the doctor after [he]162-the doctor had made some inquiries . Why , and how , [he]162-the doctor had set those inquiries on foot was what [he]162-the doctor had now to tell . [I]0-i will repeat what [he]162-the doctor said , in [his]162-the doctor own words , as nearly as [I]0-i can remember them . While [he]162-the doctor was in attendance on [Philip]47-philip , [he]162-the doctor had observed symptoms which made [him]162-the doctor suspect that [Digitalis]144-digitalis had been given to [the young man]4367-the young man , in doses often repeated . Cases of attempted poisoning by this medicine were so rare , that [he]162-the doctor felt bound to put [his]162-the doctor suspicions to the test by going round among [[the chemists]5817-the chemists 's shops]5818-the chemists 's shops - excepting of course [the shop at which [his]162-the doctor own prescriptions were made up]5819-the shop at which his own prescriptions were made up - and asking if [they]5817-the chemists had lately dispensed any preparation of Digitalis , ordered perhaps in a larger quantity than usual . At [the second shop]5820-the second shop [he]162-the doctor visited , [the chemist]5821-the chemist laughed . "[0-i] Why , [doctor]419-doctor , " [he]5821-the chemist said , "[419-doctor] have [you]419-doctor forgotten [your]419-doctor own prescription ? " After this , the prescription was asked for , and produced . It was on the paper used by [the doctor]162-the doctor - paper which had [his]162-the doctor address printed at the top , and a notice added , telling patients who came to consult [him]162-the doctor for the second time to bring [their]5817-the chemists prescriptions with [them]5817-the chemists . Then , there followed in writing : "[419-doctor] Tincture of [Digitalis]144-digitalis , one ounce " - with [his]162-the doctor signature at the end , not badly imitated , but a forgery nevertheless . [The chemist]5821-the chemist noticed the effect which this discovery had produced on [the doctor]162-the doctor , and asked if that was [his]162-the doctor signature . [He]162-the doctor could hardly , as [an honest man]165-an honest man , have asserted that a forgery was a signature of [his]162-the doctor own writing . So [he]162-the doctor made the true reply , and asked who had presented the prescription . [The chemist]5821-the chemist called to [[his]5821-the chemist assistant]5827-his assistant to come forward . "[419-doctor] Did [you]419-doctor tell [me]0-i that [you]419-doctor knew , by sight , [the young lady who brought this prescription]3197-the young lady who brought this prescription ? " [The assistant]5828-the assistant admitted it . "[419-doctor] Did [you]419-doctor tell [me]0-i [she]3197-the young lady who brought this prescription was [Miss Helena Gracedieu]52-helena ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i did . " "[0-i] Are [you]419-doctor sure of not having made any mistake ? " "[419-doctor] Quite sure . " [The chemist]5821-the chemist then said : "[0-i] [I]0-i [myself]0-i supplied the Tincture of Digitalis , and [the young lady]3971-the young lady paid for it , and took it away with [her]3971-the young lady . [You]419-doctor have had all the information that [I]0-i can give [you]419-doctor , [sir]3443-sir ; and [I]0-i may now ask , if [you]419-doctor can throw any light on the matter . " [[Our]5830-our good friend]5831-our good friend thought of [the poor Minister]3693-the poor minister , so sorely afflicted , and of the famous name so sincerely respected in [the town]205-the town and in [the country]3999-the country round , and said [he]5831-our good friend could not undertake to give an immediate answer . [The chemist]5821-the chemist was excessively angry . "[419-doctor] [You]419-doctor know as well as [I]0-i do , " [he]0-i said , "[419-doctor] that Digitalis , given in certain doses , is a poison , and [you]419-doctor can not deny that [I]0-i honestly believed [myself]0-i to be dispensing [your]419-doctor prescription . While [you]419-doctor are hesitating to give [me]0-i an answer , [my]0-i character may suffer ; [I]0-i may be suspected [myself]0-i . " [He]0-i ended in declaring [he]0-i should consult [[his]0-i lawyer]5836-his lawyer . [The doctor]162-the doctor went [home]258-home , and questioned [[his]162-the doctor servant]5839-his servant . [The man]3581-the man remembered the day of [Miss Helena]52-helena 's visit in the afternoon , and the intention that [she]52-helena expressed of waiting for [[his]3581-the man master]5744-his master 's return . [He]162-the doctor had shown [her]52-helena into [the parlor]5842-the parlor which opened into [the consulting - room]5746-the consulting - room . [No other visitor]5844-no other visitor was in [the house]314-the house at that time , or had arrived during the rest of the day . [The doctor]162-the doctor 's own experience , when [he]162-the doctor got [home]258-home , led [him]162-the doctor to conclude that [Helena]52-helena had gone into [the consulting - room]5746-the consulting - room . [He]162-the doctor had entered [that room]5849-that room , for the purpose of writing some prescriptions , and had found the leaves of paper that [he]162-the doctor used diminished in number . After what [he]162-the doctor had heard , and what [he]162-the doctor had discovered to say nothing of what [he]162-the doctor suspected , it occurred to [him]162-the doctor to look along the shelves of [[his]162-the doctor medical library]5850-his medical library . [He]162-the doctor found a volume treating of Poisons with a slip of paper left between the leaves ; the poison described at the place so marked being Digitalis , and the paper used being one of [his]162-the doctor own prescription - papers . "[419-doctor] If , as [I]0-i fear , a legal investigation into [Helena]52-helena 's conduct is a possible event , " [the doctor]162-the doctor concluded , "[52-helena] there is the evidence that [I]0-i shall be obliged to give , when [I]0-i am called as [a witness]227-a witness . " It is [my]52-helena belief that [I]52-helena could have felt no greater dismay , if the long arm of the Law had laid its hold on [me]52-helena while [he]162-the doctor was speaking . [I]52-helena asked what was to be done . "[52-helena] If [she]52-helena leaves [the house]314-the house at once , " [the doctor]162-the doctor replied , ' [she]52-helena may escape the infamy of being charged with an attempt at murder by poison ; and , in [her]52-helena absence , [I]52-helena can answer for [Philip]47-philip 's life . [I]52-helena do n't urge [you]0-i to warn [her]52-helena , because that might be a dangerous thing to do . It is for [you]0-i to decide , as [a member of [the family]550-the family]4028-a member of the family , whether [you]0-i will run the risk . "[52-helena] [I]0-i tried to speak to [him]3202-he of [Euneece]77-euneece , and to tell [him]3202-he what [I]0-i had already related to [yourself]0-i . [He]3202-he was in no humor to listen to [me]0-i . " Keep it for a fitter time , "[3202-he] [he]3202-he answered ; " and think of what [I]3202-he have just said to [you]0-i . "[3202-he] With that , [he]3202-he left [me]0-i , on [his]3202-he way to [[Philip]47-philip 's room]3147-philip 's room . Mental exertion was completely beyond [me]0-i . Can [you]0-i understand [a poor middle - aged spinster]3204-a poor middle - aged spinster being frightened into doing a dangerous thing ? That may seem to be nonsense . But if [you]0-i ask why [I]0-i took a morsel of paper , and wrote the warning which [I]0-i was afraid to communicate by word of mouth - why [I]0-i went [upstairs]3864-upstairs with [my]0-i knees knocking together , and opened the door of [[Helena]52-helena 's room]1730-helena 's room just wide enough to let [my]0-i hand pass through - why [I]0-i threw the paper in , and banged the door to again , and ran [downstairs]4170-downstairs as [I]0-i have never run since [I]0-i was [a little girl]3483-a little girl - [I]0-i can only say , in the way of explanation , what [I]0-i have said already : [I]0-i was frightened into doing it . What [I]0-i have written , thus far , [I]0-i shall send to [you]0-i by to - night 's post . [The doctor]162-the doctor came back to [me]0-i , after [he]162-the doctor had seen [Philip]47-philip , and spoken with [Euneece]77-euneece . [He]162-the doctor was very angry ; and , [I]0-i must own , not without reason . [Philip]47-philip had flatly refused to let [himself]47-philip be removed to [the hospital]414-the hospital ; and [Euneece]77-euneece - " [a mere girl]5855-a mere girl "[77-euneece] - had declared that [she]77-euneece would be answerable for consequences ! [The doctor]162-the doctor warned [me]0-i that [he]162-the doctor meant to withdraw from the case , and to make [his]162-the doctor declaration before [the magistrates]4333-the magistrates . At [my]0-i entreaties [he]162-the doctor consented to return in the evening , and to judge by results before taking the terrible step that [he]162-the doctor had threatened . While [I]0-i remained at [home]258-home on the watch , keeping the doors of [both rooms]3214-both rooms locked , [Eunice]53-eunice went out to get [Philip]47-philip 's medicine . [She]53-eunice came back , followed by [a boy carrying a portable apparatus for cooking]3215-a boy carrying a portable apparatus for cooking . " All that [Philip]47-philip wants , and all that [we]5856-we want , "[53-eunice] [she]53-eunice explained , " [we]5856-we can provide for [ourselves]5856-we . Give [me]53-eunice a morsel of paper to write on . "[53-eunice] Unhooking the little pencil attached to [her]53-eunice watch - chain , [she]53-eunice paused and looked toward the door . " [Somebody]983-somebody listening , "[53-eunice] [she]53-eunice whispered . " Let [them]983-somebody listen . "[53-eunice] [She]53-eunice wrote a list of necessaries , in the way of things to eat and things to drink , and asked [me]0-i to go out and get them [myself]0-i . " [I]53-eunice do n't doubt [the servants]4290-the servants , "[53-eunice] [she]53-eunice said , speaking distinctly enough to be heard outside ; " but [I]53-eunice am afraid of what [a Poisoner]5859-a poisoner 's cunning and [a Poisoner]5859-a poisoner 's desperation may do , in [a kitchen which is open to [her]53-eunice]5861-a kitchen which is open to her . "[53-eunice] [I]0-i went away on [my]0-i errand - discovering [no listener]3216-no listener outside , [I]0-i need hardly say . On [my]0-i return , [I]0-i found the door of communication with [[Philip]47-philip 's room]3147-philip 's room closed , but no longer locked . " [We]5862-we can now attend on [him]47-philip in turn , "[53-eunice] [she]53-eunice said , " without opening either of the doors which lead into [the hall]1431-the hall . At night [we]5862-we can relieve [each other]3725-each other , and each of [us]5862-we can get sleep as [we]5862-we want it in the large armchair in [the dining - room]1663-the dining - room . [Philip]47-philip must be safe under [our]5862-we charge , or [the doctor]162-the doctor will insist on taking [him]47-philip to [the hospital]414-the hospital . When [we]5862-we want [Maria]64-maria 's help , from time to time , [we]5862-we can employ [her]64-maria under [our]5862-we own superintendence . Have [you]0-i anything else , [Selina]140-miss jillgall , to suggest ? "[53-eunice] There was nothing left to suggest . Young and inexperienced as [she]53-eunice was , how [I]0-i asked had [she]53-eunice contrived to think of all this ? [She]53-eunice answered , simply " [I]53-eunice 'm sure [I]53-eunice do n't know ; [my]53-eunice thoughts came to [me]53-eunice while [I]53-eunice was looking at [Philip]47-philip . "[53-eunice] Soon afterward [I]0-i found an opportunity of inquiring if [Helena]52-helena had left [the house]314-the house . [She]52-helena had just rung [her]52-helena bell ; and [Maria]64-maria had found [her]52-helena , quietly reading , in [[her]52-helena room]1655-her room . Hours afterward , when [I]0-i was on the watch at night , [I]0-i heard [Philip]47-philip 's door softly tried from the outside . [Her]52-helena dreadful purpose had not been given up , even yet . [The doctor]162-the doctor came in the evening , as [he]162-the doctor had promised , and found an improvement in [Philip]47-philip 's health . [I]0-i mentioned what precautions [we]3221-we had taken , and that they had been devised by [Euneece]77-euneece . " Are [you]162-the doctor going to withdraw from the case ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [I]162-the doctor am coming back to the case , "[162-the doctor] [he]162-the doctor answered , " to - morrow morning . "[162-the doctor] It had been a disappointment to [me]0-i to receive no answer to the telegram which [I]0-i had sent to [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip [the elder]3966-the elder . The next day 's post brought the explanation in a letter to [Philip]47-philip from [[his]47-philip father]3972-his father , directed to [him]162-the doctor at [the hotel]1214-the hotel [here]225-here . This showed that [my]0-i telegram , giving [my]0-i address at [this house]731-this house , had not been received . [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip announced that [he]162-the doctor had returned to [Ireland]7-ireland , finding the air of [London]3-london unendurable , after the sea - breezes at [home]258-home . If [Philip]47-philip had already married , [[his]47-philip father]3972-his father would leave [him]47-philip to a life of genteel poverty with [Helena Gracedieu]52-helena . If [he]47-philip had thought better of it , [his]47-philip welcome was waiting for [him]47-philip . Little did [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip know what changes had taken place since [he]47-philip and [[his]47-philip son]3903-his son had last met , and what hope might yet present itself of brighter days for [poor Euneece]77-euneece ! [I]0-i thought of writing to [him]47-philip . But how would [that crabbed old man]3230-that crabbed old man receive a confidential letter from [a lady who was [a stranger]287-a stranger]3231-a lady who was a stranger ? [My]0-i doubts were set at rest by [Philip]47-philip [himself]47-philip . [He]47-philip asked [me]0-i to write a few lines of reply to [[his]47-philip father]3972-his father ; declaring that [his]47-philip marriage with [Helena]52-helena was broken off - that [he]47-philip had not given up all hope of being permitted to offer the sincere expression of [his]47-philip penitence to [Euneece]77-euneece - and that [he]47-philip would gladly claim [his]47-philip welcome , as soon as [he]47-philip was well enough to undertake the journey to [Ireland]7-ireland . When [he]47-philip had signed the letter , [I]0-i was so pleased that [I]0-i made a smart remark . [I]0-i said : " This is a treaty of peace between [father]3936-father and [son]5216-son . "[0-i] When [the doctor]162-the doctor arrived in the morning , and found the change for the better in [[his]162-the doctor patient]2413-his patient confirmed , [he]162-the doctor did justice to [us]3236-us at last . [He]162-the doctor spoke kindly , and even gratefully , to [Euneece]77-euneece . No more allusions to [the hospital]414-the hospital as [a place of safety]3238-a place of safety escaped [him]162-the doctor . [He]162-the doctor asked [me]0-i cautiously for news of [Helena]52-helena . [I]0-i could only tell [him]162-the doctor that [she]52-helena had gone out at [her]52-helena customary time , and had returned at [her]52-helena customary time . [He]162-the doctor did not attempt to conceal that [my]0-i reply had made [him]162-the doctor uneasy . " Are [you]162-the doctor still afraid that [she]52-helena may succeed in poisoning [Philip]47-philip ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [I]162-the doctor am afraid of [her]52-helena cunning , "[162-the doctor] [he]162-the doctor said . " If [she]52-helena is charged with attempting to poison [young Dunboyne]47-philip , [she]52-helena has some system of defense , [you]47-philip may rely on it , for which [we]3239-we are not prepared . There , in [my]162-the doctor opinion , is the true reason for [her]52-helena extraordinary insensibility to [her]52-helena own danger . "[162-the doctor] Two more days passed , and [we]3239-we were still safe under the protection of lock and key . On the evening of the second day which was a Monday [Maria]64-maria came to [me]0-i in great tribulation . On inquiring what was the matter , [I]0-i received a disquieting reply : " [Miss Helena]52-helena is tempting [me]0-i . [She]52-helena is so miserable at being prevented from seeing [Mr. Philip]47-philip , and helping to nurse [him]47-philip , that it is quite distressing to see [her]52-helena . At the same time , [miss]4033-miss , it 's hard on [a poor servant]5871-a poor servant . [She]52-helena asks [me]0-i to take the key secretly out of the door , and lend it to [her]52-helena at night for a few minutes only . [I]0-i 'm really afraid [I]0-i shall be led into doing it , if [she]52-helena goes on persuading [me]0-i much longer . "[0-i] [I]0-i commended [Maria]64-maria for feeling scruples which proved [her]64-maria to be the best of [good girls]3240-good girls , and promised to relieve [her]64-maria from all fear of future temptation . This was easily done . [Euneece]77-euneece kept the key of [Philip]47-philip 's door in [her]77-euneece pocket ; and [I]0-i kept the key of the dining - room door in [mine]0-i . CHAPTER LXI . ATROCITY . On the next day , a Tuesday in the week , an event took place which [Euneece]77-euneece and [I]0-i viewed with distrust . Early in the afternoon , [a young man]1228-a young man called with a note for [Helena]52-helena . It was to be given to [her]52-helena immediately , and no answer was required . [Maria]64-maria had just closed [the house]314-the house door , and was on [her]64-maria way [upstairs]3864-upstairs with the letter , when [she]64-maria was called back by another ring at the bell . [[Our]3244-our visitor]3245-our visitor was [the doctor]162-the doctor . [He]162-the doctor spoke to [Maria]64-maria in [the hall]1431-the hall : " [I]162-the doctor think [I]162-the doctor see a note in [your]64-maria hand . Was it given to [you]64-maria by [the young man who has just left [the house]314-the house]5872-the young man who has just left the house ? "[162-the doctor] " Yes , [sir]3443-sir . "[162-the doctor] If [he]3248-he 's [[your]64-maria sweetheart]3249-your sweetheart , [[my]0-i dear]3949-my dear , [I]0-i have nothing more to say . " "[0-i] Good gracious , [doctor]419-doctor , how [you]419-doctor do talk ! [I]0-i never saw [the young man]4367-the young man before in [my]0-i life . " "[0-i] In that case , [Maria]64-maria , [I]0-i will ask [you]64-maria to let [me]0-i look at the address . Aha ! Mischief ! " The moment [I]0-i heard that [I]0-i threw open the dining - room door . Curiosity is not easily satisfied . When it hears , it wants to see ; when it sees , it wants to know . [Every lady]5875-every lady will agree with [me]0-i in this observation . "[0-i] Pray come in , " [I]140-miss jillgall said . "[140-miss jillgall] One minute , [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall . [[My]0-i girl]4794-my girl , when [you]64-maria give [Miss Helena]52-helena that note , try to get a sly look at [her]52-helena when [she]52-helena opens it , and come and tell [me]0-i what [you]64-maria have seen . " [He]0-i joined [me]64-maria in [the dining - room]1663-the dining - room , and closed the door . "[64-maria] The other day , " [he]0-i went on , "[64-maria] when [I]0-i told [you]64-maria what [I]0-i had discovered in [the chemist 's shop]3254-the chemist 's shop , [I]0-i think [I]0-i mentioned [a young man who was called to speak to a question of identity]3255-a young man who was called to speak to a question of identity - [an assistant who knew [Miss Helena Gracedieu]52-helena]3256-an assistant who knew miss helena gracedieu by sight . " "[3255-a young man who was called to speak to a question of identity] Yes , yes ! " "[780-that young man] [That young man]780-that young man left the note which [Maria]64-maria has just taken [upstairs]3864-upstairs . " "[780-that young man] Who wrote it , [doctor]419-doctor , and what does it say ? " "[780-that young man] Questions naturally asked , [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall - and not easily answered . Where is [Eunice]53-eunice ? [Her]53-eunice quick wit might help [us]3260-us . " [She]53-eunice had gone out to buy some fruit and flowers for [Philip]47-philip . [The doctor]162-the doctor accepted [his]47-philip disappointment resignedly . "[53-eunice] Let [us]3260-us try what [we]3260-us can do without [her]53-eunice , " [he]162-the doctor said . "[53-eunice] [[That young man]780-that young man 's master]3262-that young man 's master has been in consultation [you]140-miss jillgall may remember why with [[his]3262-that young man 's master lawyer]5836-his lawyer , and [Helena]52-helena may be threatened by an investigation before [the magistrates]4333-the magistrates . If this wild guess of [mine]419-doctor turns out to have hit the mark , [the poisoner]3169-the poisoner [upstairs]3864-upstairs has got a warning . " [I]3169-the poisoner asked if [the chemist]5821-the chemist had written the note . Foolish enough of [me]3169-the poisoner when [I]3169-the poisoner came to think of it . [The chemist]5821-the chemist would scarcely act a friendly part toward [Helena]52-helena , when [she]52-helena was answerable for the awkward position in which [he]5821-the chemist had placed [himself]5821-the chemist . Perhaps [the young man who had left the warning]5880-the young man who had left the warning was also [the writer of the warning]5881-the writer of the warning . [The doctor]162-the doctor reminded [me]3169-the poisoner that [he]162-the doctor was all but [a stranger to [Helena]52-helena]5883-a stranger to helena . "[3169-the poisoner] [We]3267-we are not usually interested , " [he]162-the doctor remarked , "[3267-we] in [a person whom [we]3267-we only know by sight]3268-a person whom we only know by sight . " "[3268-a person whom we only know by sight] Remember that [he]3268-a person whom we only know by sight is [a young man]1228-a young man , " [I]3268-a person whom we only know by sight ventured to say . This was a strong hint , but [the doctor]162-the doctor failed to see it . [He]162-the doctor had evidently forgotten [his]162-the doctor own youth . [I]3268-a person whom we only know by sight made another attempt . "[3268-a person whom we only know by sight] And vile as [Helena]52-helena is , " [I]1228-a young man continued , "[1228-a young man] [we]3267-we can not deny that this disgrace to [her]52-helena sex is [a handsome young lady]3270-a handsome young lady . " [He]162-the doctor saw it at last . "[3271-woman] [Woman]3271-woman 's wit ! " [he]162-the doctor cried . "[3271-woman] [You]3272-you have hit it , [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall . [The young fool]3273-the young fool is smitten with [her]52-helena , and has given [her]52-helena a chance of making [her]52-helena escape . " "[3273-the young fool] Do [you]3272-you think [she]52-helena will take the chance ? " "[52-helena] For all [our]3267-we sakes , [I]0-i pray God [she]52-helena may ! But [I]0-i do n't feel sure about it . " "[0-i] Why ? " "[3272-you] Recollect what [you]3272-you and [Eunice]53-eunice have done . [You]3272-you have shown [your]3272-you suspicion of [her]52-helena without an attempt to conceal it . If [you]3272-you had put [her]52-helena in [prison]243-prison [you]3272-you could not have more completely defeated [her]52-helena infernal design . Do [you]3272-you think [she]52-helena is [a likely person to submit to that]3275-a likely person to submit to that , without an effort to be even with [you]3272-you ? " Just as [he]0-i said those terrifying words , [Maria]64-maria came back to [us]5885-us . [He]0-i asked at once what had kept [her]52-helena so long [upstairs]3864-upstairs . [The girl]377-the girl had evidently something to say , which had inflated [her]52-helena if [I]3272-you may use such an expression with a sense of [her]52-helena own importance . "[3272-you] Please to let [me]0-i tell it , [sir]3443-sir , " [she]52-helena answered , "[0-i] in [my]0-i own way . [Miss Helena]52-helena turned as pale as ashes when [she]52-helena opened the letter , and then [she]52-helena took a turn in [the room]3541-the room , and then [she]52-helena looked at [me]0-i with a smile - well , [miss]4033-miss , [I]0-i can only say that [I]0-i felt that smile in the small of [my]0-i back . [I]0-i tried to get to the door . [She]52-helena stopped [me]0-i . [She]52-helena says : ' Where 's [Miss Eunice]53-eunice ? ' [I]0-i says : ' Gone out . ' [She]52-helena says : ' Is there [anybody]3926-anybody in [the drawing - room]4218-the drawing - room ? ' [I]0-i says : ' No , [miss]4033-miss . ' [She]52-helena says : ' Tell [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall [I]0-i want to speak to [her]52-helena , and say [I]0-i am waiting in [the drawing - room]4218-the drawing - room . ' It 's every word of it true ! And , if [a poor servant]5871-a poor servant may give an opinion , [I]0-i do n't like the look of it . " [The doctor]162-the doctor dismissed [Maria]64-maria . "[0-i] Whatever it is , " [he]162-the doctor said to [me]0-i , "[0-i] [you]0-i must go and hear it . " [I]0-i am not [a courageous woman]5889-a courageous woman ; [I]0-i expressed [myself]0-i as being willing to go to [her]64-maria , if [the doctor]162-the doctor went with [me]0-i . [He]162-the doctor said that was impossible ; [she]64-maria would probably refuse to speak before [any witness]5891-any witness ; and certainly before [him]162-the doctor . But [he]162-the doctor promised to look after [Philip]47-philip in [my]0-i absence , and to wait below if it really so happened that [I]0-i wanted [him]47-philip . [I]0-i need only ring the bell , and [he]162-the doctor would come to [me]0-i the moment [he]162-the doctor heard it . Such kindness as this roused [my]0-i courage , [I]0-i suppose . At any rate , [I]0-i went [upstairs]3864-upstairs . [She]64-maria was standing by [the fire - place]5893-the fire - place , with [her]64-maria elbow on the chimney - piece , and [her]64-maria head , resting on [her]64-maria hand . [I]0-i stopped just inside the door , waiting to hear what [she]64-maria had to say . In this position [her]64-maria side - face only was presented to [me]0-i . It was a ghastly face . The eye that [I]0-i could see turned wickedly on [me]0-i when [I]0-i came in - then turned away again . Otherwise , [she]64-maria never moved . [I]0-i confess [I]0-i trembled , but [I]0-i did [my]0-i best to disguise it . [She]64-maria broke out suddenly with what [she]64-maria had to say : "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't allow this state of things to go on any longer . [My]0-i horror of an exposure which will disgrace [the family]550-the family has kept [me]0-i silent , wrongly silent , so far . [Philip]47-philip 's life is in danger . [I]0-i am forgetting [my]0-i duty to [[my]0-i affianced husband]3285-my affianced husband , if [I]0-i allow [myself]0-i to be kept away from [him]47-philip any longer . Open those locked doors , and relieve [me]0-i from the sight of [you]3286-you . Open the doors , [I]0-i say , or [you]3286-you will both of [you]3286-you - [you]3286-you [the accomplice]3287-the accomplice , [she]3288-she [the wretch who directs [you]3286-you]3289-the wretch who directs you - repent it to the end of [your]3286-you lives . " In [my]0-i own mind , [I]0-i asked [myself]0-i if [she]3286-you had gone mad . But [I]0-i only answered : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't understand [you]3286-you . " [She]3286-you said again : "[0-i] [You]3286-you are [[Eunice]53-eunice 's accomplice]3290-eunice 's accomplice . " "[53-eunice] Accomplice in what ? " [I]53-eunice asked . [She]3286-you turned [her]3286-you head slowly and faced [me]53-eunice . [I]53-eunice shrank from looking at [her]3286-you . "[53-eunice] All the circumstances prove it , " [she]3286-you went on . "[53-eunice] [I]0-i have supplanted [Eunice]53-eunice in [Philip]47-philip 's affection . [She]53-eunice was once engaged to marry [him]47-philip ; [I]0-i am engaged to marry [him]47-philip now . [She]53-eunice is resolved that [he]47-philip shall never make [me]0-i [[his]47-philip wife]174-his wife . [He]47-philip will die if [I]0-i delay any longer . [He]47-philip will die if [I]0-i do n't crush [her]53-eunice , like the reptile [she]53-eunice is . [She]53-eunice comes here - and what does [she]53-eunice do ? Keeps [him]47-philip prisoner under [her]53-eunice own superintendence . Who gets [his]47-philip medicine ? [She]53-eunice gets it . Who cooks [his]47-philip food ? [She]53-eunice cooks it . The doors are locked . [I]0-i might be [a witness of what goes on]3292-a witness of what goes on ; and [I]0-i am kept out . [The servants who ought to wait on [him]47-philip]3293-the servants who ought to wait on him are kept out . [She]53-eunice can do what [she]53-eunice likes with [his]47-philip medicine ; [she]53-eunice can do what [she]53-eunice likes with [his]47-philip food : [she]53-eunice is infuriated with [him]47-philip for deserting [her]53-eunice , and promising to marry [me]0-i . Give [him]47-philip back to [my]0-i care ; or , dreadful as it is to denounce [[my]0-i own sister]1627-my own sister , [I]0-i shall claim protection from [the magistrates]4333-the magistrates . " [I]4333-the magistrates lost all fear of [her]3944-your sister : [I]4333-the magistrates stepped close up to the place at which [she]3944-your sister was standing ; [I]4333-the magistrates cried out : "[4333-the magistrates] Of what , in [God]38-god 's name , do [you]0-i accuse [[your]0-i sister]3944-your sister ? " [She]3944-your sister answered : "[0-i] [I]0-i accuse [her]3944-your sister of poisoning [Philip Dunboyne]47-philip . " [I]0-i ran out of [the room]3541-the room ; [I]0-i rushed headlong down [the stairs]1016-the stairs . [The doctor]162-the doctor heard [me]0-i , and came running into [the hall]1431-the hall . [I]0-i caught hold of [him]162-the doctor like [a madwoman]5898-a madwoman . "[0-i] [Euneece]77-euneece ! " [My]77-euneece breath was gone ; [I]77-euneece could only say : "[77-euneece] [Euneece]77-euneece ! " [He]162-the doctor dragged [me]77-euneece into [the dining - room]1663-the dining - room . There was wine on the side - board , which [he]162-the doctor had ordered medically for [Philip]47-philip . [He]162-the doctor forced [me]77-euneece to drink some of it . It ran through [me]77-euneece like fire ; it helped [me]77-euneece to speak . "[77-euneece] Now tell [me]0-i , " [he]162-the doctor said , "[3297-she] what has [she]3297-she done to [Eunice]53-eunice ? " "[3297-she] [She]3297-she brings a horrible accusation against [her]53-eunice , " [I]3297-she answered . "[3297-she] What is the accusation ? " [I]3297-she told [him]162-the doctor . [He]162-the doctor looked [me]3297-she through and through . "[3297-she] Take care ! " [he]162-the doctor said . "[3297-she] No hysterics , no exaggeration . [You]3298-you may lead to dreadful consequences if [you]3298-you are not sure of [yourself]3298-you . If it 's really true , say it again . " [I]0-i said it again - quietly this time . [His]162-the doctor face startled [me]0-i ; it was white with rage . [He]162-the doctor snatched [his]162-the doctor hat off the hall table . "[0-i] What are [you]0-i going to do ? " [I]0-i asked . "[0-i] [My]0-i duty . " [He]162-the doctor was out of [the house]314-the house before [I]0-i could speak to [him]162-the doctor again . Third Period concluded . TROUBLES AND TRIUMPHS OF [THE FAMILY]550-the family , RELATED BY [THE GOVERNOR]148-the governor . CHAPTER LXII . THE SENTENCE PRONOUNCED . [MARTYRS to gout]5903-martyrs to gout know , by sad experience , that [they]5903-martyrs to gout suffer under one of the most capricious of maladies . An attack of this disease will shift , in the most unaccountable manner , from one part of the body to another ; or , it will release [the victim]4921-the victim when there is every reason to fear that it is about to strengthen its hold on [him]4921-the victim ; or , having shown the fairest promise of submitting to medical treatment , it will cruelly lay [the patient]5905-the patient prostrate again in a state of relapse . Adverse fortune , in [my]0-i case , subjected [me]0-i to this last and worst trial of endurance . Two months passed - months of pain aggravated by anxiety - before [I]0-i was able to help [Eunice]53-eunice and [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall personally with [my]0-i sympathy and advice . During this interval , [I]0-i heard regularly from [the friendly and faithful Selina]140-miss jillgall . Terror and suspense , courageously endured day after day , seem to have broken down [her]140-miss jillgall resistance , poor soul , when [Eunice]53-eunice 's good name and [Eunice]53-eunice 's tranquillity were threatened by the most infamous of false accusations . From that time , [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall 's method of expressing [herself]140-miss jillgall betrayed a gradual deterioration . [I]0-i shall avoid presenting at a disadvantage [a correspondent who has claims on [my]0-i gratitude]5906-a correspondent who has claims on my gratitude , if [I]0-i give the substance only of what [she]140-miss jillgall wrote - assisted by the newspaper which [she]140-miss jillgall sent to [me]0-i , while the legal proceedings were in progress . Honest indignation does sometimes counsel [us]5907-us wisely . When [the doctor]162-the doctor left [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall , in anger and in haste , [he]162-the doctor had determined on taking the course from which , as [a humane man]5909-a humane man and [a faithful friend]5910-a faithful friend , [he]162-the doctor had hitherto recoiled . It was no time , now , to shrink from the prospect of an exposure . The one hope of successfully encountering the vindictive wickedness of [Helena]52-helena lay in the resolution to be beforehand with [her]52-helena , in the appeal to [the magistrates with which [she]52-helena had threatened [Eunice]53-eunice and [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall]5911-the magistrates with which she had threatened eunice and miss jillgall . [The doctor]162-the doctor 's sworn information stated the whole terrible case of the poisoning , ranging from [his]162-the doctor first suspicions and [their]5911-the magistrates with which she had threatened eunice and miss jillgall confirmation , to [Helena]52-helena 's atrocious attempt to accuse [[her]52-helena innocent sister]5913-her innocent sister of [her]52-helena own guilt . So firmly were [the magistrates]4333-the magistrates convinced of the serious nature of the case thus stated , that [they]4333-the magistrates did not hesitate to issue [their]4333-the magistrates warrant . Among [the witnesses whose attendance was immediately secured]5915-the witnesses whose attendance was immediately secured , by [the legal adviser to whom [the doctor]162-the doctor]5916-the legal adviser to whom the doctor applied , were [the farmer]2250-the farmer and [[his]2250-the farmer wife]174-his wife . [Helena]52-helena was arrested while [she]52-helena was dressing to go out . [Her]52-helena composure was not for a moment disturbed . "[0-i] [I]0-i was on [my]0-i way , " [she]52-helena said coolly , "[0-i] to make a statement before [the justices]1148-the justices . The sooner [they]1148-the justices hear what [I]0-i have to say the better . " The attempt of [this shameless wretch]5920-this shameless wretch to "[1148-the justices] turn the tables " on poor [Eunice]53-eunice - suggested , as [I]1148-the justices afterward discovered , by the record of family history which [she]52-helena had quoted in [her]52-helena journal - was defeated with ease . [The farmer]2250-the farmer and [[his]2250-the farmer wife]174-his wife proved the date at which [Eunice]53-eunice had left [[her]53-eunice place of residence]5923-her place of residence under [[their]5924-their roof]5925-their roof . [The doctor]162-the doctor 's evidence followed . [He]162-the doctor proved , by the production of [his]162-the doctor professional diary , that the discovery of the attempt to poison [[his]162-the doctor patient]2413-his patient had taken place before the day of [Eunice]53-eunice 's departure from [the farm]2245-the farm , and that the first improvement in [Mr. Philip Dunboyne]47-philip 's state of health had shown itself after [that young lady]5929-that young lady 's arrival to perform the duties of [a nurse]3646-a nurse . To the wise precautions which [she]52-helena had taken - perverted by [Helena]52-helena to the purpose of a false accusation - [the doctor]162-the doctor attributed the preservation of [the young man]4367-the young man 's life . Having produced the worst possible impression on the minds of [the magistrates]4333-the magistrates , [Helena]52-helena was remanded . [[Her]52-helena legal adviser]5934-her legal adviser had predicted this result ; but the vindictive obstinacy of [[his]162-the doctor client]5935-his client had set both experience and remonstrance at defiance . At the renewed examination , the line of defense adopted by [[the prisoner]158-the prisoner 's lawyer]5937-the prisoner 's lawyer proved to be - mistaken identity . It was asserted that [she]52-helena had never entered [[the chemist]5821-the chemist 's shop]3254-the chemist 's shop ; also , that [the assistant]5828-the assistant had wrongly identified [some other lady]5941-some other lady as [Miss Helena Gracedieu]52-helena ; also , that there was not an atom of evidence to connect [her]52-helena with the stealing of [the doctor]162-the doctor 's prescription - paper and the forgery of [his]162-the doctor writing . Other assertions to the same purpose followed , on which it is needless to dwell . The case for [the prosecution]5943-the prosecution was , happily , in competent hands . With the exception of [one witness]5944-one witness , cross - examination afforded no material help to the evidence for [the defense]5945-the defense . [The chemist]5821-the chemist swore positively to the personal appearance of [Helena]52-helena , as being the personal appearance of [the lady who had presented the prescription]5947-the lady who had presented the prescription . [[His]5821-the chemist assistant]5827-his assistant , pressed on the question of identity , broke down under cross - examination - purposely , as it was whispered , serving the interests of [the prisoner]158-the prisoner . But the victory , so far gained by [the defense]5945-the defense , was successfully contested by the statement of [the next witness]5951-the next witness , [a respectable tradesman in [the town]205-the town]5952-a respectable tradesman in the town . [He]5951-the next witness had seen the newspaper report of the first examination , and had volunteered to present [himself]5951-the next witness as [a witness]227-a witness . [A member of [[Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu 's congregation]5956-mr. gracedieu 's congregation]5955-a member of mr. gracedieu 's congregation , [[his]5951-the next witness pew]5957-his pew in [the chapel]5958-the chapel was so situated as to give [him]5951-the next witness a view of [[the minister]161-the minister 's daughters]5960-the minister 's daughters occupying [[their]161-the minister pew]5961-their pew . [He]5951-the next witness had seen [the prisoner]158-the prisoner on every Sunday , for years past ; and [he]5951-the next witness swore that [he]5951-the next witness was passing the door of [[the chemist]5821-the chemist 's shop]3254-the chemist 's shop , at the moment when [she]158-the prisoner stepped out into [the street]670-the street , having a bottle covered with the customary white paper in [her]158-the prisoner hand . [The doctor]162-the doctor and [[his]162-the doctor servant]5839-his servant were [the next witnesses called]5968-the next witnesses called . [They]5968-the next witnesses called were severely cross - examined . Some of [their]5968-the next witnesses called statements - questioned technically with success - received unexpected and powerful support , due to the discovery and production of [the prisoner]158-the prisoner 's diary . The entries , guardedly as some of them were written , revealed [her]158-the prisoner motive for attempting to poison [Philip Dunboyne]47-philip ; proved that [she]158-the prisoner had purposely called on [the doctor]162-the doctor when [she]158-the prisoner knew that [he]162-the doctor would be out , that [she]158-the prisoner had entered [the consulting - room]5746-the consulting - room , and examined the medical books , had found to use [her]158-the prisoner own written words "[1148-the justices] a volume that interested [her]3300-her , " and had used the prescription - papers for the purpose of making notes . The notes themselves were not to be found ; they had doubtless been destroyed . Enough , and more than enough , remained to make the case for [the prosecution]5943-the prosecution complete . [The magistrates]4333-the magistrates committed [Helena Gracedieu]52-helena for trial at the next assizes . [I]1148-the justices arrived in [the town]205-the town , as well as [I]1148-the justices can remember , about a week after the trial had taken place . Found guilty , [the prisoner]158-the prisoner had been recommended to mercy by [the jury]5976-the jury - partly in consideration of [her]158-the prisoner youth ; partly as an expression of sympathy and respect for [[her]158-the prisoner unhappy father]5259-her unhappy father . [The judge]184-the judge [a father]475-a father [himself]475-a father passed a lenient sentence . [She]52-helena was condemned to imprisonment for two years . [The careful matron of [the jail]217-the jail]5980-the careful matron of the jail had provided [herself]5980-the careful matron of the jail with a bottle of smelling - salts , in the fear that there might be need for it when [Helena]52-helena heard [her]52-helena sentence pronounced . Not the slightest sign of agitation appeared in [her]52-helena face or [her]52-helena manner . [She]52-helena lied to [the last]5982-the last ; asserting [her]52-helena innocence in a firm voice , and returning from [the dock]5983-the dock to [the prison]147-the prison without requiring assistance from [anybody]3926-anybody . Relating these particulars to [me]1148-the justices , in a state of ungovernable excitement , good [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall ended with a little confession of [her]140-miss jillgall own , which operated as a relief to [my]1148-the justices overburdened mind after what [I]1148-the justices had just heard . "[1148-the justices] [I]0-i would n't own it , " [she]140-miss jillgall said , "[0-i] to [anybody]3926-anybody but [a dear friend]3302-a dear friend . One thing , in the dreadful disgrace that has fallen on [us]3303-us , [I]0-i am quite at a loss to account for . Think of [[Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu 's daughter]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter being [one of those criminal creatures on whom it was once [your]3306-your terrible duty to turn the key]3305-one of those criminal creatures on whom it was once your terrible duty to turn the key ! Why did n't [she]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter commit suicide ? " "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear lady]1960-my dear lady , [no thoroughly wicked creature]3308-no thoroughly wicked creature ever yet committed suicide . Self - destruction , when it is not an act of madness , implies some acuteness of feeling - sensibility to remorse or to shame , or perhaps a distorted idea of making atonement . There is no such thing as remorse or shame , or hope of making atonement , in [Helena]52-helena 's nature . " "[5373-mr. governor] But when [she]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter comes out of [prison]243-prison , what will [she]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter do ? " "[5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter] Do n't alarm [yourself]3306-your , [[my]0-i good friend]1997-my good friend . [She]5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter will do very well . " "[5016-mr. gracedieu 's daughter] Oh , hush ! hush ! Poetical justice , [Mr. Governor]5373-mr. governor ! " "[5373-mr. governor] Poetical fiddlesticks , [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall . " CHAPTER LXIII . THE OBSTACLE REMOVED . When the subject of the trial was happily dismissed , [my]140-miss jillgall first inquiry related to [Eunice]53-eunice . The reply was made with an ominous accompaniment of sighs and sad looks . [Eunice]53-eunice had gone back to [her]53-eunice duties as [governess at [the farm]2245-the farm]5986-governess at the farm . Hearing this , [I]140-miss jillgall asked naturally what had become of [Philip]47-philip . Melancholy news , again , was the news that [I]140-miss jillgall now heard . [Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip [the elder]3966-the elder had died suddenly , at [[his]47-philip house in [Ireland]7-ireland]5989-his house in ireland , while [Philip]47-philip was on [his]47-philip way [home]258-home . When the funeral ceremony had come to an end , the will was read . It had been made only a few days before [the testator]5991-the testator 's death ; and the clause which left all [his]0-i property to [[his]0-i son]3903-his son was preceded by expressions of paternal affection , at a time when [Philip]47-philip was in sore need of consolation . After alluding to a letter , received from [[his]0-i son]3903-his son , [the old man]5994-the old man added : "[140-miss jillgall] [I]0-i always loved [him]3312-him , without caring to confess it ; [I]0-i detest scenes of sentiment , kissings , embracings , tears , and that sort of thing . But [Philip]47-philip has yielded to [my]0-i wishes , and has broken off a marriage which would have made [him]47-philip , as well as [me]0-i , wretched for life . After this , [I]0-i may speak [my]0-i mind from [my]0-i grave , and may tell [[my]0-i boy]3899-my boy that [I]0-i loved [him]3312-him . If the wish is likely to be of any use , [I]0-i will add on the chance - [God]38-god bless [him]47-philip . " "[38-god] Does [Philip]47-philip submit to separation from [Eunice]53-eunice ? " [I]47-philip asked . "[47-philip] Does [he]47-philip stay in [Ireland]7-ireland ? " "[47-philip] Not [he]47-philip , [poor fellow]1882-poor fellow ! [He]47-philip will be here to - morrow or next day . When [I]0-i last wrote , " [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall continued , "[0-i] [I]0-i told [him]47-philip [I]0-i hoped to see [you]3315-you again soon . If [you]3315-you ca n't help [us]3316-us [I]0-i mean with [Eunice]53-eunice that [unlucky young man]3317-unlucky young man will do some desperate thing . [He]47-philip will join [those madmen at large who disturb poor savages in [Africa]32-africa]3318-those madmen at large who disturb poor savages in africa , or go nowhere to find nothing in [the Arctic regions]3319-the arctic regions . " Whatever [I]0-i can do , [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall , shall be gladly done . Is it really possible that [Eunice]53-eunice refuses to marry [him]47-philip , after having saved [his]47-philip life ? "[0-i] " A little patience , please , [Mr. Governor]43-mr. governor ; let [Philip]47-philip tell [his]47-philip own story . If [I]161-the minister try to do it , [I]161-the minister shall only cry - and [we]5995-we have had tears enough lately , in [this house]731-this house . "[161-the minister] Further consultation being thus deferred , [I]0-i went [upstairs]3864-upstairs to [[the Minister]161-the minister 's room]1922-the minister 's room . [He]161-the minister was sitting by the window , in [his]161-the minister favorite armchair , absorbed in knitting ! [The person who attended on [him]161-the minister]3323-the person who attended on him , [a good - natured , patient fellow]3324-a good - natured , patient fellow , had been [a sailor]3325-a sailor in [his]3325-a sailor younger days , and had taught [Mr. Gracedieu]63-mr. gracedieu how to use the needles . " [You]0-i see it amuses [him]161-the minister , "[3581-the man] [the man]3581-the man said , kindly . " Do n't notice [his]161-the minister mistakes , [he]161-the minister thinks there is n't such another in [the world]364-the world for knitting as [himself]161-the minister . [You]0-i can see , [sir]3443-sir , how [he]161-the minister sticks to it . "[3581-the man] [He]161-the minister was so absorbed over [his]161-the minister employment that [I]0-i had to speak to [him]161-the minister twice , before [I]0-i could induce [him]161-the minister to look at [me]0-i . The utter ruin of [his]161-the minister intellect did not appear to have exercised any disastrous influence over [his]161-the minister bodily health . On the contrary , [he]161-the minister had grown fatter since [I]0-i had last seen [him]161-the minister ; [his]161-the minister complexion had lost the pallor that [I]0-i remembered - there was color in [his]161-the minister cheeks . " Do n't [you]161-the minister remember [[your]161-the minister old friend]4772-your old friend ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . [He]161-the minister smiled , and nodded , and repeated the words : " Yes , yes , [[my]161-the minister old friend]4756-my old friend . "[161-the minister] It was only too plain that [he]161-the minister had not the least recollection of [me]0-i . " [His]161-the minister memory is gone , "[3581-the man] [the man]3581-the man said . " When [he]161-the minister puts away [his]161-the minister knitting , at night , [I]3581-the man have to find it for [him]161-the minister in the morning . But , there ! [he]161-the minister 's happy - enjoys [his]161-the minister victuals , likes sitting out in [the garden]637-the garden and watching the birds . There 's been a deal of trouble in [the family]550-the family , [sir]3443-sir ; and it has all passed over [him]161-the minister like a wet sponge over a slate . "[3581-the man] [The old sailor]3328-the old sailor was right . If [that wreck of [a man]3697-a man]3329-that wreck of a man had been capable of feeling and thinking , [[his]161-the minister daughter]944-his daughter 's disgrace would have broken [his]161-the minister heart . In a world of sin and sorrow , is peaceable imbecility always to be pitied ? [I]0-i have known men who would have answered , without hesitation : " It is to be envied . "[3332-some persons] And where [some persons]3332-some persons might say was [the poor Minister]3693-the poor minister 's reward for the act of mercy which had saved [Eunice]53-eunice in [her]53-eunice infancy ? Where it ought to be ! [A man who worthily performs a good action]3334-a man who worthily performs a good action finds [his]3334-a man who worthily performs a good action reward in the action itself . At breakfast , on the next day , the talk touched on those passages in [Helena]52-helena 's diary , which had been produced in [court]3335-court as evidence against [her]52-helena . [I]0-i expressed a wish to see what revelation of a depraved nature the entries in the diary might present ; and [my]0-i curiosity was gratified . At a fitter time , [I]0-i may find an opportunity of alluding to the impression produced on [me]0-i by the diary . In the meanwhile , the event of [Philip]47-philip 's return claims notice in the first place . [The poor fellow]3336-the poor fellow was so glad to see [me]0-i that [he]3336-the poor fellow shook hands as heartily as if [we]3337-we had known [each other]3725-each other from the time when [he]3336-the poor fellow was [a boy]4076-a boy . " Do [you]0-i remember how kindly [you]0-i spoke to [me]3336-the poor fellow when [I]3336-the poor fellow called on [you]0-i in [London]3-london ? "[3336-the poor fellow] [he]3336-the poor fellow asked . " If [I]3336-the poor fellow have repeated those words once - but perhaps [you]0-i do n't remember them ? The time passed - and [I]0-i could arrive at no positive conclusion . Either way - with or without [Philip]47-philip - the contemplation of [Eunice]53-eunice 's future harassed [me]0-i with doubt . The chances , either way , were perhaps equal . The deed was done . CHAPTER LXIV . THE TRUTH TRIUMPHANT . [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen had again appeared on the scene ! [She]53-eunice had written to [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall , from [Paris]33-paris , to say that [she]53-eunice had heard of [old Mr. Dunboyne]47-philip 's death , and that [she]53-eunice wished to have the letter returned , which [she]53-eunice had left for delivery to [[Philip]47-philip 's father]825-philip 's father on the day when [Philip]47-philip and [Eunice]53-eunice were married . [My]0-i misgivings , thus excited , were increased by more news of no very welcome kind . [Mrs. Tenbruggen]49-mrs. tenbruggen had decided on returning to [her]49-mrs. tenbruggen professional pursuits in [England]4-england . [Massage]128-massage , now [the fashion everywhere]3403-the fashion everywhere , had put money into [her]49-mrs. tenbruggen pocket among [the foreigners]3404-the foreigners ; and [[her]49-mrs. tenbruggen husband]168-her husband , finding that [she]49-mrs. tenbruggen persisted in keeping out of [his]168-her husband reach , had consented to a compromise . [[Our]3430-our married pair]3431-our married pair live now on [the paternal estate in [Ireland]7-ireland]3432-the paternal estate in ireland ; and [Miss Jillgall]140-miss jillgall reigns [queen of domestic affairs]3433-queen of domestic affairs . [I]0-i am still strong enough to pass [my]0-i autumn holidays in [that pleasant house]3434-that pleasant house . At times , [my]0-i memory reverts to [Helena Gracedieu]52-helena , and to what [I]0-i discovered when [I]0-i had seen [her]52-helena diary . How little [I]0-i knew of [that terrible creature]3435-that terrible creature when [I]0-i first met with [her]3435-that terrible creature , and fancied that [she]3435-that terrible creature had inherited [[her]3435-that terrible creature mother]3501-her mother 's character ! It was weak indeed to compare the mean vices of [Mrs. Gracedieu]98-mrs. gracedieu with the diabolical depravity of [[her]98-mrs. gracedieu daughter]3437-her daughter . Here the doctrine of hereditary transmission of moral qualities must own that it has overlooked the fertility for growth of good and for growth of evil equally which is inherent in human nature . There are virtues that exalt [us]3438-us , and vices that degrade [us]3438-us , whose mysterious origin is , not in [[our]3438-us parents]3439-our parents , but in [ourselves]3438-us . Here is an extract : " [This eminent lady]6082-this eminent lady , the victim of a shocking miscarriage of justice in [England]4-england , is now [the distinguished leader of [a new community in [the United States]6085-the united states]6084-a new community in the united states]6083-the distinguished leader of a new community in the united states . [We]6086-we hail in [her]6082-this eminent lady the great intellect which asserts the superiority of [woman]3271-woman over [man]2586-man . In the first French Revolution , the attempt made by [men]1581-men to found a rational religion met with only temporary success . It was reserved for the mightier spirit of [woman]3271-woman to lay the foundations more firmly , and to dedicate one of [the noblest edifices in [this city]6092-this city]6091-the noblest edifices in this city to the Worship of Pure Reason .
